Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Health, pursuant to subsection 30(1)a of the Food and Drugs Actb, subsection 55(1)c of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Actd and subsection 139(1) and section 161 of the Cannabis Acte, makes the annexed Cannabis Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in the Act and in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: cannabis beverage means edible cannabis that is intended to be consumed by drinking and has a concentration of 3% w/w or less of THC, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC. (boisson de cannabis)
cannabis concentrate means a substance that has a concentration of greater than 3% w/w of THC, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC. (cannabis sous forme de concentré)
cannabis extract means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a substance produced by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subjecting anything referred to in item 1 of Schedule 1 to the Act to extraction processing, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: synthesizing a substance that is identical to a phytocannabinoid produced by, or found in, a cannabis plant; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a substance or mixture of substances that contains or has on it a substance produced in a manner referred to in paragraph (a).

ContinuedDefinition.Text: It does not include a cannabis topical or edible cannabis. (extrait de cannabis)

Definition.Text: cannabis topical means a substance or mixture of substances that contains or has on it anything referred to in item 1 or 3 of Schedule 1 to the Act and that is intended for use, directly or indirectly, exclusively on external body surfaces, including hair and nails. (cannabis pour usage topique)

edible cannabis means a substance or mixture of substances that contains or has on it anything referred to in item 1 or 3 of Schedule 1 to the Act and that is intended to be consumed in the same manner as food. It does not include dried cannabis, fresh cannabis, cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds. (cannabis comestible)
fresh cannabis means freshly harvested cannabis leaves, flowers or buds, but does not include plant material that can be used to propagate cannabis. (cannabis frais)

non-solids containing cannabis means substances that are in non-solid form at a temperature of 22 ± 2°C and that have a concentration of 3% w/w or less of THC, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC. (substances qui ne sont pas solides et qui contiennent du cannabis)

solids containing cannabis means substances that are in solid form at a temperature of 22 ± 2°C and that have a concentration of 3% w/w or less of THC, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC. (solides qui contiennent du cannabis)

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the Cannabis Act. (Loi)
cannabis drug licence means a licence for a drug containing cannabis. (Version anglaise seulement)

cannabis product means cannabis of only one of the classes set out in Schedule 4 to the Act — or a cannabis accessory that contains such cannabis — after it has been packaged and labelled for sale to a consumer at the retail level. It does not include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cannabis that is intended for an animal;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a cannabis accessory that contains cannabis that is intended for an animal; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a drug containing cannabis. (produit du cannabis)

Definition.Text: CBD means cannabidiol. (CBD)
CBDA means cannabidiolic acid. (ACBD)
client means, in respect of a holder of a licence for sale for medical purposes, an individual who is registered with that holder of the licence under subsection 282(1). (client)

combination product means a product, consisting of a device and a prescription drug, for which a drug identification number has been assigned under subsection C.01.014.2(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (produit mixte)
common-law partner means an individual who is cohabiting with an individual in a conjugal relationship, having done so for a period of at least one year. (conjoint de fait)
constituent means an individual unit of food that is combined as an individual unit of food with one or more other individual units of food to form an ingredient. (constituant)

contaminated means, in respect of cannabis, a cannabis accessory or an ingredient, containing or having on it anything — including a micro-organism but excluding anything referred to in item 1 or 3 of Schedule 1 to the Act — that may render the cannabis, cannabis accessory or ingredient injurious to human health or unsuitable for human use. (contaminé)
controlled substance offence means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an offence under Part I of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act, except subsection 4(1) of that Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a conspiracy or an attempt to commit, being an accessory after the fact in relation to, or any counselling in relation to, an offence referred to in paragraph (a). (infraction relative à une substance désignée)

Definition.Text: cultivation waste means cannabis leaves, shoots or branches that are obtained during the cultivation, propagation or harvesting of cannabis and that are intended for destruction. (déchet de culture)
device has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Food and Drugs Act. (instrument)
drug has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Food and Drugs Act, but excludes cannabis that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a natural health product to which the Natural Health Products Regulations apply; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: manufactured or sold — within the meaning of section 2 of the Food and Drugs Act — and is not represented, for use in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the diagnosis, treatment, mitigation or prevention of a disease, disorder or abnormal physical state, or its symptoms, in human beings, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: restoring, correcting or modifying organic functions in human beings.

ContinuedDefinition.Text: It includes cannabis that is an active pharmaceutical ingredient as defined in subsection C.01A.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. It also includes cannabis that is manufactured or sold for use in a clinical trial as defined in section C.05.001 of those Regulations that is not non-therapeutic research on cannabis. (drogue)

Definition.Text: durable life means the period, commencing on the day on which a cannabis product is packaged for sale to a consumer at the retail level, during which the product, when it is stored under conditions appropriate to that product, will retain, without any appreciable deterioration, normal palatability and any other qualities claimed for it by the holder of a licence for processing that manufactured the product. (durée de conservation)
durable life date means the date on which the durable life of a cannabis product ends. (date limite de conservation)
export permit means a permit issued under subsection 62(1) of the Act that authorizes the exportation of cannabis for medical or scientific purposes. (permis d’exportation)
fish has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations. (poisson)
food has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Food and Drugs Act. (aliment)

food additive means any substance the use of which results, or may reasonably be expected to result, in it or its by-products becoming a part of, or affecting the characteristics of, a food or edible cannabis, but does not include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: anything referred to in item 1 or 3 of Schedule 1 to the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: anything that is excluded from the definition food additive in subsection B.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (additif alimentaire)

Definition.Text: former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations means the regulations made by Order in Council P.C. 2016-743 of August 5, 2016 and registered as SOR/2016-230. (ancien Règlement sur l’accès au cannabis à des fins médicales)
former Industrial Hemp Regulations means the regulations made by Order in Council P.C. 1998-352 of March 12, 1998 and registered as SOR/98-156. (ancien Règlement sur le chanvre industriel)
grow area means, in respect of a site set out in a licence, an area of the site where cannabis plants are cultivated, harvested or propagated. (zone de culture)
hospital means, except in Part 8, a facility

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is licensed, approved or designated by a province under the laws of the province to provide care or treatment to individuals suffering from any form of disease or illness; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is owned or operated by the Government of Canada or the government of a province and that provides health services. (hôpital)

Definition.Text: immediate container means a container that is in direct contact with cannabis or a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product or, if a wrapper is in direct contact with the cannabis or the cannabis accessory, with the wrapper. (contenant immédiat)
import permit means a permit issued under subsection 62(1) of the Act that authorizes the importation of cannabis for medical or scientific purposes. (permis d’importation)
ingestion includes absorption in the mouth. (ingestion)
ingredient means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a cannabis extract or a cannabis topical, a substance, other than anything referred to in item 1 or 3 of Schedule 1 to the Act, that is used to produce the cannabis extract or cannabis topical, including any substance used in the manufacture of that substance, and that is present in the final form of the cannabis extract or cannabis topical; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of edible cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a substance, other than anything referred to in item 1 or 3 of Schedule 1 to the Act,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: that is used to produce the edible cannabis if the use of the substance results, or may reasonably be expected to result, in the substance or its by-products becoming a part of, or affecting the characteristics of, the edible cannabis, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: that is part of a mixture of substances referred to in item 2 of that Schedule that is used to produce the edible cannabis if the use of the mixture results, or may reasonably be expected to result, in the substance or its by-products becoming a part of, or affecting the characteristics of, the edible cannabis, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a mixture of substances, other than anything referred to in item 1 or 3 of Schedule 1 to the Act,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: that is used to produce the edible cannabis if the use of the mixture results, or may reasonably be expected to result, in the mixture or its by-products becoming a part of, or affecting the characteristics of, the edible cannabis, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: that is part of a mixture of substances referred to in item 2 of that Schedule that is used to produce the edible cannabis if the use of the latter mixture results, or may reasonably be expected to result, in the former mixture or its by-products becoming a part of, or affecting the characteristics of, the edible cannabis. (ingrédient)

Definition.Text: licence means a licence issued under subsection 62(1) of the Act in relation to cannabis. (licence)
Lists of Permitted Food Additives has the same meaning as in subsection B.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (Listes des additifs alimentaires autorisés)
meat product has the same meaning as in subsection B.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (produit de viande)

mineral nutrient has the same meaning as in subsection D.02.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations except that it does not include sodium, potassium or chloride or compounds that include those elements. (minéral nutritif)

non-therapeutic research on cannabis means research that involves the distribution of cannabis to human participants by the holder of a licence for research and that is not a clinical trial as defined in section C.05.001 of the Food and Drug Regulations for which the sale of cannabis is authorized in accordance with section C.05.006 of those Regulations. This definition does not include research

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: related to the diagnosis, treatment, mitigation or prevention of a disease, disorder or abnormal physical state, or its symptoms, or the restoration or correction of organic functions, in human beings or animals;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: involving the distribution of cannabis that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: represented for use in the diagnosis, treatment, mitigation or prevention of a disease, disorder or abnormal physical state, or its symptoms, or the restoration or correction of organic functions, in human beings or animals,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: manufactured or sold by any person other than a licence holder referred to in paragraph 2(a) of the Cannabis Exemption (Food and Drugs Act) Regulations for use in the diagnosis, treatment, mitigation or prevention of a disease, disorder or abnormal physical state, or its symptoms, or in the restoration or correction of organic functions, in human beings or animals,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: referred to in any of paragraphs 1(b) to (d) of the Cannabis Exemption (Food and Drugs Act) Regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: referred to in paragraph 1(f) of the Cannabis Exemption (Food and Drugs Act) Regulations in respect of an experimental study as defined in subsection C.08.013(2) of the Food and Drug Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: involving the distribution of cannabis that contains any substance that is referred to in column 1 of Schedule 5 to the Act and that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of cannabis that is a cannabis product or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product, does not meet the requirements set out in subsection 101.3(5.1) or (6) or section 101.31, 102.2 or 102.3, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of any other cannabis, would not meet the requirements set out in subsection 101.3(5.1) or (6) or section 101.31, 102.2 or 102.3 if it were a cannabis product or if it were contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: involving the participation of, or relating to, a young person. (recherche non thérapeutique sur le cannabis)

Definition.Text: operations area means, in respect of a site set out in a licence, an area of the site — other than a storage area — where cannabis is present as a result of any activities conducted under a licence. It includes a grow area. (zone d’exploitation)
pest control product has the same meaning as in subsection 2(1) of the Pest Control Products Act. (produit antiparasitaire)
pharmacist means an individual who is entitled under the laws of a province to practise pharmacy and who is practising pharmacy in that province. (pharmacien)
point means the unit of measurement for type size that is known as a PostScript point and is equal to 0.3527777778 mm. (point)

potential to convert CBDA into CBD means the maximum amount of CBD that would be obtained if CBDA was converted into CBD with no further degradation of CBD. (potentiel de transformation de l’ACBD en CBD)

potential to convert THCA into THC means the maximum amount of THC that would be obtained if THCA was converted into THC with no further degradation of THC. (potentiel de transformation de l’ATHC en THC)
poultry product has the same meaning as in subsection B.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (produit de volaille)
prescription has the same meaning as in subsection C.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (ordonnance)
prescription drug means a drug

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that contains cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is a prescription drug, as defined in section A.01.010 of the Food and Drug Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for which a drug identification number has been assigned under subsection C.01.014.2(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (drogue sur ordonnance)

Definition.Text: proper name has the same meaning as in subsection C.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (nom propre)

reference standard means a standardized form of cannabis that is intended to be used as a measurement base when testing a substance to confirm its identity, concentration, quality or purity for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose. (étalon de référence)

security clearance means, except in paragraph 53(2)(g), a security clearance granted by the Minister under section 67 of the Act and includes, for the purpose of paragraph 53(2)(e), a security clearance granted under section 112 of the former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations. (habilitation de sécurité)
site means, in respect of a holder of a licence, an area that is used exclusively by the holder and that consists of at least one building or one part of a building. (lieu)
storage area means, in respect of a site set out in a licence, an area of the site where cannabis is stored. (zone d’entreposage)
sugars has the same meaning as in subsection B.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (sucres)
test kit means a kit

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that contains

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: cannabis, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a reagent system or buffering agent, or both;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is designed to be used during the course of a chemical or analytical procedure to test for the presence or quantity of cannabis for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the contents of which are not intended or likely to be consumed or administered. (nécessaire d’essai)

Definition.Text: THC means delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol. (THC)
THCA means delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinolic acid. (ATHC )
vitamin, except in subsection 101.3(3), has the same meaning as in subsection D.01.002(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (vitamine)

water activity, except in section 102.5, means the ratio of the water vapour pressure of a meat product, poultry product or fish to the vapour pressure of pure water, at the same temperature and pressure. (activité de l’eau)

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of the incorporation by reference into these Regulations of any documents published by the Government of Canada, terms that are used but not defined in those documents have the same meaning as in these Regulations.

For the purposes of these Regulations, a cannabis accessory that contains edible cannabis in liquid form at a temperature of 22 ± 2°C and that is a cannabis product is deemed to be an immediate container.

Section.Text: These Regulations do not apply to a holder of a licence that is subject to the Industrial Hemp Regulations, or to an applicant for such a licence.

Section.MarginalNote: Non-application — holder of cannabis drug licence
Section.Text: Subsection 10(1), sections 29 to 48 and Parts 5 and 7 do not apply to a holder of a cannabis drug licence referred to in Part 8, or to an applicant for such a licence.

Section.MarginalNote: Authorized activities — federal or provincial laboratory

Subsection.Text: Individuals who are involved in the testing of cannabis as a requirement of their duties at a laboratory that is operated by the Government of Canada or the government of a province are authorized to conduct the following activities:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to the extent necessary to conduct the testing,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to possess cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: to obtain cannabis by altering its chemical or physical properties by any means,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of seed viability testing, to obtain cannabis by cultivating it, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: to distribute cannabis to any of the following:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: a holder of a licence for analytical testing,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: an individual referred to in subsection (4), or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: other individuals who are involved in the testing of cannabis as a requirement of their duties at a laboratory that is operated by the Government of Canada or the government of a province;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of producing reference standards or manufacturing or assembling test kits, to produce cannabis, other than obtain it by cultivating, propagating or harvesting it; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to sell or distribute reference standards to any of the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for cultivation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for processing,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for research,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for analytical testing,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a cannabis drug licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: an individual referred to in subsection (4),

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person to which an exemption has been granted under section 140 of the Act in relation to the cannabis or the class of cannabis that is distributed, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: other individuals who are involved in the testing of cannabis as a requirement of their duties at a laboratory that is operated by the Government of Canada or the government of a province.

Subsection.Text: An individual who conducts an activity referred to in subparagraph (1)(a)(ii) or (iii) or paragraph (1)(b) is also authorized to offer to conduct that activity.

An individual who conducts an activity referred to in subparagraph (1)(a)(ii) or paragraph (1)(b) is also authorized to alter or offer to alter the chemical or physical properties of cannabis by the use of an organic solvent when conducting that activity.

An individual who is involved in the testing of cannabis as a requirement of their duties at a laboratory that is designated as an accredited laboratory under section 2.1 of the Seeds Act is authorized to conduct the activities referred to in subparagraphs (1)(a)(i), (iii) and (iv), and to offer to conduct the activity referred to in subparagraph (1)(a)(iii), to the extent necessary to conduct the testing.

Section.Text: An individual is authorized to distribute cannabis to a holder of a licence for analytical testing if the quantity of cannabis does not exceed the equivalent of 30 g of dried cannabis, as determined in accordance with subsection 2(4) of the Act.
For the purposes of subsection 34(1) of the Act,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a licence for processing that authorizes the sale of cannabis may, in accordance with the licence, sell edible cannabis that is not a cannabis product and that contains caffeine if the caffeine has been introduced through the use of ingredients that naturally contain caffeine; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the following persons may, in accordance with their licence or the provincial authorization, as the case may be, sell edible cannabis that is a cannabis product and that contains caffeine if the caffeine has been introduced through the use of ingredients that naturally contain caffeine and the total amount of caffeine in each immediate container of the cannabis product does not exceed 30 mg:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for processing that authorizes the sale of cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for sale that authorizes the sale of cannabis products, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person that is authorized under a provincial Act referred to in subsection 69(1) of the Act to sell cannabis.

Section.MarginalNote: Sale of cannabis containing ethyl alcohol

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 34(1) of the Act,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a licence for processing that authorizes the sale of cannabis may, in accordance with the licence, sell a cannabis extract that is not a cannabis product and that contains ethyl alcohol; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the following persons may, in accordance with their licence or the provincial authorization, as the case may be, sell a cannabis extract that is a cannabis product and that contains ethyl alcohol if the cannabis extract is intended to be consumed by means of inhalation and meets the requirements set out in subsection 101.3(5.1) or if it is intended to be ingested and meets the requirements set out in subsection 101.3(6):

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for processing that authorizes the sale of cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for sale that authorizes the sale of cannabis products, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person that is authorized under a provincial Act referred to in subsection 69(1) of the Act to sell cannabis.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 34(1) of the Act,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a licence for processing that authorizes the sale of cannabis may, in accordance with the licence, sell a cannabis topical that is not a cannabis product and that contains denatured ethyl alcohol; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the following persons may, in accordance with their licence or the provincial authorization, as the case may be, sell a cannabis topical that is a cannabis product and that contains denatured ethyl alcohol:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for processing that authorizes the sale of cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for sale that authorizes the sale of cannabis products; and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person that is authorized under a provincial Act referred to in subsection 69(1) of the Act to sell cannabis.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 34(1) of the Act,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a licence for processing that authorizes the sale of cannabis may, in accordance with the licence, sell edible cannabis that is not a cannabis product and that contains ethyl alcohol; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the following persons may, in accordance with their licence or the provincial authorization, as the case may be, sell edible cannabis that is a cannabis product and that contains ethyl alcohol if the concentration of ethyl alcohol does not exceed 0.5% w/w of the edible cannabis:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for processing that authorizes the sale of cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for sale that authorizes the sale of cannabis products, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person that is authorized under a provincial Act referred to in subsection 69(1) of the Act to sell cannabis.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 34(1) of the Act, the following persons are authorized to sell a reference standard that contains any substance that is referred to in column 1 of Schedule 5 to the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a licence for processing that authorizes the sale of cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a licence for analytical testing that authorizes the sale of cannabis; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the individuals referred to in section 4.

Section.Text: A person that is authorized under a provincial Act referred to in subsection 69(1) of the Act to sell cannabis must not sell a cannabis product that they know is the subject of a voluntary recall in Canada that has been commenced for reasons respecting

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the quality of the cannabis product; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicable requirements of Part 5 or 6 are otherwise not being met.

Section.Text: A reference standard must not be used as an ingredient, be included in a cannabis product or be packaged and labelled for sale to a consumer at the retail level.

Section.MarginalNote: Reference standards appealing to young persons
Section.Text: For the purposes of section 31 of the Act, the following persons are authorized to sell a reference standard even if it has an appearance, shape or other sensory attribute or a function that there are reasonable grounds to believe could be appealing to young persons:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a licence for processing that authorizes the sale of cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a licence for analytical testing that authorizes the sale of cannabis; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the individuals referred to in section 4.

Section.Text: In this Part, distribute does not include administering.

Subsection.Text: Before submitting an application to the Minister for a licence for cultivation, a licence for processing or a licence for sale that authorizes the possession of cannabis, the person that intends to submit the application must provide a written notice to the following authorities in the area in which the site referred to in the application is located:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the local government;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the local fire authority; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the local police force or the Royal Canadian Mounted Police detachment that is responsible for providing policing services to that area.

Subsection.Text: The notice must contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person’s name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the person expects to submit the application;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the class and the subclass of licence that will be sought, the activity that the person expects to conduct under the licence and an indication that the activity will be conducted in relation to cannabis; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the site where the person proposes to conduct the activities and, if applicable, of each building within the site.

Subsection.Text: The notice must be addressed to a senior official of the local authority to which it is provided.
In this section, local government includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an incorporated city, metropolitan area, town, village or other municipality;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an authority responsible for delivering municipal services that are related to the activities to be conducted under the licence to an unincorporated city, metropolitan area, town, village or other municipality;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a band, as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Indian Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a First Nation, Métis or Inuit government that is party to a self-government or land claims agreement that is given effect by an Act of Parliament, or a First Nation, Métis or Inuit government established under a provincial Act.

Subsection.Text: The following, among others, are established as classes of licences that authorize activities in relation to cannabis:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a licence for cultivation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a licence for processing;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a licence for analytical testing;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a licence for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a licence for research; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a cannabis drug licence.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), the licences referred to in paragraphs (1)(a), (b) and (d) authorize activities in relation to cannabis, other than a drug containing cannabis.
The following, among others, are established as subclasses of a licence for cultivation:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a licence for micro-cultivation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a licence for standard cultivation; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a licence for a nursery.

Subsection.Text: The following, among others, are established as subclasses of a licence for processing:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a licence for micro-processing; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a licence for standard processing.

Subsection.Text: A licence for sale for medical purposes is established as a subclass, among others, of a licence for sale.

Section.Text: A licence, other than a licence referred to in paragraph 8(1)(f), must set out the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the holder of the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the class of the licence and, if applicable, the subclass of the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the site where the activity is authorized and, if applicable, of each building within the site;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the authorized activity at the site and, if applicable, the authorized activity that may be conducted at each building within the site;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any conditions that the Minister considers appropriate;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry of the licence.

Subsection.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a holder of a licence that authorizes the possession of cannabis must only possess cannabis that was obtained in accordance with the former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations, the former Industrial Hemp Regulations or the Industrial Hemp Regulations or that is obtained in accordance with these Regulations or from a person that is authorized under a provincial Act referred to in subsection 69(1) of the Act to sell cannabis.

A holder of a licence for cultivation is authorized to possess cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds that were not obtained in accordance with subsection (1) if the holder had submitted to the Minister, with the licence application, a declaration, signed and dated by the individual who signed and dated the application, indicating the quantity of such cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds that they will have in their possession on the effective date of the licence.
The quantity of cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds that the holder is authorized to possess under subsection (2) must be equal to the amount indicated in the declaration.

Heading.TitleText: Licences for Micro-cultivation and Standard Cultivation

Subsection.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a holder of a licence for micro-cultivation or standard cultivation is authorized to conduct those of the following activities that are authorized by the licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to possess cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to obtain dried cannabis, fresh cannabis, cannabis pollen, cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds by cultivating, propagating and harvesting cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of testing, to obtain cannabis by altering its chemical or physical properties by any means; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: to sell cannabis.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for micro-cultivation or standard cultivation that is authorized to conduct the activity referred to in paragraph (1)(b) is also authorized to offer to conduct that activity.

A holder of a licence for micro-cultivation or standard cultivation that is authorized to conduct the activity referred to in paragraph (1)(b) is also authorized, to the extent necessary to conduct that activity, to conduct ancillary activities such as drying, trimming and milling cannabis.

A holder of a licence for micro-cultivation or standard cultivation that is authorized to conduct the activity referred to in paragraph (1)(c) is also authorized to alter the chemical or physical properties of cannabis by the use of an organic solvent when conducting that activity.
A holder of a licence for micro-cultivation or standard cultivation whose licence authorizes the sale of cannabis is authorized to conduct the following activities:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to sell and distribute dried cannabis, fresh cannabis, cannabis pollen, cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds to any of the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for micro-cultivation or standard cultivation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for processing,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for analytical testing,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for research,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a cannabis drug licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person to which an exemption has been granted under section 140 of the Act in relation to the cannabis or class of cannabis that is sold or distributed; or

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the individuals referred to in section 4;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to sell and distribute cannabis pollen, cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds to a holder of a licence for a nursery;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to sell and distribute cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds, that are cannabis products, to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for sale, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person that is authorized under a provincial Act referred to in subsection 69(1) of the Act to sell cannabis; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: to send and deliver cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds, that are cannabis products, to the purchaser of the products at the request of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a person that is authorized under a provincial Act referred to in subsection 69(1) of the Act to sell cannabis, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for sale.

Subsection.Text: If a holder of a licence for micro-cultivation or standard cultivation sends or delivers cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds under subparagraph (5)(d)(ii) the sale of such products under section 289, the holder must send or deliver the products to the client’s shipping address as indicated by the holder of a licence for sale for medical purposes.
A holder of a licence for micro-cultivation or standard cultivation must retain the services of one individual as a master grower.

The master grower is responsible for the cultivation, propagation and harvesting of cannabis and must have sufficient knowledge of the provisions of the Act and these Regulations in relation to those activities.
A holder of a licence for micro-cultivation or standard cultivation may designate one individual as the alternate master grower who is qualified to replace the master grower.
A holder of a licence for micro-cultivation

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: must clearly delineate a surface area that does not exceed 800 m2 in which all the cannabis plants, including all the parts of the plants, must be contained; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: must cultivate, propagate or harvest cannabis plants only from that surface area.

Subsection.Text: If the surface area referred to in paragraph (1)(a) consists of multiple surfaces, such as surfaces arranged above one another, the area of each surface must be included in the calculation of the total surface area.
Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a holder of a licence for a nursery is authorized to conduct those of the following activities that are authorized by the licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to possess cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to obtain cannabis pollen, cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds by cultivating, propagating and harvesting cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of testing, to obtain cannabis by altering its chemical or physical properties by any means; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: to sell cannabis.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for a nursery that is authorized to conduct the activity referred to in paragraph (1)(b) is also authorized to offer to conduct that activity.

A holder of a licence for a nursery that is authorized to conduct the activity referred to in paragraph (1)(b) is also authorized, to the extent necessary to conduct that activity, to conduct ancillary activities such as drying cannabis.

A holder of a licence for a nursery that is authorized to conduct the activity referred to in paragraph (1)(c) is also authorized to alter the chemical or physical properties of cannabis by the use of an organic solvent when conducting that activity.
A holder of a licence for a nursery whose licence authorizes the sale of cannabis is authorized to conduct the following activities:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to sell and distribute cannabis pollen, cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds to any of the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for cultivation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for processing,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for analytical testing,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for research,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a cannabis drug licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person to which an exemption has been granted under section 140 of the Act in relation to the cannabis or class of cannabis that is sold or distributed, or

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the individuals referred to in section 4;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to sell and distribute cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds, that are cannabis products, to the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for sale, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person that is authorized under a provincial Act referred to in subsection 69(1) of the Act to sell cannabis; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to send and deliver cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds, that are cannabis products, to the purchaser of the products at the request of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a person that is authorized under a provincial Act referred to in subsection 69(1) of the Act to sell cannabis, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for sale.

Subsection.Text: If a holder of a licence for a nursery sends or delivers cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds under subparagraph (5)(c)(ii) further to the sale of such products under section 289, the holder must send or deliver the products to the client’s shipping address as indicated by the holder of a licence for sale for medical purposes.
A holder of a licence for a nursery must retain the services of one individual as a master grower.

The master grower is responsible for the cultivation, propagation and harvesting of cannabis and must have sufficient knowledge of the provisions of the Act and these Regulations in relation to those activities.
A holder of a licence for a nursery may designate one individual as the alternate master grower who is qualified to replace the master grower.
A holder of a licence for a nursery that cultivates cannabis for the purpose of obtaining cannabis plant seeds must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: clearly delineate a total surface area that does not exceed 200 m2 in which all the budding or flowering cannabis plants, including all the parts of those plants, must be contained;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not possess more than 20 kg of flowering heads harvested from the plants referred to in paragraph (a), with the exception of the cannabis plant seeds; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: destroy the flowering heads — with the exception of the cannabis plant seeds — leaves and branches of the plants referred to in paragraph (a) within 30 days of harvesting them.

Subsection.Text: If the surface area referred to in paragraph (1)(a) consists of multiple surfaces, such as surfaces arranged above one another, the area of each surface must be included in the calculation of the total surface area.

Section.MarginalNote: Authorized activities — licence for standard processing

Subsection.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a holder of a licence for standard processing is authorized to conduct those of the following activities that are authorized by the licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to possess cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to produce cannabis, other than obtain it by cultivating, propagating or harvesting it; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to sell cannabis.

Subsection.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a holder of a licence for micro-processing is authorized to conduct those of the following activities that are authorized by the licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to possess cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to produce cannabis, other than obtain it by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: synthesis, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: cultivating, propagating or harvesting it; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to sell cannabis.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for micro-processing or standard processing that is authorized to conduct the activity referred to in paragraph (1)(b) or (2)(b) is also authorized to offer to obtain cannabis by any method authorized by the licence.

A holder of a licence for micro-processing or standard processing that is authorized to conduct the activity referred to in paragraph 1(b) or (2)(b) is also authorized to alter or offer to alter the chemical or physical properties of cannabis by the use of an organic solvent when conducting that activity.
A holder of a licence for micro-processing or standard processing whose licence authorizes the sale of cannabis is authorized to conduct the following activities:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to sell and distribute cannabis to any of the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for processing,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for analytical testing,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for research,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a cannabis drug licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a person to which an exemption has been granted under section 140 of the Act in relation to the cannabis or a class of cannabis that is sold or distributed, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the individuals referred to in section 4;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to sell and distribute the following to a holder of a licence for micro-cultivation or standard cultivation:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: dried cannabis, fresh cannabis, cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: reference standards;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to sell and distribute the following to a holder of a licence for a nursery:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: reference standards;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: to sell and distribute cannabis products to the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for sale, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person that is authorized under a provincial Act referred to in subsection 69(1) of the Act to sell cannabis; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: to send and deliver cannabis products to the purchaser of the products at the request of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a person that is authorized under a provincial Act referred to in subsection 69(1) of the Act to sell cannabis, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for sale.

Subsection.Text: If a holder of a licence for micro-processing or standard processing sends or delivers cannabis products under subparagraph (5)(e)(ii) further to the sale of such products under section 289, the holder must send or deliver the products to the client’s shipping address as indicated by the holder of a licence for sale for medical purposes.

A holder of a licence for processing must retain the services of one individual as a quality assurance person who has the training, experience and technical knowledge related to the requirements of Parts 5 and 6 that are applicable to the class of cannabis in respect of which activities are conducted under the licence.

Despite subsection (1), if the quality assurance person does not have the training, experience and technical knowledge related to the requirements of Parts 5 and 6 that are applicable to edible cannabis, the holder of a licence for processing that conducts activities in respect of that class of cannabis must retain the services of another individual who has that training, experience and technical knowledge.
The quality assurance person is responsible for

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: assuring the quality of the cannabis before it is made available for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: investigating every complaint received in respect of the quality of the cannabis and, if necessary, immediately taking measures to mitigate any risk; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if they suspect, on reasonable grounds, that the cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient presents a risk of injury to human health or that the applicable requirements of Part 5 or 6 are otherwise not being met, immediately investigating the matter and, if necessary, immediately taking measures to mitigate any risk.

Subsection.Text: The holder of a licence for processing may designate one or more individuals as alternate quality assurance persons who are qualified to replace the quality assurance person.
Subsections (1) to (3) do not apply in respect of a reference standard or a test kit.
A holder of a licence for processing must obtain the Minister’s approval before

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: designating or replacing an alternate quality assurance person; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: replacing the quality assurance person by an individual, other than by the alternate quality assurance person.

Subsection.Text: The holder of a licence for processing must, for the purpose of obtaining the Minister’s approval, submit an application that includes the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and date of birth of the proposed alternate quality assurance person or the proposed quality assurance person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the proposed quality assurance person’s or the proposed alternate quality assurance person’s qualifications in respect of the matters referred to in subsection 19(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration, signed and dated by the responsible person referred to in section 37, indicating that all information provided in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of their knowledge.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on receiving an application for approval, require the submission of any additional information that pertains to the information contained in the application and that is necessary for the Minister to consider the application.

A holder of a licence for micro-processing must not possess, in a calendar year, cannabis of one or more classes of cannabis — other than cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds — that has been sold or distributed to them, the total amount of which, as determined in accordance with the table to this section, is equivalent to more than 2,400 kg of dried cannabis.

The cannabis referred to in subsection (1) is exempt from the application of subsection 2(4) of the Act and a quantity referred to in column 2 of the table to this section in respect of any class of cannabis referred to in column 1 is deemed to be equivalent to 1 kg of dried cannabis.
Subsection (1) does not apply if the holder also holds a licence for micro-cultivation in relation to the same site and the cannabis that is sold or distributed to them is exclusively from that site.

row.entry: Amount that is equivalent to 1 kg of dried cannabis

Subsection.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a holder of a licence for analytical testing is authorized to conduct those of the following activities that are authorized by the licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of testing,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to possess cannabis, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: to obtain cannabis by altering its chemical or physical properties by any means;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of producing reference standards or manufacturing or assembling test kits, to produce cannabis, other than obtain it by cultivating, propagating or harvesting it; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to sell cannabis.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for analytical testing that is authorized to conduct the activity referred to in subparagraph (1)(a)(ii) or paragraph (1)(b) is also authorized to offer to conduct that activity.

A holder of a licence for analytical testing that is authorized to conduct the activity referred to in subparagraph (1)(a)(ii) or paragraph (1)(b) is also authorized to alter or offer to alter the chemical or physical properties of cannabis by the use of an organic solvent when conducting that activity.

A holder of a licence for analytical testing is also authorized, for the purpose of testing, to distribute cannabis to another holder of a licence for analytical testing or the individuals referred to in section 4.
A holder of a licence for analytical testing whose licence authorizes the sale of cannabis is authorized to sell and distribute reference standards to any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a licence for cultivation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a licence for processing;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a licence for research;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: another holder of a licence for analytical testing;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a cannabis drug licence;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the individuals referred to in section 4;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a person to which an exemption has been granted under section 140 of the Act in relation to the cannabis or class of cannabis that is sold or distributed.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for analytical testing must retain the services of one individual as the head of laboratory who must work at the site set out in the licence and who is responsible for the testing referred to in sections 90 to 91.1.
The head of laboratory must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: have sufficient knowledge of the provisions of the Act and these Regulations that apply to the holder of the licence for analytical testing to properly carry out the duties of the position;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: have knowledge and experience relevant to the duties of the position; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: hold

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a diploma, certificate or credential awarded by a post-secondary educational institution in Canada in a field or occupation that is relevant to the duties of the position, such as chemistry, biology, pharmaceutical or scientific regulatory affairs, laboratory management or laboratory technician, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a diploma, certificate or credential awarded by a foreign educational institution in a field or occupation referred to in subparagraph (i) and

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: an equivalency assessment as defined in subsection 73(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: an equivalency assessment issued by an organization or institution that is responsible for issuing equivalency assessments and is recognized by a province.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for analytical testing may designate one or more individuals as the alternate heads of laboratory who are qualified to replace the head of laboratory.
A holder of a licence for analytical testing must obtain the Minister’s approval before

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: designating or replacing an alternate head of laboratory; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: replacing the head of laboratory by an individual, other than by an alternate head of laboratory.

Subsection.Text: The holder of a licence for analytical testing must, for the purpose of obtaining the Minister’s approval, submit an application that includes the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and date of birth of the proposed alternate head of laboratory or the proposed head of laboratory;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the proposed head of laboratory’s or the proposed alternate head of laboratory’s qualifications in respect of the matters referred to in subsection 23(2); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration, signed and dated by the responsible person referred to in section 37, indicating that all information provided in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of their knowledge.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on receiving an application for approval, require the submission of any additional information that pertains to the information contained in the application and that is necessary for the Minister to consider the application.

A holder of a licence for analytical testing must destroy the sample of a lot or batch of cannabis that has been distributed to them, and all cannabis obtained from that sample, within 90 days after completing the testing of the sample of the lot or batch.

If testing of the sample of a lot or batch of cannabis distributed to the holder of the licence for analytical testing is not initiated within 120 days of its receipt, the holder must, by the end of that period, either destroy the sample or distribute it to another holder of a licence for analytical testing or to the individuals referred to in section 4.

Heading.TitleText: Licence for Sale for Medical Purposes

Section.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a holder of a licence for sale for medical purposes is authorized to conduct those of the following activities that are authorized by the licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to possess cannabis products; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to sell cannabis products.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), a holder of a licence for sale for medical purposes that authorizes the sale of cannabis products is authorized to sell or distribute

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cannabis products to any of the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence, other than a licence for cultivation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person to which an exemption has been granted under section 140 of the Act in relation to the cannabis or class of cannabis that is, or is contained in, a cannabis product that is sold or distributed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: dried cannabis, fresh cannabis, cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds, that are cannabis products, to a holder of a licence for micro-cultivation or standard cultivation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds, that are cannabis products, to a holder of a licence for a nursery; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: cannabis products, other than cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds, to a hospital employee if the employee’s possession of the cannabis product is for the purpose of, and in connection with, their duties.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for sale for medical purposes must sell the cannabis products referred to in subsection (1) in the packaging in which they were sold or distributed to the holder.
Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a holder of a licence for research is authorized to conduct those of the following activities, that are authorized by the licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of research,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to possess cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: to produce cannabis, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: to transport, send or deliver cannabis between the sites that are set out by the licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to sell cannabis pollen, cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds to any of the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for cultivation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: another holder of a licence for research,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for analytical testing,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a cannabis drug licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the individuals referred to in section 4,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person to which an exemption has been granted under section 140 of the Act in relation to the cannabis or class of cannabis that is sold.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for research that is authorized to conduct the activity referred to in subparagraph (1)(a)(ii) is also authorized to offer to obtain cannabis by any method authorized by the licence.

A holder of a licence for research that is authorized to obtain cannabis by altering its chemical or physical properties by any means is also authorized to alter or offer to alter its chemical or physical properties by the use of an organic solvent when conducting that activity.
A holder of a licence for research is also authorized, for the purpose of research, to administer and distribute cannabis to a research subject.
A holder of a licence for research is also authorized to distribute

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cannabis to any of the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: another holder of a licence for research,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for analytical testing,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a cannabis drug licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the individuals referred to in section 4, or

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cannabis pollen, cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds to the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a holder of a licence for cultivation, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person to which an exemption has been granted under section 140 of the Act in relation to the cannabis or class of cannabis that is distributed.

Section.MarginalNote: Research not involving human participants or animals

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), a person, other than a young person, may conduct research on cannabis without a licence for research if the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: possesses, for the purpose of research, a total quantity of cannabis that does not exceed the equivalent of 30 g of dried cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: does not administer or distribute cannabis to a human participant or to an animal; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: does not conduct the research within a dwelling-house or at an address specified in a registration certificate issued under subsection 313(1).

Subsection.Text: The person is authorized, to the extent necessary to conduct the research,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to possess cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to produce cannabis, other than obtain it by cultivating, propagating or harvesting it; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to distribute cannabis to a holder of a licence for analytical testing or a holder of a licence for research.

Subsection.Text: A person that is authorized to conduct the activity referred to in paragraph (2)(b) is also authorized to alter or to offer to alter the chemical or physical properties of cannabis by the use of an organic solvent when conducting that activity.

The requirements of Part 6, other than those set out in subsection 102(6), apply to the following cannabis or cannabis accessory that is administered or distributed to a human participant in the conduct of non-therapeutic research on cannabis as if the cannabis or cannabis accessory were a cannabis product or will become one:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cannabis that is not a cannabis product or is contained in a cannabis accessory that is not a cannabis product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a cannabis accessory that contains cannabis and that is not a cannabis product.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), any reference in Part 6 to subsection 97(1) or (2) should be read as a reference to paragraph (3)(a) or (b), respectively.

Cannabis that is not a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is not a cannabis product — and that is administered or distributed by the holder of a licence for research to human participants in the conduct of non-therapeutic research on cannabis must not contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a cannabis extract or a cannabis topical, less than 85% or more than 115% of the quantity or concentration of THC or CBD represented by the holder in the application for the licence, or for its renewal or amendment, related to that research; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of edible cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the quantity of THC or CBD that is represented by the holder in the application exceeds 5 mg, less than 85% or more than 115% of that quantity,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the quantity of THC or CBD that is represented by the holder in the application exceeds 2 mg but does not exceed 5 mg, less than 80% or more than 120% of that quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the quantity of THC or CBD that is represented by the holder in the application does not exceed 2 mg, less than 75% or more than 125% of that quantity.

Subsection.Text: The holder of a licence for research that administers or distributes edible cannabis to human participants in the conduct of non-therapeutic research on cannabis must ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a meat product, poultry product or fish, other than a food additive, was not used as an ingredient to produce the edible cannabis, and was not a constituent of such an ingredient, unless the meat product, poultry product or fish

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: was produced by a person that is authorized to produce it under the laws of a province or the Safe Food for Canadians Act or was imported in accordance with that Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: had a water activity that did not exceed 0.85 at a temperature of 22 ± 2°C at the time the meat product, poultry product or fish was obtained by the holder that produced the edible cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: food that was produced by a holder of a licence for research and that was used by that holder as an ingredient to produce the edible cannabis, or as a constituent of such an ingredient, was not a meat product, poultry product or fish, and the sale of the food would not have been prohibited under section 4 of the Food and Drugs Act;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a food additive was not used as an ingredient to produce the edible cannabis unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the edible cannabis would be a food that is set out in column 3 of the Lists of Permitted Food Additives if the edible cannabis did not contain or have on it anything referred to in item 1 or 3 of Schedule 1 to the Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the food additive is set out in column 1 and is not caffeine or caffeine citrate,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the food additive is obtained from any corresponding source set out in column 2,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the food additive is used for any corresponding purpose of use set out in column 4,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount of the food additive does not exceed

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: any corresponding maximum level of use and any corresponding maximum level of residue set out in column 5, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the amount that is required to accomplish the purpose for which it is added, in the case where the words “Good Manufacturing Practice” appear in column 5 for that food additive in the food, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: any other corresponding condition set out in column 5 is met; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the edible cannabis was not irradiated unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the edible cannabis would be a food that is listed in item 3 or 4, column 1, of the table to Division 26 of Part B of the Food and Drug Regulations if the edible cannabis did not contain or have on it anything that is referred to in item 1 or 3 of Schedule 1 to the Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the licence holder that produced the edible cannabis satisfied the requirements set out in paragraphs B.26.003(2)(a) and (b) and subsection B.26.004(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations in respect of the edible cannabis.

Subsection.Text: If the conditions set out in subparagraphs (4)(c)(i) to (vi) are met, the holder of a licence for research whose licence authorizes the production of cannabis may use a vitamin or mineral nutrient as an ingredient to produce edible cannabis that is administered or distributed to a human participant in the conduct of non-therapeutic research on cannabis and that is not a cannabis product or is contained in a cannabis accessory that is not a cannabis product.

Section.Text: The holder of a licence for research that administers or distributes irradiated edible cannabis to human participants in the conduct of non-therapeutic research on cannabis must ensure that the requirement set out in subsection 42(1) has been met in addition to the conditions set out in paragraph 28.1(4)(d).

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subparagraph 9(1)(a)(i) or (iii) of the Act, a human participant to whom cannabis was distributed in the conduct of non-therapeutic research on cannabis is authorized to return the cannabis to the holder of the licence for research from which the cannabis was received.
The participant who is returning cannabis under subsection (1) must, if they are sending or having delivered a total quantity of cannabis that exceeds the equivalent of 30 g of dried cannabis,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prepare the parcel in a manner that ensures the security of its contents, such that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it will not open or permit the escape of its contents during handling and transportation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it is sealed so that it cannot be opened without the seal being broken, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: it prevents its contents from being identified without it being opened; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: use a method that ensures the tracking and safekeeping of the parcel during transportation.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence for research that receives cannabis from a human participant under section 28.3 must retain a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the participant;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the location at which the cannabis is received and, if that location is different from the site or sites at which the cannabis was produced, the address of the site or sites, if known;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the cannabis is received;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis that is received;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the cannabis, including, if applicable, the brand name; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the lot or batch number of the cannabis.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence for research must destroy any cannabis that has been returned to them by a human participant under section 28.3 no later than 90 days after the day on which the non-therapeutic research on cannabis ends.

Section.MarginalNote: Refusal to issue, renew or amend — other grounds
Section.Text: For the purpose of paragraph 62(7)(h) of the Act, other grounds for refusing to issue, renew or amend a licence are the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who is required to hold a security clearance under section 50 in respect of an application does not hold such a security clearance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the renewal or amendment of a licence, the holder of the licence does not hold a cannabis licence issued under subsection 14(1.1) of the Excise Act, 2001, if it is required;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the issuance or amendment of a licence for cultivation, the site proposed in the application would be authorized by another licence for cultivation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the issuance or amendment of a licence for micro-cultivation, the site proposed in the application would be authorized by a licence for standard processing and a licence for micro-cultivation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the issuance or amendment of a licence for standard cultivation, the site proposed in the application would be authorized by a licence for micro-processing and a licence for standard cultivation;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the issuance or amendment of a licence for a nursery, the site proposed in the application would be authorized by a licence for processing and a licence for a nursery;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the issuance or amendment of a licence for processing, the site proposed in the application would be authorized by another licence for processing;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the issuance or amendment of a licence for processing, the site proposed in the application would be authorized by a licence for processing and a licence for a nursery;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the issuance or amendment of a licence for micro-processing, the site proposed in the application would be authorized by a licence for standard cultivation and a licence for micro-processing;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the issuance or amendment of a licence for standard processing, the site proposed in the application would be authorized by a licence for micro-cultivation and a licence for standard processing;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a licence for processing, the applicant has, in the past 10 years, been convicted of an offence under the Safe Food for Canadians Act or an Act referred to in subsection 374(2) of the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a licence for research that would authorize activities in relation to non-therapeutic research on cannabis, the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the use of the cannabis proposed in the application presents a risk of injury to the health of a human participant or other person that cannot reasonably be mitigated, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the objectives of the non-therapeutic research on cannabis that are set out in the application will not be achieved.

Section.Text: For the purpose of paragraph 64(1)(b) of the Act, other circumstances for the suspension of a licence are the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who is required to hold a security clearance under section 50 in respect of the licence does not hold such a security clearance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of a licence has failed to pay a fee in relation to the licence, or any other licence issued to that holder that is fixed by an order made under subsection 142(1) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of a licence has failed to submit to the Minister a statement of cannabis revenue in accordance with an order made under subsection 142(1) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of a licence does not hold a cannabis licence issued under subsection 14(1.1) of the Excise Act, 2001, if it is required;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the cannabis licence issued to the holder under subsection 14(1.1) of the Excise Act, 2001 is suspended under subsection 23(2) of that Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a licence for research that authorizes activities in relation to non-therapeutic research on cannabis, the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the use of the cannabis in the conduct of the non-therapeutic research on cannabis presents a risk of injury to the health of a human participant or other person that cannot reasonably be mitigated, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the objectives of the non-therapeutic research on cannabis will not be achieved.

Section.Text: For the purpose of paragraph 65(h) of the Act, other circumstances for the revocation of a licence are the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the licence has requested, in writing, the revocation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
