Paragraph.Text: the licence has been suspended and not reinstated because the reasons for the suspension still exist or the holder of the licence has not demonstrated to the Minister that the suspension is unfounded;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: since the issuance of the licence, a security clearance in respect of the licence has been refused;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the licence no longer holds the cannabis licence issued under subsection 14(1.1) of the Excise Act, 2001, if it is required;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a licence for processing, the holder has, since its issuance, been convicted of an offence under the Safe Food for Canadians Act or an Act referred to in subsection 374(2) of the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a licence for research that authorizes activities in relation to non-therapeutic research on cannabis, the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the use of the cannabis in the conduct of the non-therapeutic research on cannabis presents a risk of injury to the health of a human participant or other person that cannot reasonably be mitigated, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the objectives of the non-therapeutic research on cannabis will not be achieved.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence must submit an application for an amendment to the licence if they propose to make any of the following changes:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the name of the holder of the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the address of the site or building within the site where the activity is authorized; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the authorized activity at the site or the authorized activity that may be conducted at each building within the site.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence that proposes to make a change to the site plan that would require physical security measures to be carried out in order to comply with Part 4 must obtain the Minister’s approval before making the change.
The holder of a licence must, for the purpose of obtaining the Minister’s approval, submit an application that includes the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the change;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed site plan; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration, signed and dated by the responsible person referred to in section 37, indicating that all information provided in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of their knowledge.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on receiving an application for approval, require the submission of any additional information that pertains to the information contained in the application and that is necessary for the Minister to consider the application.
A holder of a licence must notify the Minister of any of the following changes within five days after the change occurs:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the mailing address, telephone number, email address or facsimile number of the holder;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the site plan, other than a change referred to in subsection 33(1);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the replacement of an individual who must hold a security clearance referred to in any of paragraphs 50(b) to (g), (i) and (j) or the addition of another such individual, other than an individual who is designated as an alternate for the position of quality assurance person referred to in section 19; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a holder of a licence for cultivation, a licence for processing or a licence for sale, a change to the organizational security plan.

Subsection.Text: The notification must include the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the change; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration, signed and dated by the responsible person referred to in section 37, indicating that all information provided in support of the notification is correct and complete to the best of their knowledge.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a change referred to in paragraph (1)(c), the notification must also include the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and date of birth of the individual who replaced an individual referred to in any of paragraphs 50(b) to (g), (i) and (j) or who was added as another such individual; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the individual replaced a director or officer referred to in subparagraph 50(b)(i) or (c)(i) or was added as such a director or officer, the certificate of incorporation or other amended incorporating instrument of the corporation or cooperative.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for cultivation, a licence for processing or a licence for sale that authorizes the possession of cannabis must, within 30 days after the issuance, amendment, suspension, reinstatement or revocation of the licence, provide a written notice to the local authorities referred to in paragraphs 7(1)(a) to (c) in the area in which the site set out in the licence is located and provide a copy of the notice to the Minister.
The notice must contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the holder of the licence and the address of the site set out in the licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the applicable event referred to in subsection (1) and its effective date and, in the case of an amendment to the licence, details of the amendment.

Subsection.Text: The notice must be addressed to a senior official of the local authority to which it is provided.

A holder of a licence that intends to cease conducting all the activities authorized by the licence — whether before or on the date of expiry of the licence — must provide the Minister with a written notice to that effect at least 30 days before the day on which those activities cease.
The notice must be signed and dated by the responsible person referred to in section 37 and contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which activities are expected to cease;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the manner in which any cannabis remaining at the site as of the date referred to in paragraph (a) will be disposed of by the holder of the licence, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the cannabis will be sold or distributed, in whole or in part, the name and address of the person to which it will be sold or distributed, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it will be destroyed, in whole or in part, the day on which and the location at which the destruction is to take place;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the location at which the holder’s records, reports, electronic data and other documents that are required to be retained under the Act by the holder will be retained after activities have ceased; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address, telephone number and, if applicable, facsimile number and email address of a person from which the Minister may obtain further information after activities have ceased.

Subsection.Text: After having ceased the activities, the holder must submit to the Minister an update of the information referred to in paragraphs (2)(a) to (d), if it differs from the information submitted in the notice under subsection (1). The update must be signed and dated by the responsible person referred to in section 37.

Heading.TitleText: General Requirements Relating to Authorized Activities

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence must retain the services of one individual as the responsible person who has the authority to bind the holder.

The responsible person is responsible for the activities conducted under the licence and must have sufficient knowledge of the provisions of the Act and these Regulations that apply to the holder of the licence.
A holder of a licence may designate one individual as the alternate responsible person who is qualified to replace the responsible person.
A holder of a licence, other than a licence for analytical testing or a licence for research, must retain the services of one individual as the head of security who is responsible for

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensuring that the applicable physical security measures set out in Part 4 are complied with; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the organizational security plan of the holder.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence, other than a licence for analytical testing or a licence for research, may designate one individual as the alternate head of security who is qualified to replace the head of security.
A holder of a licence must only conduct activities that are authorized by the licence at the site and, if applicable, the building within the site, set out in the licence.
Subsection (1) does not apply to the possession of cannabis for the purpose of antimicrobial treatment or destruction or the distribution of cannabis.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence must not conduct any activity that is authorized by the licence at a dwelling-house.
A holder of a licence must not produce cannabis — other than obtain cannabis by cultivating, propagating or harvesting it — or test, store, package or label cannabis outdoors.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence, other than a licence for analytical testing, may conduct antimicrobial treatment of cannabis at a location other than the site set out in the licence only if the cannabis is subsequently returned to the site set out in the licence or distributed in accordance with these Regulations.

For greater certainty, in the case of the irradiation of edible cannabis by a holder of a licence for processing, the requirement set out in subsection (1) applies in addition to the conditions set out in section 102.6.
A holder of a licence is authorized to destroy cannabis only

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with a method that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the location where it is to be destroyed, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: does not result in any individual being exposed to cannabis smoke or cannabis vapour;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the presence of at least one employee of the holder of the licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the cannabis is destroyed at a location other than the site set out in the licence, if the holder of the licence ensures that the cannabis that is at the location is, at all times, in the presence of at least one employee of the licence holder.

Subsection.Text: Paragraphs (1)(b) and (c) do not apply in cases where the holder of a licence destroys cultivation waste.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence, other than a holder of a licence for analytical testing or a licence for research, must on request of the Minister, update and submit the organizational security plan.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence, other than a licence for analytical testing, must establish and maintain a system of control that permits the rapid and complete recall of every lot or batch of cannabis that has been sold or distributed.
The holder must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at least once every 12 months, conduct a recall simulation based on the system of control;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: after completing the recall simulation, prepare a document that sets out the details of how it was conducted and the results; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: retain the document for at least two years after the day on which the recall simulation is completed.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence must take any steps that are necessary to ensure the safekeeping of cannabis when distributing it.

Section.MarginalNote: Identification of holder of a licence
Section.Text: A holder of a licence must include their name, as set out in the licence, in all the means by which they identify themself in relation to cannabis, including advertising, purchase orders, shipping documents and invoices.
The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: corporation does not include a federal or provincial Crown corporation. (personne morale)
partnership does not include an incorporated entity. (société de personnes)

Section.Text: The following individuals must hold a security clearance:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who holds a licence for cultivation, processing or sale;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a corporation that holds a licence for cultivation, processing or sale,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the directors and officers of the corporation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any individual who exercises, or is in a position to exercise, direct control over the corporation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the directors and officers of any corporation or cooperative that exercises, or is in a position to exercise, direct control over the corporation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any individual who is a partner in a partnership that exercises, or is in a position to exercise, direct control over the corporation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the directors and officers of any corporation that is a partner in a partnership that exercises, or is in a position to exercise, direct control over the corporation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a cooperative that holds a licence for cultivation, processing or sale,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the directors and officers of the cooperative,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any individual who exercises, or is in a position to exercise, direct control over the cooperative,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the directors and officers of any corporation or cooperative that exercises, or is in a position to exercise, direct control over the cooperative,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any individual who is a partner in a partnership that exercises, or is in a position to exercise, direct control over the cooperative, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the directors and officers of any corporation that is a partner in a partnership that exercises, or is in a position to exercise, direct control over the cooperative;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a partnership that holds a licence for cultivation, processing or sale,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any individual who is a partner,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the directors and officers of any corporation or cooperative that is a partner,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any individual who is a partner in a partnership that exercises, or is in a position to exercise, direct control over the partnership that holds the licence, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the directors and officers of any corporation that is a partner in a partnership that exercises, or is in a position to exercise, direct control over the partnership that holds the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a licence for cultivation, processing or sale, the responsible person referred to in section 37;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a licence for cultivation, processing or sale, the head of security referred to in section 38;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a licence for cultivation, the master grower referred to in section 12 or 15;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a licence for processing, the quality assurance person referred to in section 19;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who has been designated as an alternate for a position referred to in any of paragraphs (e) to (h); and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who has been specified by name by the Minister under subsection 67(2) of the Act or who occupies a position that has been specified by the Minister under that subsection.

Section.Text: Only the following individuals may submit an application for a security clearance:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who is required to hold a security clearance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who will be required to hold a security clearance if an application for a licence, or for its renewal or amendment, that has been filed with the Minister results in the issuance, renewal or amendment of the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who will be required to hold a security clearance if a pending business transaction is completed;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who has been selected for a position referred to in any of paragraphs 50(e) to (h) or as an alternate for such a position; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who has been selected for a position that has been specified by the Minister under subsection 67(2) of the Act or who has been notified that the Minister intends to specify them, by name or position, under that subsection.

Section.Text: The Minister may, at any time, conduct checks that are necessary to determine whether an applicant for, or the holder of, a security clearance poses a risk to public health or public safety, including the risk of cannabis being diverted to an illicit market or activity. Such checks include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a check of the applicant’s or holder’s criminal record; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a check of the relevant files of law enforcement agencies that relate to the applicant or holder, including intelligence gathered for law enforcement purposes.

Subsection.Text: Before granting a security clearance, the Minister must, taking into account any licence conditions that he or she imposes under subsection 62(10) of the Act, determine that the applicant does not pose an unacceptable risk to public health or public safety, including the risk of cannabis being diverted to an illicit market or activity.
Factors that the Minister may consider to determine the level of risk posed by the applicant include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the circumstances of any events or convictions that are relevant to the determination, the seriousness of those events or convictions, their number and frequency, the date of the most recent event or conviction and any sentence or other disposition;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whether it is known, or there are reasonable grounds to suspect, that the applicant

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is or has been involved in, or contributes or has contributed to, an activity that is prohibited by, or conducted in contravention of, any of the provisions of Division 1 of Part 1 of the Act — other than paragraphs 8(1)(a) to (e) — or Subdivision E of Division 2 of Part 1 of the Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is or has been involved in, or contributes or has contributed to, an activity that is prohibited by, or conducted in contravention of, any of the provisions of Part I of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act — other than subsection 4(1) — or subsection 32(1) or (2) of that Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: is or has been involved in, or contributes or has contributed to, an activity that is prohibited by, or conducted in contravention of, any provision of the Criminal Code relating to fraud, corruption of public officials, terrorism financing, counterfeiting or laundering the proceeds of crime,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: is or has been involved in, or contributes or has contributed to, an offence involving an act of violence or the threat of violence,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: is or has been a member of a criminal organization as defined in subsection 467.1(1) of the Criminal Code, or is or has been involved in, or contributes or has contributed to, the activities of such an organization,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: is or has been a member of an organization that is known to be involved in or to contribute to — or in respect of which there are reasonable grounds to suspect its involvement in or contribution to — activities directed toward, or in support of, acts of violence or the threat of violence, or is or has been involved in, or contributes or has contributed to, the activities of such an organization,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: is or has been associated with an individual who

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: is known to be involved in or to contribute to — or in respect of whom there are reasonable grounds to suspect their involvement in or contribution to — activities referred to in subparagraphs (i) to (iii), or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: is a member of an organization referred to in subparagraph (v) or (vi), or

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: has conspired to commit

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: an offence under any of the provisions of the Criminal Code referred to in subparagraph (iii),

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: an offence referred to in subparagraph (iv), or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: an offence under any of sections 467.11 to 467.13 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: whether there are reasonable grounds to suspect that the applicant could be induced to commit an act — or to aid or abet any person to commit an act — that might constitute a risk to public health or public safety;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: whether there are reasonable grounds to believe that the applicant’s activities, including their financial activities, pose a risk to the integrity of the control of the production and distribution of cannabis under the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: whether the applicant has had a security clearance suspended or cancelled;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: whether there are reasonable grounds to believe the applicant has, now or in the past, submitted false or misleading information, or false or falsified documents, to the Minister; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: whether an entity has refused to issue a security clearance to the applicant — or has suspended or cancelled one — and the reason for the refusal, suspension or cancellation.

Section.Text: If the Minister refuses to consider an application for a security clearance because there is an outstanding criminal charge against the applicant that may be relevant to the determination of the risk under subsection 53(1), the Minister must provide the applicant, and any affected holder of or applicant for a licence, with notice of the refusal in writing.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister intends to refuse to grant a security clearance, the Minister must provide the applicant with a notice that sets out the reason for the proposed refusal and that specifies the period of time within which they may make written representations to the Minister. The period must start on the day on which the notice is provided and must be not less than 20 days.
If the Minister refuses to grant the security clearance, the Minister must provide the applicant, and any affected holder of or applicant for a licence, with notice of the refusal in writing.

The Minister must establish a validity period for a security clearance in accordance with the level of risk to public health or public safety — including the risk of cannabis being diverted to an illicit market or activity — posed by the applicant, but the period must not exceed five years.

If the validity period of a security clearance is less than five years, the Minister may subsequently extend the period to a total of five years if the Minister, taking into account any licence conditions that he or she imposes under subsection 62(10) of the Act, determines that the holder does not pose an unacceptable risk to public health or public safety, including the risk of cannabis being diverted to an illicit market or activity.
The factors that the Minister may consider to determine the level of risk posed by the holder include those set out in subsection 53(2).

Section.Text: A holder of a security clearance must, without delay, provide the Minister with notice in writing if they are charged with, or found guilty of, an offence under the Act, the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act or the Criminal Code.

Subsection.Text: Before suspending a security clearance, the Minister must have reasonable grounds to believe that the risk to public health or public safety posed by the holder, including the risk of cannabis being diverted to an illicit market or activity, has become unacceptable.

A suspension takes effect as soon as the Minister provides the holder with a notice in writing that sets out the reasons for the suspension and that specifies the period of time within which they may make written representations to the Minister. The period starts on the day on which the notice is provided and must be not less than 20 days.
The Minister must, without delay after suspending a security clearance, also provide any affected holder of or applicant for a licence with notice of the suspension in writing.
The Minister must reinstate a suspended security clearance if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the reasons for the suspension no longer exist or the holder of the security clearance demonstrates to the Minister that the suspension was unfounded; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister determines, taking into account any licence conditions that he or she imposes under subsection 62(10) of the Act, that the holder of the security clearance does not pose an unacceptable risk to public health or public safety, including the risk of cannabis being diverted to an illicit market or activity.

Subsection.Text: The factors that the Minister may consider to determine the level of risk posed by the holder of the security clearance include those set out in subsection 53(2).

The Minister must, without delay after reinstating a security clearance, provide the holder of the security clearance, and any affected holder of or applicant for a licence, with notice of the reinstatement in writing.
A security clearance may not be cancelled unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is suspended and the period within which the holder may make representations in respect of the suspension has expired; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has determined that the holder poses an unacceptable risk to public health or public safety, including the risk of cannabis being diverted to an illicit market or activity.

Subsection.Text: The factors that the Minister may consider to determine the level of risk posed by the holder include those set out in subsection 53(2).
The Minister must, without delay after cancelling a security clearance, provide the holder, and any affected holder of or applicant for a licence, with notice of the cancellation in writing.

Section.Text: If the Minister refuses to grant or cancels a security clearance, the individual who has been refused a security clearance or the former holder may submit a new application for a security clearance only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a period of five years has elapsed since the day on which the refusal or cancellation occurred; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a change has occurred in the circumstances that led to the refusal or cancellation.

Subsection.Text: The security measures set out in sections 63 to 72 apply in respect of the sites set out in the following licences:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a licence for standard cultivation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a licence for standard processing;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a licence for sale that authorizes the possession of cannabis; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a cannabis drug licence if the amount of cannabis that is sold or distributed to the holder of the licence is, as determined in accordance with the table to section 21, equivalent to more than 600 kg of dried cannabis per calendar year.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence referred to in subsection (1) must ensure that the security measures are complied with.

The cannabis referred to in paragraph (1)(d) is exempt from the application of subsection 2(4) of the Act and a quantity referred to in column 2 of the table to section 21 in respect of any class of cannabis referred to in column 1 is deemed to be equivalent to 1 kg of dried cannabis.

Section.Text: The site must be designed in a manner that prevents unauthorized access.

Subsection.Text: The perimeter of the site must be monitored at all times by visual recording devices to detect any attempted or actual unauthorized access to the site.
The devices must, in the conditions under which they are used, be capable of making a visible recording of any attempted or actual unauthorized access.
Access to each operations area and storage area must be restricted to individuals whose presence in the area is required by their duties.

Section.Text: Each operations area and storage area must be surrounded by a physical barrier that prevents unauthorized access.

Subsection.Text: Each operations area and storage area must be monitored at all times by visual recording devices to detect illicit conduct.
For a grow area, only the entry and exit points of the area must be monitored by the devices.
The devices must, in the conditions under which they are used, be capable of making a visible recording of any illicit conduct.

Each operations area and storage area must be secured by means of an intrusion detection system that operates at all times and that allows for the detection of any attempted or actual unauthorized access to the area, any unauthorized movement in the area and any attempted or actual tampering with the system.
The intrusion detection system is not required to detect unauthorized movement in a grow area.
The intrusion detection system referred to in section 71 must be monitored at all times.
The holder of the licence must determine the appropriate measures to be taken if any occurrence referred to in section 70 or 71 is detected.
If any such occurrence is detected, the holder of the licence must ensure that a document is retained that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date and time of the occurrence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the measures taken in response to it and the date and time when they were taken.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence referred to in subsection 62(1) must retain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the following visual recordings made under section 64 or 70 for at least one year after the day on which they are made:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if they are made using a visual recording device that is activated by motion, the visual recordings depicting movements only, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if they are made using a visual recording device that does not have this feature, all of those recordings; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the document referred to in subsection 72(3) for at least two years after the day on which it is prepared.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence for micro-cultivation, micro-processing or a nursery must ensure that the following security measures are complied with in respect of the site set out in the licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the site is designed in a manner that prevents unauthorized access;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the site is surrounded by a physical barrier that prevents unauthorized access;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: storage areas are surrounded by a physical barrier that prevents unauthorized access; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: access to each storage area is restricted to individuals whose presence in the area is required by their duties.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence for analytical testing must ensure that the following security measures are complied with in respect of the site set out in the licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: storage areas are surrounded by a physical barrier that prevents unauthorized access; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: access to each storage area is restricted to individuals whose presence in the area is required by their duties.

Subsection.Text: If the amount of cannabis that is sold or distributed to the holder of a cannabis drug licence is not equivalent, as determined in accordance with the table to section 21, to more than 600 kg of dried cannabis per calendar year, the holder must ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if they only conduct analytical testing, the security measures set out in paragraphs 75(a) and (b) are complied with in respect of the site set out in the licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, the security measures set out in paragraphs 74(a) to (d) are complied with in respect of the site set out in the licence.

Subsection.Text: The cannabis referred to in subsection (1) is exempt from the application of subsection 2(4) of the Act and a quantity referred to in column 2 of the table to section 21 in respect of any class of cannabis referred to in column 1 is deemed to be equivalent to 1 kg of dried cannabis.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence for research must ensure that operations areas at the site set out in the licence are designed in a manner that prevents unauthorized access.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence referred to in subsection 62(1) is exempt from the application of subsections 70(1), 71(1) and 72(1) in respect of any operations area if no activities conducted under the licence are in progress in the operations area and no cannabis is present in the operations area.

A holder of a cannabis drug licence is exempt from the application of this Part in respect of the site set out in the licence if they are securely storing cannabis in accordance with the Directive on Physical Security Requirements for Controlled Substances and Drugs Containing Cannabis, as amended from time to time and published by the Government of Canada on its website.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: acceptable level means a level of a biological, chemical or physical hazard that does not present a risk of contamination of cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient. (niveau acceptable)

control measure means a measure that can be applied to prevent or eliminate any biological, chemical or physical hazard that presents a risk of contamination of cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient, or to reduce the hazard to an acceptable level. (mesure de contrôle)

critical control point means a step at which the application of a control measure is essential to prevent or eliminate any biological, chemical or physical hazard that presents a risk of contamination of cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient, or to reduce the hazard to an acceptable level. (point de contrôle critique)

sanitary condition means a condition that does not present a risk of contamination, allergen cross-contamination or introduction of an extraneous substance to cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient. (conditions hygiéniques)

Section.Text: A holder of a licence must not sell, distribute or export cannabis unless the applicable requirements set out in sections 80 to 88.94 have been met.

Section.MarginalNote: Non-application — person not holding a licence
Section.Text: The requirements of this Part do not apply to any activity that a person conducts in respect of anything that will be used as an ingredient unless the activity is conducted by a holder of a licence.

Section.MarginalNote: Non-application — holder of licence for analytical testing or research
Section.Text: Sections 80 to 87.1 do not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a licence for analytical testing; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a licence for research, except in respect of non-therapeutic research on cannabis.

Section.Text: The requirements of this Part do not apply in respect of a reference standard and anything that will be used as an ingredient in the production of a reference standard.

Cannabis and anything that will be used as an ingredient must be produced, packaged, labelled, distributed, stored, sampled and tested in accordance with standard operating procedures that are designed to ensure that those activities are conducted in accordance with the applicable requirements of this Part and Part 6.

Subsection.Text: Cannabis must not be treated with a pest control product unless the product is registered for use on cannabis under the Pest Control Products Act or is otherwise authorized for use under that Act.
Despite subsection (1), edible cannabis may be treated during the course of production with a pest control product referred to in subparagraph 3(1)(b)(ii) of the Pest Control Products Regulations.

Section.MarginalNote: Sanitizers, agronomic inputs and non-food chemical agents
Section.Text: Any sanitizer, agronomic input or non-food chemical agent that is present at a site must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be properly and clearly identified;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be suitable for its intended use and not present a risk of contamination of cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be handled and used in a manner that does not present a risk of contamination of cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient and that is in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

Section.Text: Cannabis and anything that will be used as an ingredient must be stored under conditions that maintain their quality.
Cannabis and anything that will be used as an ingredient must be distributed in a manner that maintains their quality.

Any building or part of a building where cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient is produced, packaged, labelled, stored or tested must be designed, constructed and maintained in a manner that permits those activities to be conducted appropriately and under sanitary conditions and, in particular, that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: permits the building or part of the building to be kept clean and orderly;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: permits the effective cleaning of all surfaces in the building or part of the building;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prevents the contamination of the cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: prevents the introduction of an extraneous substance to the cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient.

Subsection.Text: Any building or part of a building where cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient is produced, packaged, labelled, stored or tested must be equipped with a system that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: filters air to prevent the escape of odours associated with cannabis plant material to the outdoors;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provides natural or mechanical ventilation with sufficient air exchange to provide clean air and to remove unclean air in order to prevent the contamination of the cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is accessible and, if necessary for its cleaning, maintenance or inspection, is capable of being disassembled;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is capable of withstanding repeated cleaning; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: functions in accordance with its intended use.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — cultivation, propagation or harvesting of cannabis
Subsection.Text: Paragraph (1)(b) does not apply in respect of any building or part of a building where the only activities being conducted in respect of cannabis are its cultivation, propagation or harvesting.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — cultivation, propagation or harvesting of anything used as an ingredient
Subsection.Text: Paragraphs (1)(b) to (e) do not apply in respect of any building or part of a building where the only activities being conducted in respect of anything that will be used as an ingredient are its cultivation, propagation or harvesting.
Any system that supplies water to a site must be appropriate for any activity being conducted in respect of cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient.

Any system that supplies potable water to a site must not be cross-connected with any other system, unless measures are taken to eliminate any risk of contamination of cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient as a result of the cross-connection.

Any building or part of a building where cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient is produced, packaged, labelled, stored or tested must be equipped with natural or artificial lighting that is appropriate for the activity being conducted.
Any light fixtures in the building or part of the building where the activities referred to in subsection (1) are conducted must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be capable of withstanding repeated cleaning and, if necessary to prevent contamination of the cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient, repeated sanitizing; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not present a risk of contamination of the cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient in the event of breakage.

Subsection.Text: Cannabis and anything that will be used as an ingredient must be produced, packaged, labelled, stored, sampled and tested using equipment that is designed, constructed, maintained, operated and arranged in a manner that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: permits the effective cleaning of its surfaces;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: permits it to function in accordance with its intended use;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: is accessible and, if necessary for its cleaning, maintenance or inspection, is capable of being easily disassembled;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prevents the contamination of the cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: prevents the introduction of an extraneous substance to the cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: protects the cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient against allergen cross-contamination.

Subsection.Text: Cannabis and anything that will be used as an ingredient must be distributed using a conveyance that is designed, constructed, maintained and operated in a manner that prevents the contamination of the cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient.
Paragraphs (1)(d) and (e) do not apply to the outdoor cultivation, propagation or harvesting of cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient.
Cannabis and anything that will be used as an ingredient must be produced, packaged, labelled, distributed, stored, sampled and tested in accordance with a sanitation program that sets out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for effectively cleaning the building or part of the building in which those activities are conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for effectively cleaning the equipment and conveyances used in those activities;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for handling any substance used in those activities; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: all requirements, in respect of the health and hygienic behaviour of the personnel who are involved in those activities, that are necessary to ensure that those activities are conducted in sanitary conditions.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph (1)(a) does not apply to the outdoor cultivation, propagation or harvesting of cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient.

Section.MarginalNote: Hand cleaning and hand sanitizing stations and lavatories

Subsection.Text: If necessary to prevent the contamination of cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient, a site must be equipped with hand cleaning and hand sanitizing stations and lavatories that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: are appropriately equipped and adequate in number and size for the number of individuals using them;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: are located so that they are readily accessible to the individuals using them; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: are capable of withstanding repeated cleaning and, as necessary, repeated sanitizing.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Hand cleaning and hand sanitizing stations
Subsection.Text: The hand cleaning and hand sanitizing stations must permit the effective cleaning and sanitization of hands.
The lavatories must be located and maintained so that they do not present any risk of contamination of cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient.

Heading.TitleText: Additional Requirements — Holder of Licence for Processing

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for processing must ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: every investigation in respect of the matters referred to in paragraphs 19(2)(b) and (c) is conducted under the responsibility of the quality assurance person referred to in section 19;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if necessary following an investigation, the quality assurance person immediately causes measures to be taken to mitigate any risk;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: cannabis and anything that will be used as an ingredient are produced, packaged, labelled, distributed, stored, sampled and tested using methods and procedures that, prior to their implementation, have been approved by the quality assurance person;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a cannabis extract or edible cannabis, the quality assurance person approves the preventive control plan referred to in section 88.94 prior to its implementation; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: every lot or batch of cannabis is approved by the quality assurance person before it is made available for sale.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Activities under the responsibility of quality assurance person
Subsection.Text: The activities assigned to the quality assurance person under paragraphs (1)(b) to (e) can also be conducted under the responsibility of that person.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence for processing must ensure that any individual who conducts activities in relation to edible cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient in the production of edible cannabis has the competencies and qualifications that are necessary to conduct those activities at the site set out in the licence.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for processing must ensure that the temperature and humidity of any building or part of a building where cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient is produced, packaged, labelled, stored or tested are maintained at levels that are appropriate for the activity being conducted with the cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient.
If the building or part of the building is equipped with a heating, cooling or humidity-control system, the holder of the licence must ensure that the system

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if necessary to prevent contamination of the cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient, is equipped with instruments to control and indicate the temperature and humidity levels;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is accessible and, if necessary for its cleaning, maintenance or inspection, is capable of being disassembled;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is capable of withstanding repeated cleaning; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: functions in accordance with its intended use.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for processing must ensure that physical or other effective means are used to separate incompatible activities in order to prevent contamination of cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient.

A holder of a licence for processing must not produce, package, label or store cannabis at a site set out in the licence if food that is to be sold is also produced, packaged or labelled at that site.

Despite subsection (2), a holder of a licence for processing may produce, package, label or store cannabis in a building within a site where food that is to be sold is produced, packaged or labelled if the food is not produced, packaged or labelled in the same building.

Section.MarginalNote: Separation of cannabis and ingredients from contaminants
Section.Text: A holder of a licence for processing must ensure that physical or other effective means are used to separate cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient from anything that presents a risk of contamination of the cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient.

Section.MarginalNote: Ingredients — risk of injury to human health
Section.Text: A holder of a licence for processing must ensure that anything that will be, or was intended to be, used as an ingredient that presents a risk of injury to human health is identified as such and is stored in a designated area within the site.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for processing must ensure that any water that might come into contact with a cannabis extract, a cannabis topical, edible cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient is potable and, if the water is not potable, must ensure that it does not present a risk of contamination of the cannabis extract, cannabis topical, edible cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Steam and ice from potable water
Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for processing must ensure that any steam or ice that might come into contact with a cannabis extract, a cannabis topical, edible cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient is made from water that meets the requirements of subsection (1) and, if the steam or ice does not meet those requirements, must ensure that it does not present a risk of contamination of the cannabis extract, cannabis topical, edible cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence for processing must ensure that no animal is present in any building or part of a building where cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient is produced, packaged, labelled or stored.

If any land that forms part of a site set out in a licence for processing, or any land that is located near such a site, presents a risk of contamination of cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient, the holder of the licence must take measures to eliminate the risk.

Section.MarginalNote: Removal and disposal of contaminated materials and waste

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for processing must ensure that any building or part of a building where cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient is produced, packaged, labelled or stored has means for the removal and disposal of contaminated materials and waste and, if necessary to prevent contamination of the cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient, that the building or part of the building is equipped with a drainage, sewage and plumbing system that functions in accordance with its intended use.

The holder of the licence must ensure that contaminated materials and waste are removed and disposed of at a frequency that is sufficient to prevent contamination of the cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient and in a manner that does not present a risk of contamination of the cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence for processing must ensure that any conveyance or equipment that is used at the site set out in the licence to handle any contaminated materials or any waste, unless that conveyance or equipment does not come into contact with those materials or waste,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is used only for that purpose;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is identified as being reserved for that purpose; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: meets the applicable requirements of section 86.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence for processing must ensure that any individual who enters or is in any building or part of a building where cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient is produced, packaged, labelled, stored, sampled or tested wears clothing, footwear and protective coverings, including gloves, a hairnet, a beard net and a smock, that are in good condition, clean and in sanitary condition and that are appropriate for the activity being conducted with the cannabis or thing that will be used as an ingredient.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for processing that produces a cannabis extract or edible cannabis must identify and analyze the biological, chemical and physical hazards that present a risk of contamination of the cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient in the production of the cannabis extract or edible cannabis.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Prevention, elimination and reduction of hazards
Subsection.Text: The holder of the licence must prevent, eliminate or reduce to an acceptable level the hazards referred to in subsection (1) by using control measures that are shown by evidence to be effective, including any treatment or process.

A holder of a licence for processing that conducts activities in relation to a cannabis extract or edible cannabis must prepare, retain, maintain and implement a written preventive control plan for any activity they conduct in respect of the cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient in the production of the cannabis extract or edible cannabis.
The preventive control plan must include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the measures for ensuring that the applicable requirements of sections 101.3, 101.4, 102, 102.2, 102.3, 102.5 and 102.6 are met;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in relation to the applicable requirements of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the biological, chemical and physical hazards that are identified under subsection 88.93(1) that present a risk of contamination of the cannabis extract, edible cannabis or anything that will be used as an ingredient in the production of the cannabis extract or edible cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the control measures for preventing, eliminating or reducing to an acceptable level the hazards referred to in subparagraph (i) and the evidence that the control measures are effective,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the critical control points, the related control measures and the evidence that the control measures are effective,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the critical limits for each critical control point,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the procedures for monitoring the critical control points in relation to their critical limits,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the corrective action procedures for each critical control point,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the procedures for verifying that the implementation of the preventive control plan results in compliance with these Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: documents that substantiate that the preventive control plan has been implemented with respect to subparagraphs (i) to (vii); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: supporting documents that show evidence of the information recorded under paragraph (a) and subparagraphs (b)(i) to (vii).

Subsection.Text: Each document referred to in subparagraph (2)(b)(viii) must be retained for at least two years after the day on which it is prepared.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence must not sell or export a cannabis product unless the applicable requirements set out in sections 90 to 92 have been met.

Subsection.Text: Testing for the quantity or concentration, as the case may be, of THC, THCA, CBD and CBDA must be conducted on each lot or batch of cannabis, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is or will become a cannabis product; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is or will be contained in a cannabis accessory that is or will become a cannabis product.

Subsection.Text: The testing must be conducted on the final form of the cannabis, either before or after it — or the cannabis accessory that contains it — is packaged and labelled as a cannabis product.
Testing for microbial and chemical contaminants — other than residues of a pest control product or its components or derivatives — must be conducted on

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: each lot or batch of cannabis — other than cannabis plants, cannabis plant seeds or edible cannabis — that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is or will become a cannabis product, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is or will be contained in a cannabis accessory that is or will become a cannabis product; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each lot or batch of cannabis — other than cannabis plant seeds — that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is used to produce the cannabis referred to in paragraph (a), or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is used to produce edible cannabis that is or will become a cannabis product, or that is or will be contained in a cannabis accessory that is or will become a cannabis product.

Subsection.Text: The testing on a lot or batch of cannabis must be conducted as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the testing referred to in paragraph (1)(a) must be conducted on the final form of the cannabis, either before or after it — or the cannabis accessory that contains it — is packaged and labelled as a cannabis product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the testing referred to in paragraph (1)(b) must be conducted after the final step in the production process during which the contaminants referred to in subsection (1) could have been introduced or could be concentrated, whichever is later.

Subsection.Text: The results of the testing referred to in subsection (1) must enable a determination of whether the contaminants, if any, are or will be within the tolerance limits referred to in subsection 93(3) or 94(2) or section 101.1, as the case may be.

If cannabis — or a cannabis accessory that contains cannabis — is or will become a cannabis product to which subsection 95(1) applies, testing must be conducted on each lot or batch of the cannabis or cannabis accessory to determine whether the requirements referred to in that subsection are, or will be, met.
The testing must be conducted on the final form of the cannabis, either before or after it — or the cannabis accessory that contains it — is packaged and labelled as a cannabis product.

Testing that is conducted under sections 90 to 91.1 — or to determine whether the applicable requirements in Part 6 are, or will be, met — must be conducted using validated methods on a representative sample of each lot or batch of cannabis or cannabis accessory that contains cannabis.
A portion of the sample referred to in subsection (1) must be retained for at least one year after the date of the last sale of any portion of the lot or batch.
The portion of the sample retained under subsection (2) must be of sufficient quantity to enable a determination of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: whether the lot or batch meets the requirements of section 81, subsection 93(3), 94(2) or 95(1) or section 101.1, as applicable; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity or concentration of THC, THCA, CBD and CBDA.

Section.MarginalNote: Interpretation — residues of pest control products
Section.Text: In this Part, a reference to residues of a pest control product includes the residues of any component or derivative of the pest control product.

Section.MarginalNote: Residues of pest control products — cannabis plants and seeds
Section.Text: Cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds that are cannabis products — or that are contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — must not contain or have on them residues of a pest control product that is registered for use on cannabis under the Pest Control Products Act, or that is otherwise authorized for use under that Act, unless the residues are within any maximum residue limits that are specified in relation to cannabis under section 9 or 10 of that Act.

Subsection.Text: Dried cannabis or fresh cannabis that is a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — must not contain or have on it anything other than anything referred to in item 1 of Schedule 1 to the Act.

Despite subsection (1), cannabis that is referred to in that subsection may contain or have on it residues of a pest control product that is registered for use on cannabis under the Pest Control Products Act, or that is otherwise authorized for use under that Act, if the residues are within any maximum residue limits that are specified in relation to cannabis under section 9 or 10 of that Act.

Despite subsection (1), cannabis that is referred to in that subsection may contain or have on it microbial or chemical contaminants if the contaminants are within generally accepted tolerance limits for human use that are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: established in a publication referred to in Schedule B to the Food and Drugs Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: appropriate for the intended use and any reasonably foreseeable use of the cannabis product.

Subsection.Text: If there are generally accepted tolerance limits referred to in subsection (3) that apply in respect of the residues of a pest control product referred to in subsection (2) for which a maximum residue limit has been specified in relation to cannabis under the Pest Control Products Act, the more stringent limit applies.

Cannabis that is referred to in item 1 or 3 of Schedule 1 to the Act and that is used in the production of the following cannabis must not contain or have on it residues of a pest control product that is registered for use on cannabis under the Pest Control Products Act, or that is otherwise authorized for use under that Act, unless the residues are within any maximum residue limits that are specified in relation to cannabis under section 9 or 10 of that Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a cannabis extract that will become a cannabis product or that will be contained in a cannabis accessory that will become a cannabis product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a cannabis topical that will become a cannabis product or that will be contained in a cannabis accessory that will become a cannabis product; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: edible cannabis that will become a cannabis product or that will be contained in a cannabis accessory that will become a cannabis product.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Edible cannabis — microbial and chemical contaminants
Subsection.Text: Cannabis that is referred to in item 1 or 3 of Schedule 1 to the Act and that is used in the production of edible cannabis must not, if the edible cannabis will become a cannabis product or will be contained in a cannabis accessory that will become a cannabis product, contain or have on it microbial or chemical contaminants unless the contaminants are within generally accepted tolerance limits for human use that are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: established in a publication referred to in Schedule B to the Food and Drugs Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: appropriate for a product that is to be ingested.

Subsection.Text: Each discrete unit of a cannabis product that is intended for ingestion or nasal, rectal or vaginal use must meet, if the form of the unit is similar to a dosage form for which a dissolution or disintegration test is set out in a publication referred to in Schedule B to the Food and Drugs Act, the requirements of the test or, if there is more than one applicable test, the requirements of any such test that is suitable for demonstrating that the cannabis product will perform as intended.
Subsection (1) does not apply to edible cannabis.

Section.MarginalNote: Maximum quantity of THC — discrete unit

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection 97(1), each discrete unit of a cannabis product that is intended for ingestion or nasal, rectal or vaginal use must not contain a quantity of THC that exceeds 10 mg, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC.
Subsection (1) does not apply to edible cannabis.

A cannabis extract, or a cannabis topical, that is a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — must not contain, in respect of any quantity or concentration of THC or CBD that is displayed on the label, less than 85% or more than 115% of that quantity or concentration.
Edible cannabis that is a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — must not contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if a quantity of THC or CBD that is displayed on the label exceeds 5 mg, less than 85% or more than 115% of that quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if a quantity of THC or CBD that is displayed on the label exceeds 2 mg but does not exceed 5 mg, less than 80% or more than 120% of that quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if a quantity of THC or CBD that is displayed on the label does not exceed 2 mg, less than 75% or more than 125% of that quantity.

Subsection.Text: If a cannabis product that is not in discrete units is represented as being able to be divided into discrete units, each represented unit must not contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a quantity of THC that is less than 75% or more than 125% of the quantity of THC in each of the other represented units, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a quantity of CBD that is less than 75% or more than 125% of the quantity of CBD in each of the other represented units, taking into account the potential to convert CBDA into CBD.

Subsection.Text: If a cannabis product is in discrete units that are represented as being able to be divided into discrete sub-units, each represented subunit must not contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a quantity of THC that is less than 75% or more than 125% of the quantity of THC in each of the other represented subunits, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a quantity of CBD that is less than 75% or more than 125% of the quantity of CBD in each of the other represented subunits, taking into account the potential to convert CBDA into CBD.

Section.MarginalNote: Products that must not be sold or distributed
Section.Text: The following cannabis products must not be sold or distributed:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a cannabis product that is intended to be used in the area of the human eye bounded by the supraorbital and infraorbital ridges, including the eyebrows, the skin underlying the eyebrows, the eyelids, the eyelashes, the conjunctival sac of the eye, the eyeball and the soft tissue that lies below the eye and within the infraorbital ridge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a cannabis product that is intended to be used on damaged or broken skin or to penetrate the skin barrier other than by absorption.

Section.Text: It is prohibited for a holder of a licence to sell or distribute a cannabis extract, a cannabis topical or edible cannabis that is a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — if the immediate container contains multiple discrete units, unless the properties of each unit, including size but excluding flavour and colour, as applicable, are consistent.
THC or THCA must not be added to dried or fresh cannabis that will become a cannabis product or that is, or will be, contained in a cannabis accessory that will become a cannabis product.

Subsection.Text: A cannabis extract, or a cannabis topical, that is a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — must not contain or have on it anything that may cause injury to the health of the user when the cannabis product is used as intended or in a reasonably foreseeable way.
Subsection (1) does not, in respect of a cannabis extract that is intended to be combusted and inhaled, prohibit anything that may cause injury as a result of the intended combustion and inhalation.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Things that do not cause injury
Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), a cannabis extract or a cannabis topical does not contain or have on it anything that may cause injury to the health of the user by reason only that it contains or has on it

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: anything referred to in item 1 or 3 of Schedule 1 to the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: residues of a pest control product that is registered for use on cannabis under the Pest Control Products Act, or that is otherwise authorized for use under that Act, if the residues are within any maximum residue limits that are specified in relation to cannabis under section 9 or 10 of that Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: microbial or chemical contaminants — other than residues of a pest control product referred to in paragraph (b) — if the contaminants are within generally accepted tolerance limits for human use that are

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: established in a publication referred to in Schedule B to the Food and Drugs Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: appropriate for the intended use and any reasonably foreseeable use of the cannabis product.

Section.Text: A cannabis extract, or a cannabis topical, that is a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — must not contain or have on it microbial or chemical contaminants unless the contaminants are within generally accepted tolerance limits for human use that are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: established in a publication referred to in Schedule B to the Food and Drugs Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: appropriate for the intended use and any reasonably foreseeable use of the cannabis product.

Section.Text: A cannabis extract, or a cannabis topical, that is a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — must not contain a quantity of THC that exceeds 1000 mg per immediate container, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC.

Subsection.Text: A cannabis extract that is a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — must not contain any ingredients other than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: carrier substances;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: flavouring agents; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: substances that are necessary to maintain the quality or stability of the cannabis product.

Subsection.Text: The following substances must not be used as ingredients to produce a cannabis extract referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: substances that are listed in column 1 of the table in Schedule 2 to the Tobacco and Vaping Products Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sugars or sweeteners or sweetening agents, as those terms are defined in subsection B.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph 2(a), a vitamin may be used as an ingredient to maintain the quality or stability of the cannabis extract referred to in subsection (1) if it is used in an amount that does not exceed what is necessary to maintain the quality or stability of the cannabis product.

An ingredient that is used to produce the cannabis extract referred to in subsection (1) may contain a substance referred to in subsection (2) only if that substance is naturally present in the ingredient at a level that is not above the naturally occurring level for that ingredient.
An ingredient — other than a flavouring agent — must not be used to produce a cannabis extract referred to in subsection (1) that is intended to be consumed by means of inhalation unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a standard for the ingredient is set out in a publication referred to in Schedule B to the Food and Drugs Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the ingredient complies with the standard.

Subsection.Text: A cannabis extract referred to in subsection (1) that is intended to be consumed by means of inhalation may contain the following quantities of ethyl alcohol if the net weight of the cannabis extract in each immediate container of the cannabis product does not exceed 7.5 g:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if it is in discrete units, 10 mg or less per unit; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it is not in discrete units,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 mg or less, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: more than 10 mg, if the immediate container does not permit the extract to be easily removed from the container and contains an integrated mechanism that dispenses no more than 10 mg of ethyl alcohol per activation.

Subsection.Text: A cannabis extract referred to in subsection (1) that is intended to be ingested may contain ethyl alcohol if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the net weight of the cannabis extract in each immediate container of the cannabis product does not exceed 7.5 g, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the net weight of the cannabis extract in each immediate container of the cannabis product exceeds 7.5 g, the concentration of ethyl alcohol does not exceed 0.5% w/w of the cannabis extract.

Section.Text: A cannabis topical that is a cannabis product or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product may contain denatured ethyl alcohol.

The cannabinoids and terpenes in a cannabis extract, or a cannabis topical, that is a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — must be uniformly distributed throughout the cannabis extract or cannabis topical.

A cannabis extract that is a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — must not be represented for use, directly or indirectly, on external body surfaces, including hair and nails.

Subsection.Text: Edible cannabis that is a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — must not contain any ingredients other than food and food additives.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Temporarily marketed foods and supplemented foods
Subsection.Text: The following foods must not be used as an ingredient to produce edible cannabis referred to in subsection (1) and must not be a constituent of such an ingredient:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a food that is described in a Temporary Marketing Authorization Letter issued under subsection B.01.054(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a supplemented food within the meaning of section B.01.001 of those Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a food in respect of which the manufacturer, as defined in section A.01.010 of the Food and Drug Regulations, is exempt from the application of those Regulations in accordance with section 32 or 33 of the Regulations Amending the Food and Drug Regulations and the Cannabis Regulations (Supplemented Foods), as the case may be.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Meat products, poultry products and fish
Subsection.Text: A meat product, poultry product or fish, other than a food additive, must not be used as an ingredient to produce edible cannabis referred to in subsection (1) — and must not be a constituent of such an ingredient — unless the meat product, poultry product or fish

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has been produced by a person that is authorized to produce it under the laws of a province or the Safe Food for Canadians Act or has been imported in accordance with that Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a water activity that does not exceed 0.85 at a temperature of 22 ± 2°C at the time the meat product, poultry product or fish is obtained by the holder of the licence for processing that is producing the edible cannabis.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for processing that produces a food may use it as an ingredient to produce edible cannabis referred to in subsection (1) — or as a constituent of such an ingredient — if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the food is not a meat product, poultry product or fish; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sale of the food would not be prohibited under section 4 of the Food and Drugs Act.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for processing may use a food additive as an ingredient to produce edible cannabis referred to in subsection (1) only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the edible cannabis would be a food that is set out in column 3 of the Lists of Permitted Food Additives, if the edible cannabis did not contain or have on it anything referred to in item 1 or 3 of Schedule 1 to the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the food additive is set out in column 1 and is not caffeine or caffeine citrate;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the food additive is obtained from any corresponding source set out in column 2;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the food additive is used for any corresponding purpose of use set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of the food additive does not exceed

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any corresponding maximum level of use and any corresponding maximum level of residue set out in column 5, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount that is required to accomplish the purpose for which it is added, in the case where the words “Good Manufacturing Practice” appear in column 5 for that food additive in the food; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any other corresponding condition set out in column 5 is met.

Subsection.Text: A vitamin or mineral nutrient must not be used as an ingredient to produce edible cannabis referred to in subsection (1) unless its use is permitted under subsection (5).

Edible cannabis that is a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — must not contain or have on it anything in a quantity that would cause the sale of the edible cannabis to be prohibited under any of paragraphs 4(1)(a) to (d) of the Food and Drugs Act if the edible cannabis were a food to which that Act applies.
