Edible cannabis does not have a poisonous or harmful substance in or on it, within the meaning of paragraph 4(1)(a) of the Food and Drugs Act, and is not adulterated, within the meaning of paragraph 4(1)(d) of that Act, by reason only that it contains or has on it

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: anything referred to in item 1 or 3 of Schedule 1 to the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: residues of a pest control product that is registered for use on cannabis under the Pest Control Products Act, or is otherwise authorized for use under that Act, if the residues are within any maximum residue limits that are specified in relation to cannabis under section 9 or 10 of that Act;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: microbial or chemical contaminants — other than residues of a pest control product referred to in paragraph (b) — if the contaminants are within generally accepted tolerance limits for human use that are

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: established in a publication referred to in Schedule B to the Food and Drugs Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: appropriate for a product that is to be ingested; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a food additive, if the conditions set out in subparagraphs 28.1(4)(c)(i) to (vi) or the requirements set out in paragraphs 102(5)(a) to (f), as the case may be, are met in respect of the use of the food additive as an ingredient to produce the edible cannabis.

Section.Text: Edible cannabis that is a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — must not contain or have on it caffeine unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the caffeine has been introduced through the use of ingredients that naturally contain caffeine; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the total amount of caffeine in each immediate container of the cannabis product does not exceed 30 mg.

Section.Text: Edible cannabis that is a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — must not contain or have on it ethyl alcohol unless the concentration of ethyl alcohol does not exceed 0.5% w/w of the edible cannabis.

It is prohibited for a holder of a licence to sell or distribute edible cannabis that is a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — if the unopened immediate container must be stored at or below 4°C to prevent the cannabis product from becoming contaminated before its durable life date.

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited for a holder of a licence to sell or distribute edible cannabis that is a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — in a hermetically sealed container if any component of the edible cannabis has a pH that exceeds 4.6 and a water activity that exceeds 0.85 at a temperature of 22 ± 2°C.
The following definitions apply in subsection (1).

Definition.Text: hermetically sealed container means a container that, due to its design, is secure against the entry of micro-organisms, including spores. (contenant hermétiquement scellé)
water activity means the ratio of the water vapour pressure of the component to the vapour pressure of pure water, at the same temperature and pressure. (activité de l’eau)

Section.Text: A holder of a licence for processing must not irradiate edible cannabis unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the edible cannabis would be a food that is listed in item 3 or 4, column 1, of the table to Division 26 of Part B of the Food and Drug Regulations if the edible cannabis did not contain or have on it anything that is referred to in item 1 or 3 of Schedule 1 to the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder satisfies the requirements set out in paragraphs B.26.003(2)(a) and (b) and subsection B.26.004(1) of those Regulations in respect of the edible cannabis.

Section.Text: Subject to subsection 97(2), edible cannabis that is a cannabis product — or that is contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product — must not contain a quantity of THC that exceeds 10 mg per immediate container, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC.
A cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product, or that is packaged with a cannabis product, must not be contaminated.
A cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product, or that is packaged with a cannabis product, must not impart a characterizing flavour to the cannabis.

Subject to subsection 97(1), each activation of the following cannabis accessories must not dispense a quantity of cannabis extract that contains greater than 10 mg of THC, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product and that dispenses a cannabis extract that is intended for ingestion or nasal, rectal or vaginal use; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a cannabis accessory that is packaged with, and that is intended to dispense, a cannabis extract that is a cannabis product and that is intended for ingestion or nasal, rectal or vaginal use.

Section.MarginalNote: Psychological effects, abuse liability and toxicity

Subsection.Text: A component of a cannabis product — other than a component that is anything referred to in item 1 or 3 of Schedule 1 to the Act — and a cannabis accessory that is packaged with a cannabis product must not, through any means other than heating or combustion, and when used as intended or in a reasonably foreseeable way,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: alter or enhance the psychological effects derived from the cannabis product in a manner that may cause injury to the health of the user;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: increase the potential for abuse liability of the cannabis product; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: increase the toxicity of the cannabis product.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not prohibit the presence of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ethyl alcohol in or on a cannabis product referred to in subsections 101.3(5.1) or (6) or sections 101.31 or 102.3 if the conditions set out in those provisions, as the case may be, are met; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: caffeine in or on a cannabis product referred to in section 102.2 if the conditions set out in that section are met.

Section.MarginalNote: Non-application — prescription drug and combination product
Section.Text: Sections 104.11 to 104.16 do not apply to a prescription drug or a combination product.

It is prohibited to promote a cannabis extract — or a cannabis accessory that contains a cannabis extract — under subsections 17(2) to (6) of the Act in a manner that could cause a person to believe that the cannabis extract or the cannabis accessory has a flavour set out in column 1 of Schedule 3 to the Tobacco and Vaping Products Act, other than the flavour of cannabis.

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited to promote cannabis, a cannabis accessory or a service related to cannabis under subsections 17(2) to (6) of the Act if there are reasonable grounds to believe that the promotion could create the impression that health or cosmetic benefits may be derived from the service or the use of the cannabis or the cannabis accessory.
Subsection (1) does not apply with respect to a medical device in respect of which a licence has been issued under subsection 36(1) of the Medical Devices Regulations.

Section.MarginalNote: Energy value and amount of nutrient

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited to promote edible cannabis — or a cannabis accessory that contains edible cannabis — under subsections 17(2) to (6) of the Act by communicating information about the energy value referred to in item 2 of the table to section 132.22 or the amount of any nutrient referred to in items 3 to 15 of that table or in items 5 to 37 of the table to section B.01.402 of the Food and Drug Regulations.

Despite subsection (1), edible cannabis or a cannabis accessory that contains edible cannabis may be promoted by reproducing the nutrition facts table that is required to be included on the label of any container in which the edible cannabis or the cannabis accessory is packaged in accordance with these Regulations using smaller, larger or identical dimensions and spacing.

Section.Text: It is prohibited to promote edible cannabis — or a cannabis accessory that contains edible cannabis — under subsections 17(2) to (6) of the Act if there are reasonable grounds to believe that the promotion could create the impression that the edible cannabis or accessory is intended

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to meet the particular dietary requirements of an individual

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: who has a physical or physiological condition as a result of a disease, disorder or injury, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for whom a particular effect, including weight loss, is to be obtained by a controlled intake of food; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to meet the dietary requirements of young persons.

Section.Text: It is prohibited to promote cannabis, a cannabis accessory or a service related to cannabis under subsections 17(2) to (6) of the Act if there are reasonable grounds to believe that the promotion could associate the cannabis, the cannabis accessory or the service with an alcoholic beverage.

It is prohibited to promote cannabis, a cannabis accessory or a service related to cannabis under subsections 17(2) to (6) of the Act if there are reasonable grounds to believe that the promotion could associate the cannabis, the cannabis accessory or the service with a tobacco product, as defined in section 2 of the Tobacco and Vaping Products Act, or a vaping product to which that Act applies.

Section.MarginalNote: Place where young persons are not permitted
Section.Text: It is prohibited to promote cannabis, a cannabis accessory or a service related to cannabis under paragraphs 17(2)(b) and (3)(b) of the Act in such a manner that the promotion may be audible or visible from outside a place where young persons are not permitted by law.

It is prohibited to promote cannabis, a cannabis accessory or a service related to cannabis under subsection 17(6) of the Act in a manner that results in the same brand element being displayed more than once on a thing referred to in that subsection or in more than one brand element being displayed on the thing.

Section.MarginalNote: Public place frequented mainly by young persons
Section.Text: It is prohibited to promote cannabis, a cannabis accessory or a service related to cannabis under subsection 17(6) of the Act by displaying a brand element of cannabis, of a cannabis accessory or of a service related to cannabis on any thing that is in a school, a public playground, a daycare facility or any other public place frequented mainly by young persons or that is visible from such a place.
A brand element referred to in subsection 17(6) of the Act must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the surface area must be smaller than or equal to 300 cm2; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the height of any letter, character or number must be smaller than or equal to 4 cm.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: common name, in respect of edible cannabis, has the same meaning as in subsection B.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (nom usuel)

Common Names for Ingredients and Components Document means the document entitled Common Names for Ingredients and Components, prepared by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency and published on its website, as amended from time to time. (Document sur les noms usuels d’ingrédients et de constituants)
daily value means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a nutrient set out in column 1 of Part 1 of the Table of Daily Values, as defined in subsection B.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations, the quantity set out in column 3; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a nutrient set out in column 1 of Part 2 of the table referred to in paragraph (a), the quantity set out in column 4. (valeur quotidienne)

Definition.Text: energy value means, in respect of a cannabis product, the amount of energy made available to a person’s body when the chemical components of the cannabis product, including protein, fat, carbohydrate and alcohol, are metabolized following ingestion of the cannabis product by the person. (valeur énergétique)
expiry date means the date, expressed at minimum as a year and month, that is the end of the stability period of a cannabis product. (date limite d’utilisation)

exterior display surface means the area on the exterior surface of an immediate container to which a label is applied and that is visible under customary conditions of purchase or use. (espace extérieur d’affichage)
exterior surface includes a label or an image. (surfaces extérieures)
fat has the same meaning as in subsection B.01.400(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (lipides)
food allergen has the same meaning as in subsection B.01.010.1(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (allergène alimentaire)

food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement means a statement appearing on the label of any container in which edible cannabis — or a cannabis accessory that contains edible cannabis — that is a cannabis product is packaged that indicates the source of a food allergen or gluten that is present in the cannabis product or the presence in the cannabis product of added sulphites in an amount of 10 p.p.m. or more. (mention des sources d’allergènes alimentaires ou de gluten et des sulfites ajoutés)
gluten has the same meaning as in subsection B.01.010.1(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (gluten)
INCI name has the same meaning as in subsection 2(1) of the Cosmetic Regulations. (appellation INCI)
label does not include inserts or leaflets referred to in subsection 132(1), nor does it include a panel referred to in subsection 132.27(1). (étiquette)
p.p.m. means parts per million by weight. (p.p.m.)
principal display panel has the same meaning as in subsection 2(2) of the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations. (espace principal)

saturated fatty acids, saturated fat, saturates or saturated has the same meaning as in subsection B.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (acides gras saturés, graisses saturées, gras saturés, lipides saturés ou saturés)

standardized cannabis symbol means the symbol set out in the document entitled Standardized Cannabis Symbol, as amended from time to time and published by the Government of Canada on its website. (symbole normalisé du cannabis)
sugars-based ingredient has the same meaning as in subsection B.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (ingrédient à base de sucres)
sulphites means one or more of the following food additives:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: potassium bisulphite;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: potassium metabisulphite;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sodium bisulphite;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: sodium dithionite;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: sodium metabisulphite;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: sodium sulphite;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: sulphur dioxide; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: sulphurous acid. (sulfites)

Definition.Text: trans fatty acids, trans fat or trans has the same meaning as in subsection B.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (acides gras trans, graisses trans, gras trans, lipides trans ou trans)

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of sections 112 to 117, 121 and 132.13, subsections 132.27(2) to (7) and (9) and sections 132.28 to 132.32, panel means a panel referred to in subsection 132.27(1).

Section.MarginalNote: Requirement — sale and distribution of cannabis product

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence must not sell or distribute a cannabis product unless the applicable requirements set out in sections 108 to 136 have been met.
A holder of a licence must not export a cannabis product unless the requirements set out in paragraph 123(1)(a) and subparagraphs 123(1)(c)(ii) and (iv) have been met.

Section.Text: The requirements set out in this Part do not apply in respect of a shipping container.

Subsection.Text: The immediate container in which a cannabis product, other than a cannabis plant or cannabis plant seeds, is packaged must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be opaque or translucent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: prevent contamination of the cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of dried cannabis, or a cannabis accessory that contains dried cannabis, keep the cannabis dry;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: have a security feature that provides reasonable assurance to consumers that it has not been opened prior to receipt;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: meet the requirements of a child resistant package under subsections C.01.001(2) to (4) of the Food and Drug Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: not contain more than the equivalent of 30 g of dried cannabis, as determined in accordance with subsection 2(4) of the Act.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(a), the immediate container in which dried cannabis or fresh cannabis is packaged may be transparent.

Section.MarginalNote: Cannabis plant — not budding or flowering

Subsection.Text: A cannabis plant must not be budding or flowering at the time of packaging.
The container in which a cannabis plant is packaged must not contain more than four cannabis plants.

Section.Text: The immediate container in which cannabis plant seeds are packaged must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: keep the cannabis plant seeds dry; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not contain more than the equivalent of 30 g of dried cannabis, as determined in accordance with subsection 2(4) of the Act.

Section.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, the interior surface and exterior surface of any container in which a cannabis product is packaged must not display any brand element.

Except as otherwise provided under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any provincial Act, the interior surface, exterior surface and panel of any container in which a cannabis product is packaged must not display any image.

Subsection.Text: Except as otherwise provided under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any provincial Act, the colour of the interior surface, exterior surface and panel of any container in which a cannabis product is packaged must be one uniform colour.
Despite subsection (1), the following may be different:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the colour of each surface and the panel; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the colour of the container and the lid or cap of the container.

Subsection.Text: The colour of the interior surface, exterior surface and panel must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it must not have the lustre of metal or have metallic properties in the ink, such as Pantone Metallics or Pantone Premium Metallics;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it must not be fluorescent, have fluorescent properties in the ink or have pigments that absorb ultraviolet energy and transmit it as a longer wavelength, such as the Pantone 800 series; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: it must create a contrast with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the yellow colour of the background of the health warning message, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the red colour of the standardized cannabis symbol.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (2),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an interior surface that is made of metal may be the colour of the metal; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an exterior surface of an immediate container that is made of metal, excluding the label or any image, may be the colour of the metal.

Subsection.Text: Except as otherwise provided under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any provincial Act, the interior surface, exterior surface and panel of any container in which a cannabis product is packaged and any covering of such a container must have a smooth texture without any raised features, embossing, decorative ridges, bulges or other irregularities.
Subsection (1) does not apply to the features of a container that are necessary to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: facilitate the opening and closing of the container; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: assist visually impaired individuals.

Subsection.Text: The interior surface, exterior surface and panel of any container in which a cannabis product is packaged and any covering of such a container must not include any hidden feature that is designed to change the appearance of the container, covering or panel, such as heat-activated ink or a feature that is visible only through technological means, except a bar code or a feature that is used to prevent counterfeiting.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Feature designed to change surface area
Subsection.Text: Subject to section 132.27, the interior surface and exterior surface of any container in which a cannabis product is packaged and any covering of such a container must not include any feature that is designed to change the surface area of the container or covering, such as a fold-out panel.

Section.Text: The interior surface, exterior surface and panel of any container in which a cannabis product is packaged and any covering of such a container must not be capable of emitting a scent or sound.
The covering of any container in which a cannabis product is packaged must not display any brand element.

Except as otherwise provided under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any provincial Act, the covering of any container in which a cannabis product is packaged must not display any image or information.

Except as otherwise provided under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any provincial Act, the covering of any container in which a cannabis product is packaged must be transparent and colourless.

Subsection.Text: The interior surface, exterior surface and panel of any container in which a cannabis product is packaged must not include any cut-out window.
Despite subsection (1), any container in which dried cannabis, fresh cannabis or cannabis plant seeds are packaged may include cut-out windows.
One or two bar codes may be displayed, only once each, on any container in which a cannabis product is packaged.
Every bar code must be printed in black and white.

Section.Text: A wrapper may be used with respect to a cannabis product only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is in direct contact with the cannabis or the cannabis accessory and with one or both of the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the immediate container of the cannabis product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a wrapper that is in direct contact with the cannabis or the cannabis accessory; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is required to maintain the quality or stability of the cannabis product.

Section.Text: The following immediate container and wrappers must meet the requirements set out in Division 23 of Part B of the Food and Drug Regulations and subparagraphs 186(a)(i), (ii) and (v) to (vii) of the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations as if the cannabis that the immediate container contains or with which the wrappers are in direct contact were a food for the purposes of that Division and those subparagraphs:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the immediate container in which edible cannabis — or a cannabis accessory that contains edible cannabis — that is a cannabis product is packaged;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any wrapper that is in direct contact with edible cannabis — or a cannabis accessory that contains edible cannabis — that is a cannabis product; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any wrapper that is in direct contact with a cannabis extract that is intended for ingestion — or a cannabis accessory that contains cannabis extract intended for ingestion — that is a cannabis product.

Section.Text: The immediate container of a cannabis extract that is a cannabis product must not contain more than 90 mL of extract that is in non-solid form at a temperature of 22 ± 2°C.

Subsection.Text: The outermost container in which a cannabis product is packaged must not contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: more than one class of cannabis set out in Schedule 4 to the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: more than one immediate container.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(c), the outermost container may contain more than one immediate container if the following requirements are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of dried cannabis or fresh cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the outermost container,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: meets the requirements of section 124, if it contains cannabis that is in discrete units and that is not intended to be consumed by means of inhalation,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: meets the requirements of section 124.1, if it contains cannabis that is in discrete units and that is intended to be consumed by means of inhalation, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: despite section 125, meets the requirements of section 124.1 if it contains cannabis that is not in discrete units, as if it were in discrete units;

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the immediate containers meet the requirements of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: section 124, if they contain cannabis that is in discrete units and that is not intended to be consumed by means of inhalation,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: section 124.1, if they contain cannabis that is in discrete units and that is intended to be consumed by means of inhalation, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: section 125, if they contain cannabis that is not in discrete units;

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis contained in the outermost container does not exceed the equivalent of 30 g of dried cannabis, as determined in accordance with subsection 2(4) of the Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the properties of the cannabis are consistent in all immediate containers;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a cannabis extract,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the outermost container,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: meets the requirements of section 132.1, if it contains cannabis that is in discrete units and that is not intended to be consumed by means of inhalation,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: meets the requirements of section 132.11, if it contains cannabis that is in discrete units and that is intended to be consumed by means of inhalation, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: despite section 132.12, meets the requirements of section 132.11 if it contains cannabis that is not in discrete units, as if it were in discrete units;

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the immediate containers meet the requirements of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: section 132.1, if they contain cannabis that is in discrete units and that is not intended to be consumed by means of inhalation,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: section 132.11, if they contain cannabis that is in discrete units and that is intended to be consumed by means of inhalation, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: section 132.12, if they contain cannabis that is not in discrete units;

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis contained in the outermost container does not exceed the equivalent of 30 g of dried cannabis, as determined in accordance with subsection 2(4) of the Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the properties of the cannabis are consistent in all the immediate containers;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a cannabis topical,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the outermost container,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: meets the requirements of section 132.15, if it contains cannabis that is in discrete units, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: despite section 132.16, meets the requirements of section 132.15 if it contains cannabis that is not in discrete units, as if it were in discrete units;

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the immediate containers meet the requirements, of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: section 132.15, if they contain cannabis that is in discrete units, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: section 132.16, if they contain cannabis that is not in discrete units;

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis contained in the outermost container does not exceed the equivalent of 30 g of dried cannabis, as determined in accordance with subsection 2(4) of the Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the properties of the cannabis are consistent in all the immediate containers;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of edible cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the outermost container,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: meets the requirements of section 132.18, if it contains cannabis that is in discrete units, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: despite section 132.19, meets the requirements of section 132.18 if it contains cannabis that is not in discrete units, as if it were in discrete units;

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the immediate containers meet the requirements, of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: section 132.18, if they contain cannabis that is in discrete units, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: section 132.19, if they contain cannabis that is not in discrete units;

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis contained in the outermost container does not exceed the equivalent of 30 g of dried cannabis, as determined in accordance with subsection 2(4) of the Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the properties of the cannabis are consistent in all the immediate containers.

Subsection.Text: References to “unit” are to be read as references to “immediate container”

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of subparagraph (2)(a)(i), in paragraphs 124(1)(b) and (c) and 124.1(b) and (c);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of subparagraph (2)(b)(i), in paragraphs 132.1(1)(b) and (c) and 132.11(b) and (c);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of clause (2)(c)(i)(A), in paragraphs 132.15(b) and (c);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of clause (2)(c)(i)(B), in paragraphs 132.15(b), (c), (e) and (g);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of clause (2)(d)(i)(A), in paragraph 132.18(1)(b); and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of clause (2)(d)(i)(B), in paragraphs 132.18(1)(b), (d), and (h).

Section.MarginalNote: Control measures for dispensing cannabis extract

Subsection.Text: The immediate container of a cannabis extract that is a cannabis product and that is not in discrete units must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not permit the extract to be easily poured or drunk directly from the container; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contain an integrated dispensing mechanism that dispenses no more than 10 mg of THC per activation, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC, if the cannabis extract

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is in liquid form at a temperature of 22 ± 2°C,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is not intended to be consumed only by means of inhalation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: contains at least 10 mg of THC, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph (1)(b) does not apply to an immediate container in which a cannabis accessory referred to in paragraph 103.2(a) is packaged.
The following information must be included on the label that is applied to any container in which a cannabis product is packaged:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, telephone number and email address of the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a cannabis plant or cannabis plant seeds, the holder of a licence for cultivation that cultivated the cannabis plant or cannabis plant seeds, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of any other cannabis product, the holder of a licence for processing that manufactured the product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the class of cannabis set out in Schedule 4 to the Act to which the cannabis that is in the immediate container belongs;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the product

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the lot number, preceded by one of the following designations:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: “Lot number”,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: “Lot no.”,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: “Lot”, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the recommended storage conditions, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the packaging date;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the warning “KEEP OUT OF REACH OF CHILDREN / TENIR HORS DE LA PORTÉE DES ENFANTS”;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: one of the health warning messages set out in the document entitled Cannabis Health Warning Messages, as amended from time to time and published by the Government of Canada on its website, that applies to the cannabis product; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a cannabis product that contains THC in a concentration greater than 10 μg/g, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC, the standardized cannabis symbol that must be obtained from the Minister in the form of an electronic file.

Subsection.Text: Despite subparagraph (1)(c)(iv), the packaging date that is included on the label that is applied to the container may differ from the date on which the cannabis product is packaged if the product is packaged no more than seven days before or after the packaging date that is included on the label.

In the case of an outermost container that contains multiple immediate containers in accordance with subsection 122.4(2), the outermost container is exempt from the requirement of subparagraph (1)(c)(iv).

The health warning messages referred to in paragraph (1)(e) must be displayed in rotation on each type of container of each brand name of the cannabis product that is packaged in a year, so that each health warning message is displayed, to the extent possible, on equal numbers of containers of that product.
Sections 26 and 27 of the Act do not apply with respect to the name and email address that are included on the label in accordance with paragraph (1)(a).

Despite paragraph 123(1)(e), a health warning message that applies to a cannabis product, as set out in the document entitled Cannabis Health Warning Messages as it read immediately before the day on which the amended version of the document is published by the Government of Canada, may be used on the label that is applied to any container in which a cannabis product is packaged for a period of 12 months following the day on which the amended version of the document is published.

The health warning messages referred to in subsection (1) must be displayed in rotation on each type of container of each brand name of the cannabis product that is packaged during the 12-month period referred to in subsection (1), so that each health warning message is displayed, to the extent possible, on equal numbers of containers of that product.

A holder of a licence that is authorized to sell or distribute cannabis is, in respect of the sale or distribution of cannabis products, exempt from the application of subsection 106(1) of these Regulations and from section 25 of the Act if the cannabis products are packaged and labelled in accordance with subsections (1) and (2) and the other applicable provisions of these Regulations.

A person, other than a holder of a licence, that is authorized to sell cannabis is, in respect of the sale of cannabis products, exempt from the application of section 25 of the Act if those products are packaged and labelled in accordance with subsections (1) and (2) and the other applicable provisions of these Regulations.

The label of a container in which cannabis other than edible cannabis is packaged must not include an expiry date unless the holder of the licence for processing that manufactured the cannabis product has data that establishes the stability period during which, after the cannabis is packaged in accordance with these Regulations and stored under its recommended storage conditions,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of dried cannabis or fresh cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it maintains not less than 80% and not more than 120% of its THC content and CBD content, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the microbial and chemical contaminants it contains or has on it remain within the limits referred to subsection 93(3); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a cannabis extract or a cannabis topical,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it maintains its THC content and CBD content within the variability limits referred to in subsection 97(1), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the microbial and chemical contaminants it contains or has on it remain within the limits referred to in section 101.1.

Subsection.Text: The label of a container in which edible cannabis is packaged must not include an expiry date.

The holder of the licence for processing that manufactured the cannabis product must, if they include an expiry date on the label of the container, retain a document that contains the data referred to in subsection (1) for at least two years after the day on which the last sale or distribution of any portion of the lot or batch of the cannabis product with that expiry date takes place, other than for destruction.
The interior and exterior surface of a wrapper must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not display any brand element;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not display any image or information;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be one uniform colour, which may be different for each surface;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: not be fluorescent, have fluorescent properties in the ink or have pigments that absorb ultraviolet energy and transmit it as a longer wavelength, such as the Pantone 800 series;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: have a smooth texture without any embossing or decorative ridges;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: not include any hidden feature that is designed to change the appearance of the wrapper, such as heat-activated ink or a feature that is visible only through technological means; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: not be capable of emitting a scent or sound.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(b), images or information authorized under the Act, any other Act of Parliament, any provincial Act or their regulations may be displayed on the interior or exterior surface of the wrapper.

Despite paragraph (1)(b), the standardized cannabis symbol that must be obtained from the Minister in the form of an electronic file must be clearly and prominently displayed on the exterior surface of any wrapper if the concentration of THC in the cannabis that is in direct contact with the wrapper or that is in the cannabis accessory that is in direct contact with the wrapper is greater than 10 μg/g, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC.
The standardized cannabis symbol must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it must be at least 1.27 cm by 1.27 cm in size;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it must be displayed with a white border of at least 2 points on all sides; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if a change is made to the size of the symbol, its dimensions must be proportional vertically and horizontally.

Section.MarginalNote: Dried cannabis or fresh cannabis — discrete units and not intended for inhalation

Subsection.Text: In the case of dried cannabis or fresh cannabis — or a cannabis accessory that contains dried cannabis or fresh cannabis — that is in discrete units and is not intended to be consumed by means of inhalation, the label of any container in which the cannabis product is packaged must also include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the net weight, in grams, of dried cannabis or fresh cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of units;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the net weight, in grams, of dried cannabis or fresh cannabis in each unit;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of THC, in milligrams, that each unit could yield, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC, preceded by “Total THC per unit”;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of CBD, in milligrams, that each discrete unit could yield, taking into account the potential to convert CBDA into CBD, preceded by “Total CBD per unit”; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the intended use of the cannabis product.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Maximum quantity of THC on label
Subsection.Text: The quantity of THC that is included, in accordance with paragraph (1)(e), on the label of a container in which is packaged dried cannabis or fresh cannabis — or a cannabis accessory that contains dried cannabis or fresh cannabis — that is intended for ingestion or nasal, rectal or vaginal use must not exceed 10 mg.

Section.MarginalNote: Dried cannabis or fresh cannabis — discrete units and intended for inhalation
Section.Text: In the case of dried cannabis or fresh cannabis — or a cannabis accessory that contains dried cannabis or fresh cannabis — that is in discrete units and is intended to be consumed by means of inhalation, the label of any container in which the cannabis product is packaged must also include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the net weight, in grams, of dried cannabis or fresh cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of units;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the net weight, in grams, of dried cannabis or fresh cannabis in each unit;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the concentration of THC, in milligrams per gram, that the dried cannabis or fresh cannabis could yield, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC, preceded by “Total THC”;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the concentration of CBD, in milligrams per gram, that the dried cannabis or fresh cannabis could yield, taking into account the potential to convert CBDA into CBD, preceded by “Total CBD”; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the intended use of the cannabis product.

Section.MarginalNote: Dried cannabis or fresh cannabis — not in discrete units
Section.Text: In the case of dried cannabis or fresh cannabis — or a cannabis accessory that contains dried cannabis or fresh cannabis — that is not in discrete units, the label of any container in which the cannabis product is packaged must also include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the net weight, in grams, of dried cannabis or fresh cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the concentration of THC, in milligrams per gram, that the dried cannabis or fresh cannabis could yield, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC, preceded by “Total THC”; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the concentration of CBD, in milligrams per gram, that the dried cannabis or fresh cannabis could yield, taking into account the potential to convert CBDA into CBD, preceded by “Total CBD”.

Section.Text: In the case of a cannabis plant, the number of plants in the container must be included on the label that is applied to any container in which a cannabis product is packaged.
In the case of cannabis plant seeds, the number of seeds in the container must be included on the label that is applied to any container in which a cannabis product is packaged.

Subsection.Text: All information that is included on a label must be in English and in French, except for the INCI name and the European Union (EU) technical name.
All information that is required to be included on a label must be clearly and prominently displayed and readily discernible under the customary conditions of purchase and use.
All information that is required to be included on a label, other than the brand name, the standardized cannabis symbol and the health warning message must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (e)(ii), it must be in a regular weight and width standard sans serif font, without italics, in the colour black and with leading of at least 7 points;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it must be in one single font type;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (e)(iv), it must be in a type size of at least 6 points and smaller than the type size used for the health warning message;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: it must be on a white background that extends at least 6 points on all sides away from the information; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the information required under paragraphs 124(1)(e) and (g), 124.1(e) and (g), 125(c) and (e), 132.1(1)(e) and (g), 132.11(e) and (g), 132.12(1)(c) and (e), 132.15(e) and (g), 132.16(c) and (e), 132.18(1)(d), (f), (h) and (j) and 132.19(1)(c) and (e), it must be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: displayed on the principal display panel or, if there are separate principal display panels for English and French, on each principal display panel,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in bold type,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: at least 6 points away from any other information, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in a type size of at least 6 points and equal in size or smaller than the type size used for the health warning message.

Subsection.Text: The brand name that is required to be included on a label must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it must be in a type size that is smaller than or equal to the type size used for the health warning message;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it must not be a colour that has the lustre of metal or has metallic properties in the ink, such as Pantone Metallics or Pantone Premium Metallics;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: it must not be a colour that is fluorescent, has fluorescent properties in the ink or has pigments that absorb ultraviolet energy and transmit it as a longer wavelength, such as the Pantone 800 series; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: it must be displayed only once on the principal display panel, or if there are separate principal display panels for English and French, only once on each principal display panel.

Subsection.Text: The standardized cannabis symbol that is required to be included on a label must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it must appear in the upper left 25% of the principal display panel, or if there are separate principal display panels for English and French, in the upper left 25% of each principal display panel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it must be at least 1.27 cm by 1.27 cm in size;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: it must be displayed with a white border of at least 2 points on all sides;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: it must be oriented in such a manner that its text is readable from left to right when the container is displayed or visible under the customary conditions of purchase and use; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if a change is made to the size of the symbol, its dimensions must be proportional vertically and horizontally.

Subsection.Text: The health warning message that is required to be included on a label must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it must be displayed on the principal display panel or, if there are separate principal display panels for English and French, on each principal display panel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subject to paragraphs (c) and (d), it must be in a regular weight and width standard sans serif font, without italics, in the colour black and with leading of at least 8 points;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the word “WARNING” must be in upper case letters and bold type;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the first sentence must be in sentence case letters and bold type;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the second sentence must be in sentence case letters;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: it must be in the same font type as that used for the information referred to in subsection (3);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: it must be in a type size of at least 7 points and the type size must be equal to or larger than the type size used for the brand name;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: it must be within a black border that is a solid line of at least 1 point and that has an inset of at least 6 points on all sides between the message and the border;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the background colour must be yellow with the CMYK value (C=0 M=0 Y=100 K=0);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the message must be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: left-justified without hyphenation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: oriented in such a manner that its text is readable from left to right when the container is displayed or visible under the customary conditions of purchase and use; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where there is one principal display panel, there must be at least 3 points between the English and French message.

Subsection.Text: Any attribution to the source of the health warning message that is included on the label must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: only the following attributions may be displayed:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if there is one principal display panel, the words “Health Canada / Santé Canada”, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if there are separate principal display panels for English and French, the words “Health Canada” for the English display panel and the words “Santé Canada” for the French display panel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it must be in the same font type as that used for the information referred to in subsection (3);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: it must be in a type size of at least 6 points and smaller than the type size used for the health warning message; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: it must be inside the border of the health warning message and be displayed in the bottom right corner below the health warning message text, with leading of at least 7 points.

Subsection.Text: Any other information that is included on the label must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it must be in regular weight and width standard sans serif font, without italics, and in black or white colour; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it must be in a type size that is smaller than or equal to the type size used for the information referred to in subsection (3).

Subsection.Text: A label may include only one brand element, other than a brand name, if that brand element meets the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it must be displayed only once on the principal display panel or, if there are separate principal display panels for English and French, only once on each principal display panel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it must not be a colour that has the lustre of metal or has metallic properties in the ink, such as Pantone Metallics or Pantone Premium Metallics;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: it must not be a colour that is fluorescent, has fluorescent properties in the ink or has pigments that absorb ultraviolet energy and transmit it as a longer wavelength, such as the Pantone 800 series;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the brand element is an image, its surface area must be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case where the standardized cannabis symbol must be included on the label in accordance with paragraph 123(1)(f), smaller than or equal to the surface area of the standardized cannabis symbol, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other case, smaller than or equal to 25% of the principal display panel and smaller than or equal to the surface area within the border that surrounds the health warning message that is included on the label in accordance with paragraph (6)(h); and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the brand element is text only, its type size must be smaller than or equal to the type size used for the health warning message.

Subsection.Text: The label may include an image that is printed in black and white and that provides instructions on how to open the container.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Location of information on irradiation — edible cannabis
Subsection.Text: Information that is required to be included on a label under paragraph 132.18(1)(p) or 132.19(1)(k) must be displayed on the principal display panel or, if there are separate principal display panels for English and French, on each principal display panel.

Section.Text: A representation, such as an illustration, sign, mark, symbol or design, that so closely resembles the standardized cannabis symbol that it is likely to be mistaken for that symbol must not appear on any container in which a cannabis product is packaged.

Subsection.Text: Any container in which a cannabis product is packaged may include, or be accompanied by, one or more inserts or leaflets, as long as the insert or leaflet does not present a risk of contamination of the cannabis product.
All information that is included on an insert or leaflet must be in English and French, except for the INCI name and the European Union (EU) technical name.

Section.MarginalNote: Cannabis extract — discrete units and not intended for inhalation

Subsection.Text: In the case of a cannabis extract — or a cannabis accessory that contains a cannabis extract — that is in discrete units and is not intended to be consumed by means of inhalation, the label of any container in which the cannabis product is packaged must also include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the net weight, in grams, of the cannabis extract;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of units;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the net weight, in grams, of the cannabis extract in each unit;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of THC, in milligrams, that each unit could yield, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC, preceded by “Total THC per unit”;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of CBD, in milligrams, that each unit could yield, taking into account the potential to convert CBDA into CBD, preceded by “Total CBD per unit”;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the ingredients of the cannabis extract;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the name of any food allergen that is present in the cannabis extract, except as a result of cross-contamination;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the identity of the cannabis product in terms of its common name or in terms of its function; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the intended use of the cannabis product.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Maximum quantity of THC on label
Subsection.Text: The quantity of THC that is included on the label, in accordance with paragraph (1)(e), of a container in which is packaged a cannabis extract — or in which is packaged a cannabis accessory that contains a cannabis extract — that is intended for ingestion or nasal, rectal or vaginal use must not exceed 10 mg.

Section.MarginalNote: Cannabis extract — discrete units and intended for inhalation
Section.Text: In the case of a cannabis extract — or a cannabis accessory that contains a cannabis extract — that is in discrete units and is intended to be consumed by means of inhalation, the label of any container in which the cannabis product is packaged must also include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the net weight, in grams, of the cannabis extract;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of units;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the net weight, in grams, of the cannabis extract in each unit;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the concentration of THC, in milligrams per gram, that the cannabis extract could yield, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC, preceded by “Total THC”;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the concentration of CBD, in milligrams per gram, that the cannabis extract could yield, taking into account the potential to convert CBDA into CBD, preceded by “Total CBD”;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the ingredients of the cannabis extract;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the name of any food allergen that is present in the cannabis extract, except as a result of cross-contamination;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the identity of the cannabis product in terms of its common name or in terms of its function; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the intended use of the cannabis product.

Section.MarginalNote: Cannabis extract — not in discrete units

Subsection.Text: In the case of a cannabis extract — or a cannabis accessory that contains a cannabis extract — that is not in discrete units, the label of any container in which the cannabis product is packaged must also include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the net weight, in grams, of the cannabis extract;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the concentration of THC, in milligrams per gram, that the cannabis extract could yield, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC, preceded by “Total THC”;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the concentration of CBD, in milligrams per gram, that the cannabis extract could yield, taking into account the potential to convert CBDA into CBD, preceded by “Total CBD”;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a cannabis accessory that contains a cannabis extract intended for ingestion or nasal, rectal or vaginal use or that is packaged with and is intended to dispense the extract,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of THC, in milligrams, that each activation of the accessory dispenses, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC, preceded by “Total THC per activation”, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of CBD, in milligrams, that each activation of the accessory dispenses, taking into account the potential to convert CBDA into CBD, preceded by “Total CBD per activation”;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the ingredients of the cannabis extract;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the name of any food allergen that is present in the cannabis extract, except as a result of cross-contamination;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the identity of the cannabis product in terms of its common name or in terms of its function; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the intended use of the cannabis product.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Maximum quantity of THC on label
Subsection.Text: The quantity of THC that is included on the label in accordance with subparagraph (1)(f)(i) must not exceed 10 mg.

It is prohibited to display on a cannabis extract that is a cannabis product or on a cannabis accessory that contains a cannabis extract and that is a cannabis product — or on the package of such a cannabis product, on an insert or leaflet that is included in a container in which such a cannabis product is packaged or that accompanies that container or on the label or panel of a container in which such a cannabis product is packaged — an indication or illustration, including a brand element, that could cause a person to believe that the cannabis product has a flavour set out in column 1 of Schedule 3 to the Tobacco and Vaping Products Act, other than the flavour of cannabis.
Subsection (1) does not apply with respect to the name and email address that are included on the label in accordance with paragraph 123(1)(a).
The list of ingredients of a cannabis extract — or of a cannabis accessory that contains a cannabis extract — must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the word “Ingredients” in the English version and the word “Ingrédients” in the French version must appear at the beginning of the list;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no intervening printed, written or graphic material is to appear between the word referred to in paragraph (a) and the first ingredient in the list; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the ingredients must be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: set out in descending order of their proportion of the cannabis extract by weight, determined before the ingredients are combined to form the extract,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of vitamins referred to in subsection 101.3(3), set out by their chemical name,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other case, set out by their common name or chemical name, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: separated from other ingredients by a comma.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Ingredients in proportion of 1% or less
Subsection.Text: Despite subparagraph (1)(c)(i), ingredients that are present in a proportion of 1% or less of the cannabis extract may be listed in any order after the ingredients that are present in a proportion of more than 1% of the cannabis extract.

Despite paragraph (1)(c), in the case where the cannabis extract contains one flavouring agent, it may be shown individually at the end of the list of ingredients by the name “flavouring agent” and in the case where the cannabis extract contains more than one flavouring agent, they may be shown collectively at the end of the list of ingredients by the name “flavouring agents”.

Subsection.MarginalNote: No individual listing of flavouring agent
Subsection.Text: If flavouring agents are shown collectively by the name “flavouring agents” under subsection (3), a flavouring agent must not be shown individually in the list of ingredients.

Section.Text: In the case of a cannabis topical — or a cannabis accessory that contains a cannabis topical — that is in discrete units, the label of any container in which the cannabis product is packaged must also include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the net weight, in grams, of the cannabis topical;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of units;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the net weight, in grams, of the cannabis topical in each unit;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: either the quantity of THC, in milligrams, or the concentration of THC, in milligrams per gram, that each unit could yield, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC, preceded by “Total THC per unit”;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: either the quantity of CBD, in milligrams, or the concentration of CBD, in milligrams per gram, that each unit could yield, taking into account the potential to convert CBDA into CBD, preceded by “Total CBD per unit”;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the ingredients of the cannabis topical;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the identity of the cannabis product in terms of its common name or in terms of its function; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the intended use of the cannabis product.

Section.MarginalNote: Cannabis topical — not in discrete units
Section.Text: In the case of a cannabis topical — or a cannabis accessory that contains a cannabis topical — that is not in discrete units, the label of any container in which the cannabis product is packaged must also include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the net weight, in grams, of the cannabis topical;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: either the quantity of THC, in milligrams, or the concentration of THC, in milligrams per gram, that the cannabis topical could yield, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC, preceded by “Total THC”;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: either the quantity of CBD, in milligrams, or the concentration of CBD, in milligrams per gram, that the cannabis topical could yield, taking into account the potential to convert CBDA into CBD, preceded by “Total CBD”;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the ingredients of the cannabis topical;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the identity of the cannabis product in terms of its common name or in terms of its function; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the intended use of the cannabis product.

Subsection.Text: The list of ingredients of a cannabis topical — or of a cannabis accessory that contains a cannabis topical — must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the word “Ingredients” in the English version and the word “Ingrédients” in the French version must appear at the beginning of the list;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no intervening printed, written or graphic material is to appear between the term referred to in paragraph (a) and the first ingredient in the list; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the ingredients are to be separated from other ingredients by a comma and shown in descending order of their proportion of the cannabis topical by weight, determined before the ingredients are combined to form the cannabis topical, as follows:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by their INCI name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if an ingredient has no INCI name, by its chemical name,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a botanical, by specifying at least the genus and species portions of its INCI name or, if it has no INCI name, by its chemical name, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if an ingredient is included in the schedule to the Cosmetic Regulations, by its EU technical name set out in column 1 of that schedule, or by the appropriate INCI name set out in column 2 of that schedule and the appropriate French equivalent set out in column 3 of that schedule.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Ingredients in proportion of 1% or less
Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(c), ingredients that are present in a proportion of 1% or less and all colouring agents of the cannabis topical may be listed in any order after the ingredients that are present in a proportion of more than 1% of the cannabis topical.

The word “parfum” or “aroma”, respectively, may be inserted at the end of the list of ingredients to indicate that an ingredient has been added to the cannabis topical to produce a fragrance or flavour.

For the purposes of this section, botanical means an ingredient that is directly derived from a plant and that has not been chemically modified before it is used in the production of a cannabis topical.

In the case of edible cannabis — or a cannabis accessory that contains edible cannabis — that is in discrete units, the label of any container in which the cannabis product is packaged must also include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the edible cannabis is in solid form, its net weight, in grams, and in any other case, its net volume, in millilitres;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of units;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of THC, in milligrams, that each unit could yield, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC, preceded by “Total THC per unit”;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of THC, in milligrams, that the edible cannabis could yield, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC, preceded by “Total THC”;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of CBD, in milligrams, that each unit could yield, taking into account the potential to convert CBDA into CBD, preceded by “Total CBD per unit”;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of CBD, in milligrams, that the edible cannabis could yield, taking into account the potential to convert CBDA into CBD, preceded by “Total CBD”;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the ingredients of the edible cannabis, including constituents, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the source of any food allergen or gluten present in the edible cannabis, except as a result of cross-contamination,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement, if the food allergen or gluten

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: is, or is present in, an ingredient that is not shown in the list of ingredients, but is not a constituent of that ingredient or present in a constituent of that ingredient, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: is, or is present in, a constituent and neither the constituent nor the ingredient in which it is present is shown in the list of ingredients, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in all other cases, either in the list of ingredients or in a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the sulphites that are present in the edible cannabis in an amount of 10 p.p.m. or more,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if at least one sulphite is required to be shown in the list of ingredients under these Regulations, in the list of ingredients, or in the list of ingredients and in a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other case, in the list of ingredients, in a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement or in both;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: a nutrition facts table that contains only the information set out in column 1 of the table to section 132.22, expressed using a description set out in column 2, in the unit set out in column 3 and in the manner set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: the common name of the cannabis product;

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: if the edible cannabis is irradiated under section 102.6, the symbol set out in subsection B.01.035(5) of the Food and Drug Regulations and one of the following statements or a statement that has the same meaning:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: “treated with radiation”,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: “treated by irradiation”, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: “irradiated”; and

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: if an irradiated food referred to in column 1 of the table to Division 26 of Part B of the Food and Drug Regulations is an ingredient or constituent of the edible cannabis and constitutes 10% or more of the edible cannabis, the statement “irradiated” preceding any mention of the ingredient or constituent on the label.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Maximum quantity of THC on label
Subsection.Text: The quantity of THC that is included on the label of an immediate container in accordance with paragraph (1)(f) must not exceed 10 mg.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Ingredient not required to be listed
Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(k), if one or more constituents of an ingredient are required by these Regulations to be listed in a list of ingredients, the ingredient is not required to be listed if all constituents of the ingredient are shown in the list by their common names and in accordance with subparagraphs 132.21(1)(c)(i) and (ii).

Despite paragraph (1)(l), the source of a food allergen or gluten must be shown on the label if it includes a declaration alerting consumers that, due to a risk of cross-contamination, the edible cannabis may contain the source of a food allergen or gluten.

Section.MarginalNote: Edible cannabis — not in discrete units

Subsection.Text: In the case of edible cannabis — or a cannabis accessory that contains edible cannabis — that is not in discrete units, the label of any container in which the cannabis product is packaged must also include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the edible cannabis is in solid form, its net weight, in grams, and in any other case, its net volume, in millilitres;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of THC, in milligrams, that the edible cannabis could yield, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC, preceded by “Total THC”;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of CBD, in milligrams, that the edible cannabis could yield, taking into account the potential to convert CBDA into CBD, preceded by “Total CBD”;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the ingredients of the edible cannabis, including constituents, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the source of any food allergen or gluten present in the edible cannabis, except as a result of cross-contamination,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement, if the food allergen or gluten

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: is, or is present in, an ingredient that is not shown in the list of ingredients, but is not a constituent of that ingredient or present in a constituent of that ingredient, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: is, or is present in, a constituent and neither the constituent nor the ingredient in which it is present is shown in the list of ingredients, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in all other cases, either in the list of ingredients or in a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the sulphites that are present in the edible cannabis in an amount of 10 p.p.m. or more,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if at least one sulphite is required to be shown in the list of ingredients under these Regulations, in the list of ingredients, or in the list of ingredients and in a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other case, in the list of ingredients, in a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement or in both;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a nutrition facts table that contains only the information set out in column 1 of the table to section 132.22, expressed using a description set out in column 2, in the unit set out in column 3 and in the manner set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the common name of the cannabis product;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: if the edible cannabis is irradiated under section 102.6, the symbol set out in subsection B.01.035(5) of the Food and Drug Regulations and one of the following statements or a statement that has the same meaning:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: “treated with radiation”,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: “treated by irradiation”, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: “irradiated”; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: if an irradiated food referred to in column 1 of the table to Division 26 of Part B of the Food and Drug Regulations is an ingredient or constituent of the edible cannabis and constitutes 10% or more of the edible cannabis, the statement “irradiated” preceding any mention of the ingredient or constituent on the label.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Maximum quantity of THC on label
Subsection.Text: The quantity of THC that is included on the label in accordance with paragraph (1)(c) must not exceed 10 mg.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Ingredient not required to be listed
Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(f), if one or more constituents of an ingredient are required by these Regulations to be listed in a list of ingredients, the ingredient is not required to be listed if all constituents of the ingredient are shown in the list by their common names and in accordance with subparagraphs 132.21(1)(c)(i) and (ii).

Despite paragraph (1)(g), the source of a food allergen or gluten must be shown on the label if it includes a declaration alerting consumers that, due to a risk of cross-contamination, the edible cannabis may contain the source of a food allergen or gluten.
In the case of edible cannabis having a durable life of 90 days or less, the durable life date must be shown on the label of any container in which the edible cannabis is packaged.
Any durable life date on the label of any container in which edible cannabis is packaged must be shown in accordance with subsections B.01.007(4) and (5) of the Food and Drug Regulations.
The list of ingredients of edible cannabis — or of a cannabis accessory that contains edible cannabis — must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the word “Ingredients” in the English version and the word “Ingrédients” in the French version must appear at the beginning of the list;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no intervening printed, written or graphic material is to appear between the word referred to in paragraph (a) and the first ingredient in the list;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the ingredients and constituents must be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: set out in descending order of their proportion of the edible cannabis by weight, determined before the ingredients and the constituents are combined to form the edible cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: separated from other ingredients or constituents by a comma, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: set out by the applicable name set out in column 2 of Table 1 of the Common Names for Ingredients and Components Document or, if none applies, by their common name;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the constituents of an ingredient must be shown

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: set out in parentheses, immediately after the ingredient, unless the source of a food allergen or gluten is set out immediately after the ingredient, in which case the constituent of the ingredient must be set out immediately after that source,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: set out in descending order of their proportion of the ingredient by weight, determined before they are combined to form the edible cannabis, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: separated from other constituents by a comma;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the source of a food allergen or gluten must be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: set out in parentheses,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: set out immediately after an ingredient that is shown in that list, if the food allergen or gluten

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: is the ingredient,

Clause.Label: (B)
