Clause.Text: is present in the ingredient, but is not a constituent of or present in a constituent of that ingredient, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: is, or is present in, a constituent of the ingredient and the constituent is not shown in the list of ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: set out immediately after the constituent that is shown in the list, if the food allergen or gluten is that constituent or is present in that constituent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: separated by a comma from other sources of a food allergen or gluten that is shown for the same ingredient or constituent;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: sulphites must be shown

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: set out by one of the common names “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents”, or individually by the applicable name set out in the applicable item, column 1 of the applicable Table of the Common Names for Ingredients and Components Document,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of the name “sodium dithionite”, “sulphur dioxide” or “sulphurous acid”, set out by that name, followed by one of the common names “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents” in parentheses, unless

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the word “sulfite” or “sulphite” appears in the common name of another sulphite in the list,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: one of the common names “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents” is set out in parentheses following another sulphite in the list, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: one of the common names “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents” is shown in a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement on the label, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: set out at the end of the list where they may be shown in any order with the other ingredients that are shown at the end of that list in accordance with subsection (3) or in parentheses immediately after the ingredient of which they are a constituent; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the edible cannabis contains one or more sugars-based ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the word “Sugars” in the English version of the list and the word “Sucres” in the French version of the list must appear

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: despite subparagraph (c)(i), in descending order of the proportion of all the sugars-based ingredients in the edible cannabis by weight, determined before they are combined to form the edible cannabis, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: separated from other ingredients by a comma, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: each sugars-based ingredient must be shown

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: set out in parentheses, immediately following the word “Sugars” in the English version of the list and the word “Sucres” in the French version of the list,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: set out in descending order of its proportion of the edible cannabis by weight, determined before it is combined to form the edible cannabis, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: separated from other sugars-based ingredients by a comma.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — ingredients and constituents shown collectively
Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(c), the ingredients and the constituents set out in column 1 of Table 2 of the Common Names for Ingredients and Components Document may be shown collectively in the list of ingredients by the common name set out in column 2 of that Table, unless one of the ingredients or constituents in column 1 is shown separately in the list of ingredients by its common name.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — ingredients at the end of the list
Subsection.Text: Despite subparagraph (1)(c)(i), the ingredients referred to in subsection B.01.008.2(4) of the Food and Drug Regulations, regardless of their proportion, may be listed at the end of the list of ingredients, in any order.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — source of food allergen or gluten
Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(e), the source of the food allergen or gluten is not required to be set out in parentheses immediately after the ingredient or constituent, as the case may be, if the source of the food allergen or gluten appears

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the list of ingredients

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: as part of the common name of the ingredient or constituent, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in parentheses, in accordance with subparagraph (1)(e)(i), immediately after another ingredient or constituent; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement.

Subsection.Text: The percentage of the daily value for a nutrient shown in the nutrition facts table on the label of any container in which edible cannabis is packaged must be established on the basis of the amount, by weight, of the nutrient per immediate container of edible cannabis, rounded off in the applicable manner set out in column 4 of the table to this section.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Not a significant source of a nutrient
Subsection.Text: Information with respect to a nutrient set out in column 1 of the table to this section that may be expressed as “0” in the nutrition facts table may be omitted from that table if it includes the statement “Not a significant source of (naming each nutrient that is omitted from the nutrition facts table in accordance with this subsection)”.

Despite section 130, the nutrition facts table must be presented in accordance with the format specified in the applicable figure in the Directory of Nutrition Facts Table Formats for Edible Cannabis, as amended from time to time and published by the Government of Canada on its website, having regard to matters such as order of presentation, dimensions, spacing and use of upper and lower case letters and bold type.

Section.MarginalNote: Presentation of source of food allergen

Subsection.Text: The source of a food allergen required to be shown in the list of ingredients or in the food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement under paragraph 132.18(1)(l) or 132.19(1)(g) must be set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from a food referred to in one of paragraphs (a), (b) and (e) of the definition food allergen in subsection B.01.010.1(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations or derived from that food, by the name of the food as shown in the applicable paragraph, expressed in the singular or plural;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from the food referred to in paragraph (c) of the definition food allergen in subsection B.01.010.1(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations or derived from that food, by the name “sesame”, “sesame seed” or “sesame seeds”;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from a food referred to in paragraph (d) or (f) of the definition food allergen in subsection B.01.010.1(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations or derived from that food, by the name of the food as shown in the applicable paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from the food referred to in paragraph (g) of the definition food allergen in subsection B.01.010.1(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations or derived from that food, by the name “soy”, “soya”, “soybean” or “soybeans”;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from a food referred to in one of paragraphs (h) to (j) of the definition food allergen in subsection B.01.010.1(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations or derived from that food, by the common name of the food set out in the applicable item, column 2 of the applicable Table of the Common Names for Ingredients and Components Document; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from the food referred to in paragraph (k) of the definition food allergen in subsection B.01.010.1(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations or derived from that food, by the name “mustard”, “mustard seed” or “mustard seeds”.

Subsection.Text: The source of gluten required to be shown in the list of ingredients or in the food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement under paragraph 132.18(1)(l) or 132.19(1)(g) must be set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for gluten from the grain of a cereal referred to in one of subparagraphs (a)(i) to (v) of the definition gluten in subsection B.01.010.1(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations or derived from that grain, by the name of the cereal as shown in the applicable subparagraph; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for gluten from the grain of a hybridized strain created from one or more of the cereals referred to in subparagraphs (a)(i) to (v) of the definition gluten in subsection B.01.010.1(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations or derived from that grain, by the names of the cereals as shown in the applicable subparagraphs.

Section.Text: If the label of the container in which edible cannabis is packaged includes a declaration alerting consumers that, due to a risk of cross-contamination, the edible cannabis may contain the source of a food allergen or gluten, the declaration must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it must be shown immediately after the food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement or, if there is none, immediately after the list of ingredients, and must appear on the same continuous surface as the statement, if any, and the list of ingredients; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no intervening printed, written or graphic material is to appear between it and the list of ingredients or statement that immediately precedes it.

Subsection.Text: A food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the word “Contains” in the English version and the word “Contient” in the French version must appear at the beginning of the list;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no intervening printed, written or graphic material is to appear between the word referred to in paragraph (a) and the rest of the statement;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: it must appear on the same continuous surface as the list of ingredients; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: it must include, even if any of the following information is also shown in the list of ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the source of each food allergen that is present in the edible cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: each source of any gluten that is present in the edible cannabis, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: one of the common names “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents”, if the total amount of sulphites present in the edible cannabis is 10 p.p.m. or more.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(d), the following information is not required to be shown in the statement more than once:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the same source of a food allergen;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the same source of gluten; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: one of the common names “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents”.

Section.MarginalNote: Constituents not required to be shown on label

Subsection.Text: Constituents of ingredients or of classes of ingredients set out in the table to subsection B.01.009(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations are not required to be shown on the label of a container in which edible cannabis — or a cannabis accessory that contains edible cannabis — that is a cannabis product is packaged.

Subject to subsection (3), if a preparation or mixture set out in the table to subsection B.01.009(2) of the Food and Drug Regulations is used to produce edible cannabis, the ingredients and constituents of the preparation or mixture are not required to be shown on the label of the container in which edible cannabis — or a cannabis accessory that contains edible cannabis — that is a cannabis product is packaged.

If a preparation or mixture set out in the table to subsection B.01.009(2) of the Food and Drug Regulations is used to produce edible cannabis and the preparation or mixture has one or more of the ingredients or constituents listed in subsection B.01.009(3) of the Food and Drug Regulations, those ingredients or constituents must be shown by their common names in the list of the ingredients of the edible cannabis to which they are added as if they were ingredients of that edible cannabis.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Constituents required to be shown in list of ingredients
Subsection.Text: Despite subsections (1) and (2), if any of the constituents listed in subsection B.01.009(4) of the Food and Drug Regulations is contained in an ingredient of edible cannabis set out in a table referred to in subsection (1) or (2), that constituent must be shown in the list of ingredients.

A label of an immediate container in which a cannabis product is packaged may extend beyond the exterior display surface, or a peel-back or accordion panel may be applied to the immediate container, to ensure that all the required information to be included on the label in accordance with these Regulations is displayed on the label or panel.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Label or panel not easily removed
Subsection.Text: The label that extends beyond the exterior display surface and the panel must be applied in a manner that they cannot be easily removed from the immediate container.
The panel must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be able to be resealed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: withstand repeated openings and closings without detaching from the immediate container under customary conditions of use; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: include any of the following information that is not included on the label:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the class of cannabis set out in Schedule 4 to the Act to which the cannabis that is in the immediate container belongs,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the recommended storage conditions,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the packaging date,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the list of ingredients of the cannabis product, including constituents, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of dried cannabis or fresh cannabis, the net weight,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a cannabis extract,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the net weight, including the net weight of cannabis extract in each unit, if the cannabis extract is in discrete units,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the quantity of THC and CBD that is dispensed with each activation of any cannabis accessory that is packaged with or contains the cannabis extract, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the name of any food allergen that is present in the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a cannabis topical, its net weight, including the net weight of cannabis topical in each unit, if the cannabis topical is in discrete units, and

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of edible cannabis,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: if the edible cannabis is in solid form, its net weight, and in any other case, its net volume,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the durable life date,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the source of any food allergen or gluten present in the edible cannabis, except as a result of cross-contamination,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: sulphites that are present in the edible cannabis in an amount of 10 p.p.m. or more, and

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: the nutrition facts table.

Subsection.Text: Despite subparagraph 132.27(3)(c)(iii), the packaging date that is included on the panel may differ from the date on which the cannabis product is packaged if the product is packaged no more than seven days before or after the packaging date that is included on the panel.
The information included on the panel must be shown in accordance with the provisions of these Regulations with respect to a label as if the panel were a label for the purposes of those provisions.
The panel must not display any brand element.

The label of an immediate container in which a cannabis product is packaged and to which a panel is applied must include a statement that clearly indicates the location of any information required under these Regulations that is not included on the label.
The label referred to in subsection (6) may include an image that is printed in black and white and that provides instructions on how to open the panel.
In addition to the information that is required under these Regulations, the label referred to in subsection (6) may include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: bar codes, in accordance with section 122;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a brand element, in accordance with subsection (9); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an image, in accordance with subsection 130(10).

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraphs 130(9)(d) and (e), a brand element included on a label that extends beyond the exterior display surface or on a label of a container to which a panel is applied must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the brand element is an image, be 1.27 cm by 1.27 cm in size or smaller; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the brand element is text only, be in a type size that is 7 points or smaller.

Section.MarginalNote: Prohibited representation — health and cosmetic benefits
Section.Text: It is prohibited to make an express or implied representation, including by way of a brand element, on a cannabis product — or on the package of a cannabis product, on an insert or leaflet that is included in a container in which such a cannabis product is packaged or that accompanies that container or on the label or panel of a container in which such a cannabis product is packaged — if there are reasonable grounds to believe that the representation could create the impression that health or cosmetic benefits may be derived from the use of the cannabis product.

Section.MarginalNote: Prohibited representation — energy value and amount of nutrient

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited to make an express or implied representation, including by way of a brand element, on edible cannabis that is a cannabis product or on a cannabis accessory that contains edible cannabis and that is a cannabis product — or on the package of such a cannabis product, on an insert or leaflet that is included in a container in which such a cannabis product is packaged or that accompanies that container or on the label or panel of a container in which such a cannabis product is packaged — concerning the energy value referred to in item 2 of the table to section 132.22 or the amount of any nutrient referred to in items 3 to 15 of that table or in items 5 to 37 of the table to section B.01.402 of the Food and Drug Regulations.
For greater certainty, subsection (1) does not limit the application of paragraphs 132.18(1)(n) and 132.19(1)(i).

Section.Text: It is prohibited to make an express or implied representation, including by way of a brand element, on edible cannabis that is a cannabis product or on a cannabis accessory that contains edible cannabis and that is a cannabis product — or on the package of such a cannabis product, on an insert or leaflet that is included in a container in which such a cannabis product is packaged or that accompanies that container or on the label or panel of a container in which such a cannabis product is packaged — if there are reasonable grounds to believe that the representation could create the impression that the cannabis product is intended

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to meet the particular dietary requirements of an individual

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: who has a physical or physiological condition as a result of a disease, disorder or injury, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for whom a particular effect, including weight loss, is to be obtained by a controlled intake of food; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to meet the dietary requirements of young persons.

Section.Text: It is prohibited to make an express or implied representation, including by way of a brand element, on a cannabis product — or on the package of a cannabis product, on an insert or leaflet that is included in a container in which such a cannabis product is packaged or that accompanies that container or on the label or panel of a container in which such a cannabis product is packaged — if there are reasonable grounds to believe that the representation could associate the cannabis product with an alcoholic beverage.

Section.MarginalNote: Prohibited representation — tobacco products and vaping products
Section.Text: It is prohibited to make an express or implied representation, including by way of a brand element, on a cannabis product — or on the package of a cannabis product, on an insert or leaflet that is included in a container in which such a cannabis product is packaged or that accompanies that container or on the label or panel of a container in which such a cannabis product is packaged — if there are reasonable grounds to believe that the representation could associate the cannabis product with a tobacco product, as defined in section 2 of the Tobacco and Vaping Products Act, or a vaping product to which that Act applies.
Section 132.28, subsection 132.29(1) and sections 132.3 to 132.32 do not apply with respect to the name and email address that are included on the label in accordance with paragraph 123(1)(a).

Section.MarginalNote: Standardized cannabis symbol on cannabis product intended for inhalation

Subsection.Text: The standardized cannabis symbol that must be obtained from the Minister in the form of an electronic file must be clearly and prominently displayed on the outer surface of a cannabis accessory that contains a cannabis extract and that is a cannabis product intended to be consumed by means of inhalation if the cannabis extract contains THC in a concentration greater than 10 μg/g, taking into account the potential to convert THCA into THC.
The standardized cannabis symbol must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it must be at least 1.27 cm by 1.27 cm in size;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it must be displayed with a white border of at least 2 points on all sides; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if a change is made to the size of the symbol, its dimensions must be proportional vertically and horizontally.

Section.Text: The net weight and volume that must be included on the label of a cannabis product in accordance with sections 124, 124.1, 125, 132.1, 132.11, 132.12, 132.15, 132.16, 132.18 and 132.19 must be within the tolerance limits set out for that product in the document entitled Tolerance Limits for the Net Weight and Volume Declared on Cannabis Product Labelling, as amended from time to time and published by the Government of Canada on its website.
The number of discrete units in a container that is labelled in accordance with sections 124, 124.1, 132.1, 132.11, 132.15 and 132.18 must be equal to the number specified on the label.

The number of immediate containers in an outermost container that is labelled in accordance with subparagraphs 122.4(2)(a)(i), (b)(i), (c)(i) and (d)(i) must be equal to the number of immediate containers specified on the label.
The number of cannabis plants in a container that is labelled in accordance with section 128 must be equal to the number specified on the label.
The number of cannabis plant seeds in a container that is labelled in accordance with section 129 must be equal to the number specified on the label.

Heading.TitleText: Labelling — Cannabis Other than Cannabis Products

Section.MarginalNote: Requirement — cannabis other than a cannabis product
Section.Text: Unless the requirements in section 138 have been met,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a licence for processing, a holder of a licence for analytical testing and the individuals referred to in section 4 must not sell or distribute a reference standard; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a licence must not export a reference standard or sell, distribute or export any other cannabis that is not a cannabis product.

Subsection.Text: A label that includes the following information must be applied to any container that contains cannabis, other than a cannabis product:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, telephone number and email address of the holder of the licence that sells, distributes or exports the cannabis or, in the case where an individual referred to in section 4 sells or distributes a reference standard, the name, telephone number and email address of the laboratory where that individual carries out their duties; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the lot number, preceded by one of the following designations:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: “Lot number”,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: “Lot no.”,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: “Lot”, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: “(L)”, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the packaging date.

Subsection.Text: Sections 26 and 27 of the Act do not apply with respect to the name and email address that are included on the label in accordance with paragraph (1)(a).

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: brand name has the same meaning as in subsection C.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (nom commercial)
common name has the same meaning as in subsection C.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (nom usuel)
distribute does not include administering. (distribuer)
establishment licence means a licence issued under section C.01A.008 of the Food and Drug Regulations. (licence d’établissement)
hospital means a facility

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is licensed, approved or designated by a province under the laws of the province to provide care or treatment to individuals or animals suffering from any form of disease or illness; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is owned or operated by the Government of Canada or the government of a province and that provides health services. (hôpital)

Definition.Text: licensed dealer means a licensed dealer, as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Narcotic Control Regulations, that specializes in the destruction of narcotics, as defined in subsection 2(1) of those Regulations. (distributeur autorisé)
practitioner has the same meaning as in subsection C.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (praticien)
qualified person in charge means the individual referred to in section 150. (responsable qualifié)

Security Directive means the Directive on Physical Security Requirements for Controlled Substances and Drugs Containing Cannabis, as amended from time to time and published by the Government of Canada on its website. (Directive en matière de sécurité)
senior person in charge means the individual referred to in section 149. (responsable principal)

Subsection.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a holder of a cannabis drug licence is authorized to conduct the following activities if they are authorized by the licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: possessing cannabis obtained in accordance with these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: producing or selling a drug containing cannabis.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a cannabis drug licence that authorizes the production of a drug containing cannabis is also authorized to distribute and offer to produce the drug.
A holder of a cannabis drug licence that authorizes the sale of a drug is also authorized to distribute the drug.
For the purpose of this section, produce does not include obtaining cannabis by cultivating, propagating or harvesting it.

Section.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a holder of a cannabis drug licence that authorizes the production of a drug containing cannabis is also authorized to alter or offer to alter the chemical or physical properties of the cannabis by the use of an organic solvent.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), a holder of a cannabis drug licence that authorizes the sale of a drug containing cannabis may sell or distribute the drug only to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: another holder of a cannabis drug licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an individual referred to in section 4.

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a research licence;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of an analytical testing licence;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of a licence from which the holder of the cannabis drug licence received the drug, if the drug is sold or distributed for the purpose of its return;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a licence or a licensed dealer, if the drug is sold or distributed for the purpose of its destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a pharmacist;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a hospital employee;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a person to which an exemption in relation to the drug has been granted under section 140 of the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a cannabis drug licence that authorizes the sale of a drug containing cannabis may only sell the drug if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they have received a written order that specifies the name and quantity of the drug to be supplied and is signed and dated

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a drug to be provided to a hospital employee or a practitioner in a hospital, by the pharmacist in charge of the hospital’s pharmacy or by a practitioner authorized by the individual in charge of the hospital to sign the order, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other case, by the person to which the drug is to be sold; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they have verified the signature, if it is unknown to them.

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited for a holder of a cannabis drug licence to sell or distribute any drug containing cannabis to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a pharmacist who is named in a notice issued under subsection 181(2) or (4); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner who is named in a notice issued under subsection 189(2) or (4).

Subsection.Text: Subsection (3) does not apply to a holder of a cannabis drug licence to which the Minister has issued a notice of retraction issued under

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 182(1) in respect of the pharmacist referred to in paragraph (3)(a); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 190(1) in respect of a practitioner referred to in paragraph (3)(b).

Section.MarginalNote: Presence of qualified person in charge
Section.Text: A holder of a cannabis drug licence may conduct an activity in relation to cannabis, other than its destruction or antimicrobial treatment, at the licensed site only if the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge is present at the site.

A holder of a cannabis drug licence may conduct antimicrobial treatment of cannabis at a location other than the licensed site only if the cannabis is subsequently returned to the licensed site or distributed in accordance with this Part.

Section.MarginalNote: Destruction — holder of a cannabis drug licence

Subsection.Text: A holder of a cannabis drug licence is authorized to destroy cannabis only

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with a method that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the location where it is to be destroyed, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: does not result in any individual being exposed to cannabis smoke or cannabis vapour;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the presence of a witness referred to in paragraph (3)(a) and another witness referred to in subsection (3); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the cannabis is destroyed at a location other than the licensed site, if the holder ensures that the cannabis that is at the location is, at all times, in the presence of at least one witness referred to in paragraph (3)(a).

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer is authorized to destroy cannabis only

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with a method that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the location at which it is to be destroyed, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: does not result in any individual being exposed to cannabis smoke or cannabis vapour; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the presence of a witness referred to in paragraph (4)(a) and another witness referred to in subsection (4).

Subsection.MarginalNote: Witness — holder of a cannabis drug licence
Subsection.Text: The following individuals are qualified to witness the destruction of cannabis by a holder of a cannabis drug licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the senior person in charge, the qualified person in charge or the alternate qualified person in charge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an employee of the holder.

Subsection.Text: The following individuals are qualified to witness the destruction of cannabis by a licensed dealer:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the qualified person in charge, as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Narcotic Control Regulations, or an alternate qualified person in charge designated under subsection 9.2(2) of those Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an employee of the licensed dealer.

Subsection.Text: For each instance that they destroy cannabis, the holder of a cannabis drug licence or the licensed dealer, as the case may be, must obtain a statement signed and dated by two of the witnesses referred to in paragraph (1)(b) or (2)(b) stating that they witnessed the destruction and that the cannabis was destroyed in accordance with a method referred to in paragraph (1)(a) or (2)(a).
With respect to cannabis that they destroy, the holder of a cannabis drug licence or the licensed dealer, as the case may be, must prepare a record that sets out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the cannabis, its form and quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug containing cannabis, the brand name of the drug and its strength per unit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the location at which the cannabis is destroyed;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a brief description of the method and the date of destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the names of the individuals who witnessed the destruction and were qualified to do so under paragraph (1)(b) or (2)(b) and the basis on which they were qualified under subsection (3) or (4).

Subsection.Text: The holder of a cannabis drug licence and the licensed dealer must retain the record and the statement for at least two years after the day on which the cannabis is destroyed.

Section.Text: A cannabis drug licence must set out the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the holder of the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the site where the activity is authorized and, if applicable, of each building within the site;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the authorized activity at the site and, if applicable, the authorized activity that may be conducted at each building within the site;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the security measures to be implemented to comply with the requirements of either the Security Directive or Part 4;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any conditions that the Minister considers appropriate;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry of the licence.

Section.Text: A holder of a cannabis drug licence must submit an application to amend the licence if they propose to make any of the following changes:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the name of the holder;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the authorized activity at the site or the authorized activity at each building within the site; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the security measures implemented to comply with the requirements of either the Security Directive or Part 4.

Section.Text: The holder of a cannabis drug licence must retain the services of one individual as a senior person in charge who has overall responsibility for the management of the activities, with respect to cannabis, that are authorized under the licence.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a cannabis drug licence must retain the services of one individual as a qualified person in charge who is responsible for supervising the activities with respect to cannabis that are authorized under the licence and for ensuring, on behalf of the holder, that those activities comply with these Regulations.
A holder of a cannabis drug licence may designate an individual as an alternate qualified person in charge who is authorized to replace the qualified person in charge.
Only an individual who meets the following requirements may be a qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they work at the site specified in the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: are entitled to practise a profession that is relevant to their duties, such as that of pharmacist, practitioner, pharmacy technician or laboratory technician,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: hold a diploma, certificate or credential that is awarded by a post-secondary educational institution in Canada in a field or occupation that is relevant to their duties, such as pharmacy, medicine, dentistry, veterinary medicine, pharmacology, chemistry, biology, pharmacy technician, laboratory technician, pharmaceutical regulatory affairs or supply chain management or security, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: hold a diploma, certificate or credential that is awarded by a foreign educational institution in a field or occupation referred to in subparagraph (ii) and

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: an equivalency assessment as defined in subsection 73(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: an equivalency assessment issued by an organization or institution that is responsible for issuing equivalency assessments and is recognized by a province;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: they have sufficient knowledge of and experience with the use and handling of drugs to properly carry out their duties; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: they are familiar with the provisions of the Act and these Regulations that apply to the holder of the licence.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a cannabis drug licence may retain the services of an individual as a qualified person in charge or designate an alternate qualified person in charge who does not meet any of the requirements of paragraph (3)(b) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: no other individual working at the site specified in the licence meets those requirements;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: those requirements are not necessary for the activities that are authorized under the licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the individual possesses knowledge — acquired from a combination of education, training and work experience — that is sufficient to enable them to properly carry out their duties.

Subsection.Text: An individual is not eligible to be a senior person in charge, a qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge if, in the past 10 years,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a designated offence, a controlled substance offence, or any other offence referred to in subsection (2), the individual

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: was convicted as an adult, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: was a young person who received an adult sentence, as those terms are defined in subsection 2(1) of the Youth Criminal Justice Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of an offence committed outside Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted a designated offence, a controlled substance offence or any other offence referred to in subsection (2),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the individual was convicted as an adult, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if they committed the offence when they were at least 14 years old but less than 18 years old, the individual received a sentence that was longer than the maximum youth sentence that could have been imposed under the Youth Criminal Justice Act for such an offence.

Subsection.Text: The other offences for the purpose of subsection (1) are the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving the financing of terrorism referred to in any of sections 83.02 to 83.04 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving fraud referred to in any of sections 380 to 382 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the offence of laundering proceeds of crime referred to in section 462.31 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving a criminal organization referred to in any of sections 467.11 to 467.13 of the Criminal Code; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a conspiracy or an attempt to commit, being an accessory after the fact in relation to, or any counselling in relation to, an offence referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (d).

Subsection.Text: A holder of a cannabis drug licence must obtain the Minister’s approval before making the following changes:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: replacing the senior person in charge;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: replacing the qualified person in charge; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: designating or replacing an alternate qualified person in charge.

Subsection.Text: The holder must, for the purpose of obtaining the Minister’s approval, submit an application that includes the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the change;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the replacement of the senior person in charge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a declaration signed and dated by the proposed individual attesting that they are not ineligible for a reason specified in section 151,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a document issued by a Canadian police force indicating whether, during the 10 years before the day on which the application is submitted, the individual was convicted as specified in subparagraph 151(1)(a)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph 151(1)(a)(ii), and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the individual has ordinarily resided in a country other than Canada during the 10 years before the day on which the application is submitted, a document issued by a police force of that country indicating whether in that period that they were convicted as specified in subparagraph 151(1)(b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph 151(1)(b)(ii); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the designation of an alternate qualified person in charge or in the case of the replacement of the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the declaration and the documents referred to in subparagraphs (b)(i) to (iii),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a declaration, signed and dated by the senior person in charge, attesting that the proposed individual has the knowledge and experience required under paragraphs 150(3)(c) and (d), and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the proposed individual does not meet the requirement of subparagraph 150(3)(b)(i), either

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: a copy of the individual’s diploma, certificate or credential referred to in subparagraph 150(3)(b)(ii) or (iii) and a copy of the course transcript for it, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a detailed description of the individual’s education, training or work experience required under paragraph 150(4)(c), together with supporting evidence, such as a copy of a course transcript or an attestation by the person who provided the training.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on receiving an application for approval, require the submission of any additional information that pertains to the information contained in the application and that is necessary for the Minister to consider the application.
The Minister must approve the change on completion of the review of the application if the applicable requirements referred to in subsections 150(3) and (4) and section 151 are met.
A holder of a cannabis drug licence must notify the Minister of any of the following changes within five days after the change occurs:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the mailing address, telephone number, email address and facsimile number of the holder; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the plan of the licensed site that does not require different security measures to be implemented in order to comply with Part 4.

Subsection.Text: The notification must include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the change; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration, signed and dated by the senior person in charge, indicating that all information provided in support of the notification is correct and complete to the best of their knowledge.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a cannabis drug licence that intends to cease conducting all the activities authorized by the licence — whether before or on the date of expiry of the licence — must provide to the Minister a written notice to that effect at least 30 days before the day on which those activities cease.
The notice must be signed and dated by the senior person in charge and contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which activities are expected to cease;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the manner in which any cannabis remaining at the site as of the date referred to in paragraph (a) will be disposed of by the holder, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the cannabis will be sold or distributed, in whole or in part, the name and address of the person to which it will be sold or distributed, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it will be destroyed, in whole or in part, the day on which and the location at which the destruction is to take place;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the location at which the holder’s records, reports, electronic data and other documents that are required to be retained under the Act by the holder, will be retained after activities have ceased; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address, telephone number and, if applicable, facsimile number and email address of a person from which the Minister may obtain further information after activities have ceased.

Subsection.Text: After having ceased the activities, the holder must submit to the Minister an update of the information referred to in paragraphs (2)(a) to (d), if it differs from what was set out in the notice submitted under subsection (1). The update must be signed and dated by the senior person in charge.

Section.Text: For the purpose of paragraph 62(7)(h) of the Act, the other grounds for refusing to issue, renew or amend a cannabis drug licence are as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not hold an establishment licence that is necessary to authorize them to conduct, at the site proposed in the application or at a building within the site, the activities in relation to drugs containing cannabis that they intend to conduct there;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister of Health suspends, in respect of an activity that the applicant intends to conduct in relation to drugs containing cannabis, an establishment licence that is necessary to authorize the applicant to conduct that activity at the site proposed in the application or at a building within the site;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the cannabis drug licence applies for an amendment to change the location of the site where an activity that is authorized by the licence may be conducted; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the renewal or amendment of the licence, the holder of the licence does not hold the cannabis licence issued under subsection 14(1.1) of the Excise Act, 2001, if it is required;

Section.Text: For the purpose of paragraph 64(1)(b) of the Act, other circumstances for the suspension of a cannabis drug licence are the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister of Health suspends, in respect of an activity that the holder of the cannabis drug licence is authorized to conduct under the licence, an establishment licence that is necessary to authorize the holder to conduct that activity at the site or at a building within the site;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the cannabis licence issued to the holder of the cannabis drug licence under subsection 14(1.1) of the Excise Act, 2001 is suspended under subsection 23(2) of that Act.

Section.Text: For the purpose of paragraph 65(h) of the Act, other circumstances for the revocation of a cannabis drug licence are the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licence that has been suspended is not reinstated because the reasons for the suspension still exist or the holder of the licence has not demonstrated to the Minister that the suspension is unfounded;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the licence has requested its revocation in writing;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the licence no longer holds an establishment licence that is necessary to authorize them to conduct, at the site or at a building within the site, an activity that is authorized under the cannabis drug licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the licence no longer holds the cannabis licence referred to in subsection 14(1.1) of the Excise Act, 2001, if it is required.

Section.Text: A holder of a cannabis drug licence must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take reasonable steps to protect the cannabis they possess against theft or loss;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if they experience a theft of cannabis or a loss of cannabis that cannot be explained on the basis of normally accepted operations,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: notify a police force within 24 hours after becoming aware of its theft or loss, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: notify the Minister, in writing, within 10 days after becoming aware of its theft or loss; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: take any steps that are necessary to ensure the safekeeping of cannabis when distributing it.

Section.Text: The following persons, if they have obtained a drug containing cannabis either in accordance with these Regulations, or from a person that is exempt under section 140 of the Act from the application of subsections 9(1) and (2) and 10(1) and (2) of the Act with respect to that drug, are authorized to possess the drug:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a pharmacist, a practitioner who is entitled to practise in the province in which they possess the drug or a holder of a cannabis drug licence, if they require the drug for their business or profession;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner who is entitled to practise in a province other than the province in which they possess the drug and their possession is for emergency medical purposes only;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a hospital employee or a practitioner in a hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who possesses a quantity of the drug that exceeds the applicable limit under the Act and has obtained the drug for their own use or for their animal from a practitioner or in accordance with a prescription that was not issued or obtained in contravention of these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who possesses a quantity of the drug that exceeds the applicable limit under the Act and has reasonable grounds to believe that the drug was obtained by another individual in accordance with paragraph (d) if the possession is for the purpose of its return or destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a licensed dealer, if the possession is for the purpose of its destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a person to which an exemption has been granted under section 140 of the Act with respect to the possession of that drug, if the possession is for a purpose set out in the exemption; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister.

Section.Text: Any quantity of drug containing cannabis that an individual is authorized to possess under paragraph 159(d) or (e) is in addition to any other quantity of cannabis that the individual is authorized to possess under the Act.
Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, an individual referred to in paragraph 159(d) or (e) is authorized to distribute a drug containing cannabis to a pharmacist for its destruction.

Section.MarginalNote: Promotion — communication of brand name, etc.
Section.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a person is authorized to promote a prescription drug by communicating the brand name, the proper name, the common name, the price or the quantity of the drug.

A person is exempt from the application of section 21 of the Act if they display, refer to or otherwise use the brand name of a prescription drug, or the name of the holder of the drug identification number assigned in accordance with subsection C.01.014.2(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations for a prescription drug, directly or indirectly in a promotion that is used in the sponsorship of a person, entity, event, activity or facility.

A person is exempt from the application of section 22 of the Act if they display on a facility, as part of the name of the facility or otherwise, if the facility is used for a sports or cultural event or activity, the brand name of a prescription drug or the name of the holder of the drug identification number assigned in accordance with subsection C.01.014.2(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations for a prescription drug.

A person is exempt from the application of subsection 23(1) of the Act if they publish, broadcast or otherwise disseminate, on behalf of another person, with or without consideration, any promotion that is authorized under sections 162 to 164.

Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a person that is authorized to sell a prescription drug for veterinary use may sell it in a package or with a label that sets out a depiction of a real or fictional animal that corresponds to the species of the animal for which the drug is intended.

Section.MarginalNote: Authorization — drug appealing to young person
Section.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a person is authorized to sell a drug containing cannabis that has an appearance, shape or other sensory attribute or a function that there are reasonable grounds to believe could be appealing to young persons.
Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a person authorized to sell a drug containing cannabis may sell a drug that is of a class that is not referred to in Schedule 4 to the Act.

Section.MarginalNote: Authorization — drug containing a substance in Schedule 5
Section.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a person is authorized to sell a drug containing cannabis that contains any substance that is referred to in column 1 of Schedule 5 to the Act.
A pharmacist who receives a prescription drug from a holder of a cannabis drug licence must enter the following in a record retained for such purposes:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of the drug received;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date the drug was received; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the holder.

Section.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a pharmacist is authorized to sell, distribute or administer a prescription drug to a person:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the person is exempted under section 140 of the Act with respect to the possession of that drug; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the pharmacist sells, distributes or administers the drug

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in accordance with a written order or prescription signed and dated by a practitioner, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: after verifying the signature, if it is unknown to the pharmacist.

Subsection.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a pharmacist is authorized to sell or distribute a prescription drug, other than a drug referred to in section 173, in accordance with a written order, to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of a cannabis drug licence from which the pharmacist received the drug, if the drug is sold or distributed for the purpose of its return; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a cannabis drug licence or a licensed dealer, if the drug is sold or distributed for the purpose of its destruction.

Subsection.Text: The written order must contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, quantity and strength per unit of the drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the sale or distribution is for the purpose of its destruction, a written statement that affirms that the sole purpose of the order is the destruction of the drug and that is signed and dated by, or on behalf of, the holder of the cannabis drug licence or the licensed dealer, as the case may be.

Subsection.Text: The pharmacist must prepare a record with respect to the drug that sets out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its brand name, form, quantity and strength per unit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the person to which it was sold or distributed; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which it was sold or distributed.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist is authorized to sell or distribute to a licensed dealer a prescription drug that the pharmacist received from an individual referred to in paragraph 159(d) or (e) for the purpose of its destruction, if the drug is in a container that prevents the removal of the drug from the container and is marked in a manner that is sufficient to identify the container.
The pharmacist must prepare a record, with respect to the drug, that sets out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number of containers distributed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which each container is distributed;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the identifying mark of each container; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the licensed dealer to which each container is distributed.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must prepare a record, with respect to the drug, that sets out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number of containers received;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the container is received;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the identifying mark of the container; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the pharmacist from whom the container is received.

Subsection.Text: The pharmacist and the licensed dealer must retain the record for at least two years after the day on which the pharmacist distributes the drug or the licensed dealer receives the drug, as the case may be.
Despite section 171, subsection 172(1) and section 175, it is prohibited for a pharmacist to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sell or distribute a prescription drug to a pharmacist who is named in a notice issued under subsection 181(2) or (4);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sell or distribute a prescription drug to a practitioner who is named in a notice issued under subsection 189(2) or (4); or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: fill a prescription or order for a prescription drug from such a practitioner.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a pharmacist to whom the Minister has issued a notice of retraction under

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 182(1), in respect of a pharmacist who is named in a notice issued under subsection 181(2) or (4); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 190(1), in respect of a practitioner who is named in a notice issued under subsection 189(2) or (4).

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), a pharmacist may distribute a prescription drug to a hospital employee or a practitioner in a hospital in accordance with a written order signed and dated by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist in charge of the hospital’s pharmacy; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner who is authorized by the individual in charge of the hospital to sign the order.

Subsection.Text: Before distributing the prescription drug, the pharmacist receiving the order must verify the signature on the order, if it is unknown to them.

Section.Text: A pharmacist must, with respect to a drug containing cannabis on their premises or for which the pharmacist is responsible,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take reasonable steps to protect it against theft or loss; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: notify the Minister, in writing, within 10 days after becoming aware of its theft or loss.

Section.Text: If, in accordance with a written order or prescription, a pharmacist dispenses a prescription drug, the pharmacist must retain a record of the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name or initials;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, initials and address of the practitioner who issued the order or prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the person for whom the drug was dispensed;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name, quantity and form of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the pharmacist dispensed the drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the order or prescription.

Section.MarginalNote: Sale and distribution for emergency purposes

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist may sell or distribute a prescription drug for emergency purposes to another pharmacist in accordance with a written order that is signed and dated by the other pharmacist.

A pharmacist must, after selling or distributing a prescription drug under subsection (1) or after receiving such a drug under subsection (1) or subsection 193(3), enter the details of the transaction in a record retained for such purposes.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Record keeping — removing, transporting and transferring
Subsection.Text: A pharmacist must, after removing, transporting or transferring a prescription drug from one place of business operated by the pharmacist to another, enter the details of the transaction in a record retained for such purposes.

Section.Text: A pharmacist must retain the records which the pharmacist is required to retain under these Regulations for at least two years after the day on which they are prepared.

The Minister must provide in writing any factual information about a pharmacist with respect to cannabis that has been obtained under the Act or the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act to the provincial professional licensing authority that is responsible for the authorization of individuals to practise their profession

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the province in which the pharmacist is or was entitled to practise if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the authority submits to the Minister a written request that sets out the pharmacist’s name and address, a description of the information being requested and a statement that the information is required for the purpose of assisting an investigation by the authority, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the pharmacist has

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: contravened, in relation to cannabis, a rule of conduct established by the authority,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: been convicted of a designated offence or a controlled substance offence in relation to cannabis,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: contravened these Regulations, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: has contravened the Narcotic Control Regulations in relation to cannabis; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a province in which the pharmacist is not entitled to practise, if the authority submits to the Minister

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a written request that sets out the pharmacist’s name and address and a description of the information requested, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a document that shows that

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the pharmacist has applied to that authority to practise in that province, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the authority has reasonable grounds to believe that the pharmacist is practising in that province without being authorized to do so.

Section.MarginalNote: Notice — prohibition to sell or distribute

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist may make a written request to the Minister to send a notice advising that the following persons must not sell or distribute any prescription drug to the pharmacist:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: all holders of a cannabis drug licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all pharmacies in the province in which the pharmacist who is named in the notice is entitled to practise.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must, in the circumstances set out in subsection (3), issue the notice referred to in subsection (1) to the following persons and authorities:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist who is named in the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all holders of a cannabis drug licence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: all pharmacies in the province in which the pharmacist is entitled to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the applicable provincial professional licensing authority for the province in which the pharmacist is entitled to practise; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: on request, the applicable provincial professional licensing authority for any province other than the province referred to in paragraph (d).

Subsection.Text: The notice must be issued if the pharmacist

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: made a request to the Minister in accordance with subsection (1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contravened a rule of conduct, in relation to cannabis, established by the provincial professional licensing authority for the province in which the pharmacist is practising and that provincial professional licensing authority has requested the Minister in writing to issue the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has been convicted of any of the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated offence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a controlled substance offence in relation to cannabis, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence under the Narcotic Control Regulations in relation to cannabis; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the pharmacist has contravened this Part or Part 9.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may issue the notice to the persons and authorities referred to in subsection (2) if the Minister, on reasonable grounds, believes that the pharmacist named in the notice

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has contravened section 171, subsection 172(1) or (2) or 173(1), section 174, 175 or 176 or subsection 178(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, self-administered a prescription drug contrary to accepted pharmaceutical practice;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, distributed or administered a prescription drug to their spouse, common-law partner, parent or child, including a child adopted in fact, contrary to accepted pharmaceutical practice; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is unable to account for the quantity of prescription drugs for which the pharmacist was responsible under this Part or Part 9.

Subsection.Text: Before issuing a notice under subsection (4), the Minister must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: consult with the provincial professional licensing authority for the province in which the pharmacist to whom the notice relates is entitled to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: send to the pharmacist a written notice that indicates the reasons why a notice is being considered and give them an opportunity to present reasons why the notice should not be issued; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: consider

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any reasons that have been presented by the pharmacist under paragraph (b),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the compliance history of the pharmacist in respect of the Act and its regulations, the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act and the Narcotic Control Regulations with respect to cannabis, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the actions of the pharmacist pose a significant risk to public health or public safety, including the risk of any prescription drug being diverted to an illicit market or activity.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must retract a notice that was issued under subsection 181(2) or (4) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist who is named in the notice has requested in writing that it be retracted;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist has provided a letter from the applicable provincial professional licensing authority for the province in which the pharmacist is entitled to practise that states that the authority consents to the retraction of the notice; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the notice was issued at the request of the pharmacist, one year has elapsed since the notice was issued.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister retracts a notice, he or she must notify, in writing, the persons and authorities to which the notice was issued under subsection 181(2) or (4).

Section.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a practitioner is authorized to administer a drug containing cannabis to an individual or animal, or sell or distribute it for an individual or animal if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the individual or the animal is under their professional treatment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the drug is required for the condition for which the individual or animal is receiving treatment.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner is authorized to sell or distribute a drug containing cannabis, in accordance with a written order, to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of a cannabis drug licence from which the practitioner received the drug, if the drug is sold or distributed for the purpose of its return; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a cannabis drug licence or a licensed dealer, if the drug is sold or distributed for the purpose of its destruction.

Subsection.Text: The written order must contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, quantity and strength per unit of the drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the sale or distribution is for the purpose of its destruction, a written statement that affirms that the sole purpose of the order is the destruction of the drug and that is signed and dated by, or on behalf of, the holder of the cannabis drug licence or the licensed dealer, as the case may be.

Subsection.Text: The practitioner must prepare a record with respect to the drug that sets out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its brand name, form, quantity and strength per unit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the person to which it was sold or distributed; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which it was sold or distributed.

Section.Text: A practitioner must, with respect to a drug containing cannabis that they possess,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take reasonable steps to protect it against theft or loss; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: notify the Minister, in writing, within 10 days after becoming aware of its theft or loss.

Section.Text: A practitioner who sells or distributes a prescription drug to an individual for self-administration or for administration to an animal must, whether or not the practitioner charges for the drug, retain a record showing the name and quantity of the drug sold or distributed, the name and address of the individual to whom it was sold or distributed and the date on which it was sold or distributed, if the quantity of the drug exceeds

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: three times the maximum daily dosage set out in the notice of compliance issued under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01 of the Food and Drug Regulations for the drug; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the notice of compliance does not set out any maximum daily dosage, three times the generally recognized maximum daily dosage for the drug.

Section.Text: A practitioner must retain the records which the practitioner is required to retain under these Regulations for at least two years after the day on which they are prepared.

The Minister must provide in writing any factual information about a practitioner with respect to cannabis that has been obtained under the Act or the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act to the provincial professional licensing authority that is responsible for the authorization of individuals to practise their profession

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in a province in which the practitioner is, or was, entitled to practise if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the authority submits to the Minister a written request that sets out the practitioner’s name and address, a description of the information requested and a statement that the information is required for the purpose of assisting a investigation by the authority, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the practitioner has

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: contravened, in relation to cannabis, a rule of conduct established by the authority,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: been convicted of a designated offence or a controlled substance offence in relation to cannabis,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: contravened these Regulations, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: contravened the Narcotic Control Regulations in relation to cannabis; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a province in which the practitioner is not entitled to practise, if the authority submits to the Minister

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a written request that sets out the practitioner’s name and address and a description of the information requested, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a document that shows that

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the practitioner has applied to that authority to practise in that province, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the authority has reasonable grounds to believe that the practitioner is practising in that province without being authorized to do so.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner may make a written request to the Minister to send a notice advising that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the following persons must not sell or distribute any prescription drug to the practitioner:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all holders of a cannabis drug licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: all pharmacies in the province in which the practitioner who is named in the notice is entitled to practise, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: all pharmacies in an adjacent province in which a prescription or order from the practitioner who is named in the notice may be filled; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the following individual must not fill a prescription or order written by the practitioner for a prescription drug:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all pharmacists in the province in which the practitioner who is named in the notice is entitled to practise, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: all pharmacists in an adjacent province in which a prescription or order from the practitioner who is named in the notice may be filled.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must, in the circumstances set out in subsection (3), issue the notice referred to in subsection (1) to the following persons and authorities:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner who is named in the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all holders of a cannabis drug licence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: all pharmacies in the province in which the practitioner is entitled to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: all pharmacies in an adjacent province in which a prescription or order from the practitioner who is named in the notice may be filled;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the applicable professional licensing authority for the province in which the practitioner is entitled to practise; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: on request, the applicable provincial professional licensing authority for any province other than the province referred to in paragraph (e).

Subsection.Text: The notice must be issued if the practitioner

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: made a request to the Minister in accordance with subsection (1) to issue the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contravened a rule of conduct, in relation to cannabis, established by the provincial professional licensing authority for the province in which the practitioner is practising and that provincial professional licensing authority has requested the Minister in writing to issue the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: been convicted of any of the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated offence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
