Subparagraph.Text: a controlled substance offence in relation to cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence under the Narcotic Control Regulations in relation to cannabis; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the practitioner has contravened this Part or Part 9.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may issue the notice to the persons and authorities referred to in subsection (2) if the Minister, on reasonable grounds, believes that the practitioner named in the notice

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has contravened section 183, subsection 184(1) or (2) or section 185;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, self-administered a prescription drug under a self-directed prescription or order or, in the absence of a prescription or order, contrary to accepted professional practice;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, distributed or administered a prescription drug to their spouse, common-law partner, parent or child, including a child adopted in fact, contrary to accepted professional practice; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is unable to account for the quantity of prescription drugs for which the practitioner was responsible under this Part or Part 9.

Subsection.Text: Before issuing a notice under subsection (4), the Minister must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: consult with the applicable provincial professional licensing authority for the province in which the practitioner to whom the notice relates is entitled to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: send to the practitioner a written notice that indicates the reasons why a notice is being considered and give them an opportunity to present reasons why the notice should not be issued; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: consider

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any reasons that have been presented by the practitioner under paragraph (b),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the compliance history of the practitioner in respect of the Act and its regulations, the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act and the Narcotic Control Regulations with respect to cannabis, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the actions of the practitioner pose a significant risk to public health or public safety, including the risk of any prescription drug being diverted to an illicit market or activity.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must retract a notice that was issued under subsection 189(2) or (4) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner who is named in the notice has requested in writing that it be retracted;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner has provided a letter from the applicable provincial professional licensing authority for the province in which the practitioner is entitled to practise that states that the authority consents to the retraction of the notice; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the notice was issued at the request of the practitioner, one year has elapsed since the notice was issued.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister retracts a notice, the Minister must notify, in writing, the persons and authorities to which the notice was issued under subsection 189(2) or (4).

Section.Text: An individual who is in charge of a hospital must retain a record of the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to any prescription drug received by the hospital,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and quantity of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person from whom the drug was received, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date the drug was received; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to a prescription drug that is dispensed by the hospital,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the patient for whom or animal for which the drug was dispensed,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the practitioner who ordered or prescribed the drug, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the drug was ordered or prescribed and the form and quantity of the drug.

Section.Text: An individual in charge of a hospital must, with respect to a drug containing cannabis for which the hospital is responsible,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take reasonable steps to protect it against theft or loss; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: notify the Minister, in writing, within 10 days after becoming aware of its theft or loss.

Subsection.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, it is prohibited for a person to sell, distribute or administer a prescription drug that a hospital possesses without the authorization of the individual in charge of the hospital.

The individual in charge of a hospital may authorize the sale, distribution or administration of a prescription drug only in accordance with a prescription or a written order, signed and dated by a practitioner and only

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of administration, to an individual or an animal under treatment as an in-patient or out-patient of the hospital; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of sale or distribution, for the individual referred to in paragraph (a) or to the person in charge of the animal referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.MarginalNote: Distribution or sale in an emergency
Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (2), for emergency purposes, the individual in charge of a hospital may authorize the sale or distribution of a prescription drug without a prescription to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an employee of or a practitioner in another hospital, if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug is sold or distributed in accordance with a written order signed and dated by a pharmacist in charge of the pharmacy in the other hospital or by a practitioner who is authorized by the individual in charge of the other hospital to sign the order, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the signature of the pharmacist or the practitioner is known to the person who sells or distributes the drug or has been verified by that person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a pharmacist of another hospital, if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug is sold or distributed in accordance with a written order signed and dated by the pharmacist, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the signature of the pharmacist or the practitioner who is authorized by the individual in charge of the other hospital to sign the order is known to the person who sells or distributes the drug or has been verified by that person; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who is exempted under section 140 of the Act with respect to the drug and who is employed in a research laboratory in the hospital for the purpose of research.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection 193(2), the individual in charge of a hospital may authorize the sale or distribution of a prescription drug in accordance with a written order to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of a cannabis drug licence from which the drug was received, if the drug is sold or distributed for the purpose of its return; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of a cannabis drug licence or a licensed dealer, if the drug is sold or distributed for the purpose of its destruction.

Subsection.Text: The written order must contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, the quantity and the strength per unit of the drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the sale or distribution is for the purpose of its destruction, a written statement that affirms that the sole purpose of the order is the destruction of the drug and that is signed and dated by, or on behalf of, the holder of the cannabis drug licence or the licensed dealer, as the case may be.

Subsection.Text: The individual in charge of the hospital must prepare a record, with respect to the drug for the purpose of its return or destruction, that sets out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its brand name, form, quantity and strength per unit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and the address of the person to whom it was sold or distributed; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which it was sold or distributed.

Section.Text: An individual in charge of a hospital must retain the records that the individual is required to retain under these Regulations for at least two years after the day on which they are prepared.
The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: brand name has the same meaning as in subsection C.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (nom commercial)
common name has the same meaning as in subsection C.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (nom usuel)

Section.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a person may promote a combination product by communicating the brand name, proper name, common name, price or quantity of the product.

A person is exempt from the application of section 21 of the Act if they display, refer to or otherwise use the brand name of a combination product, or the name of the holder of the drug identification number assigned in accordance with subsection C.01.014.2(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations for the product, directly or indirectly in a promotion that is used in the sponsorship of a person, entity, event, activity or facility.

A person is exempt from the application of section 22 of the Act if they display on a facility, as part of the name of the facility or otherwise, if the facility is used for a sports or cultural event or activity, the brand name of a combination product or the name of the holder of the drug identification number assigned in accordance with subsection C.01.014.2(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations for the product.

A person is exempt from the application of subsection 23(1) of the Act if they publish, broadcast or otherwise disseminate, on behalf of another person, with or without consideration, any promotion that is authorized under sections 197 to 199.

Section.MarginalNote: Authorization — combination product for veterinary use
Section.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a person that is authorized to sell a combination product for veterinary use may sell it in a package or with a label that sets out a depiction of a real or fictional animal that corresponds to the species of the animal for which the product is intended.

Subsection.Text: Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a person is authorized to sell a combination product to a young person.
Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a person is authorized to sell a device licensed for use with a prescription drug to a young person if the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has ascertained that there is a written prescription for the young person with respect to the drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is entitled under the laws of a province to dispense a prescription drug.

Heading.Label: PART 10
Heading.TitleText: Importation and Exportation for Medical or Scientific Purposes

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: customs office has the same meaning as in subsection 2(1) of the Customs Act. (bureau de douane)
customs officer has the meaning assigned by the definition officer in subsection 2(1) of the Customs Act. (agent des douanes)

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence is authorized to import cannabis for medical or scientific purposes if they also hold an import permit for each shipment of cannabis that is imported.
A holder of an import permit is also authorized to possess, transfer, transport, send or deliver the shipment of cannabis to the extent necessary to import the cannabis.

Section.Text: The import permit must set out the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and mailing address of the holder;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the permit number and the licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the shipment of cannabis to be imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the intended use of the cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the brand name of the cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: quantity of the cannabis, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the percentage of THC w/w and CBD w/w of the cannabis, except in the case of cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the exporter in the country of export;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: each mode of transportation used, the country of export and, if applicable, any country of transit or transhipment;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: any conditions that the Minister considers appropriate;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the permit; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry of the permit.

Section.Text: For the purpose of paragraph 62(7)(h) of the Act, other grounds for refusing to issue an import permit are the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not hold a licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the shipment to which the permit application pertains would contravene these Regulations or the laws of the country of export or any country of transit or transhipment, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the importation of the cannabis is for the purpose of exporting it.

Section.Text: An import permit is valid until the earliest of the following dates:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the shipment is imported,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry of the permit or the date of its revocation,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry of the licence referred to in paragraph 205(b) or the date of its revocation, or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of revocation of the permit for exportation issued by the competent authority of the country of export that pertains to the shipment.

Section.MarginalNote: Provision of copy of import permit
Section.Text: A holder of an import permit must provide a copy of the import permit to the customs office at the time of importation.
The holder of an import permit must, within 15 days after the date of release of a shipment of cannabis in Canada, provide the Minister with the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name, the number of the licence referred to in paragraph 205(b) and the import permit number issued in respect of the shipment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of release of the shipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the shipment of cannabis that is imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the intended use of the cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the brand name of the cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of the cannabis, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the percentage of THC w/w and CBD w/w of the cannabis, except in the case of cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds.

Section.Text: The holder of an import permit must ensure that, after the imported cannabis is released, it is transported directly to the site set out in the licence referred to in paragraph 205(b).
For the purpose of paragraph 65(h) of the Act, other circumstances for the revocation of an import permit are the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit holder has requested, in writing, the revocation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licence referred to in paragraph 205(b) has been revoked;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the importation of the cannabis is for the purpose of exporting it; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a permit that has been suspended is not reinstated because the reasons for the suspension still exist or the permit holder has not demonstrated to the Minister that the suspension is unfounded.

Section.Text: The Minister may, for the purpose of verifying whether an importation of cannabis complies with these Regulations, provide to a customs officer any information provided in the import permit application or referred to in sections 205 and 209 and inform that customs officer whether the import permit has been suspended or revoked.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence is authorized to export cannabis for medical or scientific purposes if they also hold an export permit for each shipment of cannabis that is exported.
A holder of an export permit is also authorized to possess, transfer, transport, send, deliver or sell the shipment of cannabis to the extent necessary to export the cannabis.

Section.Text: The export permit must set out the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and mailing address of the holder;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the permit number and the licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the shipment of cannabis to be exported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the intended use of the cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the brand name of the cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of the cannabis, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the percentage of THC w/w and CBD w/w of the cannabis, except in the case of cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the importer in the country of import;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the country of import and, if applicable, any country of transit or transhipment;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the customs office, sufferance warehouse or bonded warehouse to which the shipment is to be delivered, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: each mode of transportation used;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: any conditions that the Minister considers appropriate;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the permit; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry of the permit.

Section.Text: For the purpose of paragraph 62(7)(h) of the Act, other grounds for refusing to issue an export permit are the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not hold a licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the shipment to which the permit application pertains

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: would contravene these Regulations or the laws of the country of import or any country of transit or transhipment, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: would not comply with the permit for importation issued by a competent authority of the country of import.

Section.Text: An export permit is valid until the earliest of the following dates:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the shipment is exported,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry of the permit or the date of its revocation,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry of the licence referred to in paragraph 214(b) or the date of its revocation, or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry of the permit for importation issued by the competent authority of the country of import that pertains to the shipment or the date of its revocation.

Section.MarginalNote: Provision of copy of export permit
Section.Text: A holder of an export permit must provide a copy of the export permit to the customs office at the time of exportation.
The holder of an export permit must, within 15 days after the date of exportation of a shipment of cannabis, provide the Minister with the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and the number of the licence referred to in paragraph 214(b) and the export permit number issued in respect of the shipment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of exportation of the shipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the shipment of cannabis that is exported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: intended use of the cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the brand name of the cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of the cannabis, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the percentage of THC w/w and CBD w/w of the cannabis, except in the case of cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds.

Section.Text: For the purpose of paragraph 65(h) of the Act, other circumstances for the revocation of an export permit are the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit holder has requested, in writing, the revocation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licence referred to in paragraph 214(b) has been revoked; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a permit that has been suspended is not reinstated because the reasons for the suspension still exist or the permit holder has not demonstrated to the Minister that the suspension is unfounded.

Section.Text: The Minister may, for the purpose of verifying whether an exportation of cannabis complies with these Regulations, provide to a customs officer any information provided in the export permit application or referred to in sections 214 and 218 and inform that customs officer whether the export permit has been suspended or revoked.
A person that is required to retain a document or information — or that must ensure that a document or information is retained — under these Regulations must ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the document or information is retained in a manner that will enable an audit of it to be made in a timely manner;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the person holds a licence, the document or information is available at the site specified in the licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the person does not hold a licence, the document or information is available at their place of business in Canada or, if they do not have such a place of business, at a place of business in Canada.

Section.Text: If a person ceases to hold a licence, they must, in respect of any document or information that they were required to retain under these Regulations and for which the retention period has not yet ended,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the document or information continues to be retained until the end of the retention period; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide the Minister with notice in writing of the address of the location at which the document or information is retained and of any subsequent change to the address.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence, if they send or provide a notice under these Regulations and are not otherwise required to retain a copy, must retain a copy for at least two years after the day on which the notice is sent or provided.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence must retain, for each lot or batch of cannabis — other than a cannabis extract, a cannabis topical or edible cannabis — that they produce, a document that contains the following information, as applicable:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which cannabis plants are propagated by means other than sowing seeds and the number of new plants propagated in this manner;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which cannabis plant seeds are sown and the number of seeds sown on that date;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which cannabis is harvested and its net weight on that date;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which drying processes are completed for the cannabis and its net weight on that date;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which dried or fresh cannabis is put into a discrete unit form, the net weight of cannabis in each unit and the number of units;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which cannabis that is not of a class of cannabis set out in Schedule 4 to the Act is produced and its net weight or volume on that date; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: except in the case of cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, any information that is obtained through testing and that relates to the phytocannabinoid and terpene content of the cannabis.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence must retain, for each lot or batch of cannabis — other than a cannabis extract, a cannabis topical or edible cannabis — that they package, a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the cannabis, including, if applicable, the brand name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the cannabis is packaged and its net weight on that date; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug containing cannabis, the strength per unit of the drug.

Subsection.Text: The documents must be retained for at least two years after the day on which they are prepared.
A holder of a licence must retain, for each lot or batch of cannabis extract, cannabis topical or edible cannabis that they produce, a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of production and the net weight or volume of the cannabis extract, cannabis topical or edible cannabis on that date;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the date on which the cannabis extract, cannabis topical or edible cannabis is put into a discrete unit form, the net weight or volume of each unit and the number of units;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the cannabis that is used to produce the cannabis extract, cannabis topical or edible cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its description,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its net weight or volume,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its lot or batch number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which it was produced;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the cannabis extract, cannabis topical or edible cannabis is or will become a cannabis product or is or will be contained in a cannabis accessory that is or will become a cannabis product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the list of ingredients that is required to appear on the label of the cannabis product, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the net weight, net volume or concentration by weight or volume of each of those ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (d.1)
Paragraph.Text: if the cannabis extract, cannabis topical or edible cannabis is not referred to in paragraph (d) but is or will be distributed in the conduct of non-therapeutic research on cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the list of ingredients that would be required to appear on the label if the cannabis extract, cannabis topical or edible cannabis were a cannabis product or were contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the net weight, net volume or concentration by weight or volume of each of those ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the cannabis extract is or will become a cannabis product or is or will be contained in a cannabis accessory that is or will become a cannabis product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication of whether each ingredient that is required to appear on the label of the cannabis product is a carrier substance, flavouring agent or substance that is necessary to maintain the quality or stability of the cannabis product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any additional information in the possession of the holder that relates to the purpose of each ingredient, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the flavour, if any, of the cannabis product;

Paragraph.Label: (e.1)
Paragraph.Text: if the cannabis extract is not referred to in paragraph (e) but is or will be distributed in the conduct of non-therapeutic research on cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication of whether each ingredient that would be required to appear on the label if the cannabis extract were a cannabis product or were contained in a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product is a carrier substance, flavouring agent or substance that is necessary to maintain the quality or stability of the cannabis extract,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any additional information in the possession of the holder that relates to the purpose of each ingredient, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the flavour, if any, of the cannabis extract; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any information that is obtained through testing and that relates to the phytocannabinoid and terpene content of the cannabis extract, cannabis topical or edible cannabis.

Subsection.Text: The document is not required to contain the information referred to in subparagraph (1)(d)(ii) or (d.1)(ii), as the case may be, in respect of an ingredient if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the ingredient is part of a mixture of substances that was used in the production of cannabis referred to in paragraph (1)(d) or (d.1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder obtained the mixture from another person;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the information has not been disclosed to the holder;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has made the necessary arrangements to ensure that the information will be provided to the Minister if, within the retention period referred to in subsection (3), the Minister requires the holder to provide it; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the document contains the net weight or volume of the mixture at the time it was used to produce the cannabis.

Subsection.Text: The document is not required to contain the information referred to in subparagraph (1)(e)(i) or (e.1)(i), as the case may be, in respect of an ingredient if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the requirements in paragraphs (1.1)(a) to (d) are met; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder includes in the document an indication of whether the mixture referred to in paragraph (1.1)(a) contains carrier substances, flavouring agents, substances that are necessary to maintain the quality or stability of the cannabis, or a combination of any of these.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence must retain, for each lot or batch of cannabis extract, cannabis topical or edible cannabis that they package, a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the cannabis extract, cannabis topical or edible cannabis, including the brand name, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the cannabis extract, cannabis topical or edible cannabis is packaged and its net weight or volume on that date; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug containing cannabis, the strength per unit of the drug.

Subsection.Text: The documents must be retained for at least two years after the day on which they are prepared.

Despite subsection (3), in the case of cannabis that was distributed to human participants in the conduct of non-therapeutic research on cannabis, the holder of the licence for research that distributed the cannabis must retain the documents for at least two years after the day on which the research ends.
A holder of a licence must, if they obtain cannabis from another person, retain a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person from which the cannabis is obtained;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the location at which the cannabis is obtained and, if that location is different from the site or sites at which the cannabis was produced, the address of the site or sites, if known;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the cannabis is obtained;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis that is obtained;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the cannabis, including, if applicable, the brand name;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the lot or batch number of the cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug containing cannabis, the form of the drug and its strength per unit; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cannabis plants, cannabis plant seeds or cannabis that is not of a class of cannabis set out in Schedule 4 to the Act, the intended use.

Subsection.Text: The document must be retained for at least two years after the day on which it is prepared.

Section.MarginalNote: Things to be used as ingredients

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for processing must, if they obtain or produce anything that will be used as an ingredient to produce a cannabis extract, a cannabis topical or edible cannabis, retain a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and business address of the person, if any, that supplies the thing;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the holder takes possession of the thing or, if the thing is produced by the holder, the date on which production is completed;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the thing, including the name by which it is generally known and, if applicable,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its chemical name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its common name, if that name is not the name by which it is generally known,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its INCI name, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: its CAS registry number; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any lot code or other unique identifier that enables the thing to be traced.

Subsection.Text: The document must be retained for at least two years after the day on which it is prepared.
The following definitions apply in paragraph (1)(c).

Definition.Text: CAS registry number means the identification number assigned to a chemical by the Chemical Abstracts Service, a division of the American Chemical Society. (numéro d’enregistrement CAS)
common name has the same meaning as in subsection B.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (nom usuel)
INCI name has the same meaning as in subsection 2(1) of the Cosmetic Regulations. (appellation INCI)

Section.MarginalNote: Sale, distribution and export of cannabis

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence, if they sell, distribute or export cannabis, must retain a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person to which it is sold, distributed or exported;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the location from which it is sold, distributed or exported and the place to which it is sent or delivered;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which it is sold, distributed or exported;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity that is sold, distributed or exported;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the cannabis, including, if applicable, the brand name;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: its lot or batch number;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug containing cannabis, the form of the drug and its strength per unit;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cannabis plants, cannabis plant seeds or cannabis that is not of a class of cannabis set out in Schedule 4 to the Act, the intended use, if known; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product, a description of the cannabis accessory.

Subsection.Text: The obligation set out in subsection (1) does not apply if the cannabis is sold or distributed to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who has placed a purchase order for it under subsection 289(1); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an individual, other than an individual referred to in paragraph (a), who does not hold a licence and who is obtaining the cannabis for their personal use.

Subsection.Text: The document must be retained for at least two years after the day on which it is prepared.
A holder of a licence, if they conduct antimicrobial treatment of cannabis at a location other than the site specified in the licence, must retain a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the cannabis, including, if applicable, the brand name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the cannabis leaves the site specified in the licence and the quantity that leaves the site;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person that receives the cannabis at the location where the treatment is to be conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the location referred to in paragraph (c);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person from which the cannabis is received after the treatment;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the site to which the cannabis is returned, or of the location to which it is distributed, after the treatment; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the cannabis is received at the site or location referred to in paragraph (f) and the quantity that is received.

Subsection.Text: The document must be retained for at least two years after the day on which it is prepared.
A holder of a licence other than a cannabis drug licence, if they destroy cannabis or cause it to be destroyed, must retain a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the cannabis, including, if applicable, the brand name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the cannabis is destroyed and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if whole cannabis plants are destroyed, the number of plants destroyed on that date, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other case, the pre-destruction net weight or volume of the cannabis on that date; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the employee referred to in paragraph 43(1)(b) who witnesses the destruction.

Subsection.Text: The holder must obtain, for each instance in which cannabis is destroyed, a statement signed and dated by the employee referred to in paragraph 43(1)(b) stating that they witnessed the destruction and that the cannabis was destroyed in accordance with a method referred to in paragraph 43(1)(a).

The document referred to in subsection (1) and the statement referred to in subsection (2) must be retained for at least two years after the day on which the cannabis is destroyed, except if they relate to cannabis destroyed under section 28.5, in which case they must be retained for at least two years after the day on which the non-therapeutic research on cannabis ends.
Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply in cases where a holder of a licence destroys cultivation waste.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence must retain a copy of any organizational security plan that they submit to the Minister — including any updated plan referred to in section 45 — for at least two years after the day on which the plan is replaced by an updated plan or, if the plan has not been replaced, at least two years after the day on which the licence expires or is revoked.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence other than a cannabis drug licence must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for each lot or batch of cannabis any portion of which has been sold or exported, retain a document demonstrating that the cannabis and anything that was used as an ingredient was produced, packaged, labelled, distributed, stored, sampled and tested in accordance with the applicable provisions of Parts 5 and 6;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, maintain a list of the brand names of cannabis — of any class of cannabis set out in Schedule 4 to the Act — that the holder has produced, packaged, labelled, distributed, stored, sampled or tested;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of each instance in which a substance — including a pest control product and a fertilizer but excluding water — is applied directly or indirectly to cannabis, retain a document that contains the name of that substance, as well as the date on which it was applied;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the testing conducted under Part 5 or to meet the requirements set out in Part 6,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: maintain a document that describes the validated methods used, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for each lot or batch of cannabis that is tested, retain a document that contains the test results;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a licence for processing, retain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a document that describes the qualifications of the quality assurance person — and of any alternate quality assurance person — in respect of the matters referred to in subsection 19(1), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a document that describes every investigation conducted under paragraph 19(2)(b) or (c) and any measures taken under that paragraph; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a licence for analytical testing, retain a document that describes the qualifications of the head of laboratory in respect of the matters referred to in subsection 23(2).

Subsection.Text: The holder of a licence for research must also retain a document demonstrating that each lot or batch of cannabis that the holder produced or received from another holder of a licence for research and that has been distributed to human participants in the conduct of non-therapeutic research on cannabis, and anything that was used as an ingredient, was produced, packaged, labelled, distributed, stored, sampled or tested in accordance with sections 28.1 and 28.2 and the provisions of Parts 5 and 6, if applicable.
The following documents must be retained for the following periods:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a document referred to in paragraph (1)(a), for at least two years after the day on which the last sale or export of any portion of the lot or batch takes place;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a document referred to in paragraph (1)(c), for at least two years after the day on which it is prepared;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a document referred to in subparagraph (1)(d)(ii), for at least two years after the day on which the last sale or export of any portion of the lot or batch takes place;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a document referred to in subparagraph (1)(e)(i) or paragraph (f), for the period during which the quality assurance person, the alternate quality assurance person or the head of laboratory acts in that capacity and at least two years after the day on which they cease to do so;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a document referred to in subparagraph (1)(e)(ii), for at least two years after the day on which it is prepared; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a document referred to in subsection (1.1), for at least two years after the day on which the non-therapeutic research on cannabis ends.

Subsection.Text: The holder must retain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: each version of the list referred to in paragraph (1)(b), for at least two years after the day on which it is replaced by a new version or, if it has not been replaced, at least two years after the day on which the licence expires or is revoked; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each version of the document referred to in subparagraph (1)(d)(i), for at least two years after the day on which the validated methods are replaced or, if the methods have not been replaced, two years after the day on which the licence expires or is revoked.

Section.MarginalNote: Standard operating procedures and sanitation program

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence other than a cannabis drug licence must maintain documentation describing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the standard operating procedures referred to in section 80 that are in use at the site set out in the licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sanitation program referred to in section 87 that is in use at the site set out in the licence.

Subsection.Text: The holder must retain each version of the documentation for at least two years after the day on which it is replaced by a new version or, if it has not been replaced, at least two years after the day on which the licence expires or is revoked.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence other than a cannabis drug licence must retain the following samples and copies for at least two years after the day on which they are made:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a sample or copy of each distinct package for a cannabis product that the holder makes available for sale; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of each distinct label that relates to a cannabis product that the holder makes available for sale.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence must maintain a list of the names and types of the cannabis accessories that they sell and must retain each version of the list for at least two years after the day on which it is replaced by a new version or, if it has not been replaced, at least two years after the day on which the licence expires or is revoked.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence, other than a licence for analytical testing or a cannabis drug licence must retain, for each lot or batch of cannabis that they sell or distribute, a document that contains the information that is necessary for the system of control referred to in subsection 46(1).
The document must be retained for at least two years after the day on which the last sale or distribution of any portion of the lot or batch takes place, other than for destruction.

The holder must maintain documentation concerning the system of control and retain each version of the documentation for at least two years after the day on which it is replaced by a new version or, if it has not been replaced, at least two years after the day on which the licence expires or is revoked.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence must retain

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, a document that contains the information provided to the Minister under subsection 43(4) of the Act for at least two years after the day on which the information was provided; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a sample or copy of any promotional materials for at least two years after the day on which the promotion ended.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence, if they undertake research and development activities, must retain a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of any cannabis that is used in the activities,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its description, including, if applicable, its brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity used and, if applicable, the lot or batch number,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which it is used, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the purpose and a brief description of the activity;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of any cannabis that is produced in the course of the activities,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its description,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity produced,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which it is produced,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the date on which it is used for testing and the quantity used, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the date on which it is placed in inventory intended for sale and the quantity placed in inventory; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any other information that can be used to reconcile the quantities of cannabis referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b).

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for research must also retain, in relation to any non-therapeutic research on cannabis that the holder conducts, the following documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the documents submitted to the Minister in relation to that research;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the documents produced in relation to that research; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of any document required by licence conditions that the Minister has imposed under subsection 62(10) of the Act.

Subsection.Text: A document referred to in subsection (1) that does not relate to non-therapeutic research on cannabis must be retained for at least two years after the day on which it is prepared.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Retention period — non-therapeutic research on cannabis
Subsection.Text: Despite any other provision of these Regulations that specifies a retention period and except in the case of reports and records referred to in section 248.2, every document that the holder of a licence for research must retain under these Regulations in relation to non-therapeutic research on cannabis that the holder conducts or in relation to cannabis that is distributed in the conduct of such research must be retained for at least two years after the day on which the non-therapeutic research on cannabis ends.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence for micro-processing must maintain documentation that demonstrates that they comply with the limit set out in subsection 21(1) and retain each version of the documentation for at least two years after the day on which it is replaced by a new version or, if it has not been replaced, for at least two years after the day on which the licence expires or is revoked.

A holder or former holder of an import permit must retain a document that contains the information that they provided to the Minister under section 209 — together with a copy of the relevant export permit that was issued by a competent authority in the country of export — for at least two years after the day on which the information is provided.

A holder or former holder of an export permit must retain a document that contains the information that they provided to the Minister under section 218 — together with a copy of the relevant import permit issued by a competent authority in the country of final destination — for at least two years after the day on which the information is provided.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for cultivation, processing or sale must maintain a record that contains the following information in respect of each key investor:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the key investor’s name and mailing address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the means by which the key investor exercises, or is in a position to exercise, control over the holder;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: details regarding the transaction by virtue of which the key investor became such an investor, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if they provided money directly or indirectly to the holder, the amount provided, the date on which it was provided and the terms and conditions under which it was provided, and if the money was provided in the form of a loan, the interest rate and term, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if they provided goods or services directly or indirectly to the holder, a description of the goods or services, their fair market value at the time they were provided, the date on which they were provided and the terms and conditions under which they were provided;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: details regarding each instance in which the key investor provides money, goods or services directly or indirectly to the holder, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of money, the amount provided, the date on which it is provided and the terms and conditions under which it is provided, and if the money is provided in the form of a loan, the interest rate and term, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of goods or services, a description of the goods or services, their fair market value at the time at which they are provided, the date on which they are provided and the terms and conditions under which they are provided;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: details regarding any benefit that the key investor receives from the holder as a result of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: having provided money, goods or services to the holder, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: holding an ownership interest or other right or interest in, or in respect of, a business operated by the holder or, if the holder is an organization, in or in respect of the organization; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: details regarding each instance in which money is repaid or goods are returned to the key investor, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of money, the amount repaid and the date on which it is repaid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of goods, a description of the goods, their fair market value at the time they are returned and the date on which they are returned.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a holder that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is an organization whose equity securities are, or a class of those securities is, listed on a published market; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is wholly owned by an organization whose equity securities are, or a class of those securities is, listed on a published market.

Subsection.Text: The holder is not required to include the information referred to in paragraph (1)(c) in respect of a key investor that became such an investor before the day on which the licence was issued.

If the licence has been continued in force by virtue of subsection 158(1) of the Act, the holder is not required to include the information referred to in paragraph (1)(c) in respect of a key investor that became such an investor before the day on which these Regulations come into force.
The holder must not delete any information from the record and must indicate the effective date of the event in respect of which new information is added to the record.
For greater certainty, the information that has been included in the record in respect of a key investor must continue to be retained in the record even if the person ceases to be such an investor.
The holder must, no later than January 31 in any given year, provide the Minister with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the record; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if any person ceased to be a key investor during the previous calendar year, a document containing details regarding how and when they ceased to be such an investor.

Subsection.Text: The holder must ensure that the record is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: maintained in a manner that will enable an audit of it to be made in a timely manner;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: available at the site specified in the licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: retained for at least two years after the day on which the holder ceases to be required to maintain it.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: key investor means, in respect of the holder of a licence, a person that exercises, or is in a position to exercise, direct or indirect control over the holder by virtue of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: having provided money, goods or services directly or indirectly to the holder; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: holding an ownership interest or other right or interest in, or in respect of, a business operated by the holder or, if the holder is an organization, in or in respect of the organization. (investisseur-clé)

Definition.Text: published market means a market inside or outside Canada on which equity securities are traded, if the prices at which the securities are traded are regularly published either electronically or in a newspaper or financial or business publication of general circulation. (marché publié)

Heading.TitleText: Documents and Information Provided to Minister

Section.Text: Except as otherwise provided in these Regulations, documents that are required to be provided to the Minister under this Part, Part 8, subsection 241(7) or section 297 must be provided in the form and manner specified in the document entitled Form and Manner Requirements – Documents Provided to the Minister for the Purposes of the Cannabis Act, as amended from time to time and published by the Government of Canada on its website.

Subsection.Text: A person that is required to ensure the retention of documents or information under these Regulations and that is not authorized under the Act to conduct activities in relation to cannabis may be required by the Minister to provide the documents or information to the Minister if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the documents are, or the information is, necessary to address an issue of public health or public safety or to verify compliance or prevent non-compliance with the provisions of the Act or of these Regulations. If the person is required to provide the documents or information to the Minister, they must do so as soon as feasible.

A person that has ceased to hold a licence and that is required to retain documents — including copies of permits — under section 239 or 240 may be required by the Minister to provide the documents to the Minister if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that they are necessary for a purpose specified in subsection (1). If the person is required to provide the documents to the Minister, they must do so as soon as feasible.

A document or information that must be provided under subsection (1) or (2) to address an issue of public health or public safety must be provided without delay if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the issue must be addressed urgently and so indicates in the request.

A holder of a licence for processing must, at least 60 days before making available for sale a cannabis product — except dried cannabis, fresh cannabis, cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds — that they have not previously sold in Canada, provide the Minister with a written notice that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the class of cannabis set out in Schedule 4 to the Act to which the cannabis product belongs;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the cannabis product, including the brand name; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the cannabis product is expected to be made available for sale.

Subsection.Text: The holder must retain a copy of the notice for at least two years after the date referred to in paragraph (1)(c).

A holder of a licence other than a cannabis drug licence must, if they experience a theft of cannabis or a loss of cannabis that cannot be explained on the basis of normally accepted business activities,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: notify a police force within 24 hours after becoming aware of its theft or loss; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide the Minister with a written notice within 10 days after becoming aware of its theft or loss.

Subsection.Text: The holder must retain a copy of the notice provided to the Minister for at least two years after the day by which the Minister must be notified.

A holder of a licence must, before commencing a voluntary recall of a cannabis product that has been sold or distributed in Canada, provide the Minister with a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the cannabis product, including the brand name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of each lot or batch of the cannabis product to be recalled, together with, if known, the number of any lot or batch of cannabis that was used to make the cannabis product;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if known, the name and address of each person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: produced or imported into Canada the cannabis that is, or is contained in, the cannabis product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: packaged or labelled the cannabis referred to in subparagraph (i) before it became, or became part of, the cannabis product,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a cannabis accessory that is a cannabis product, produced or imported into Canada the cannabis accessory or any component of it, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: packaged or labelled the cannabis product;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the reasons for commencing the recall;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the cannabis that is, or is contained in, the cannabis product was produced or imported into Canada by the holder, the quantity of cannabis that was produced or imported;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the cannabis product that was sold or distributed by the holder in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the quantity of the cannabis product that is affected by the problem or potential problem underlying the recall and that remains in the possession of the holder;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the number of persons to which the holder sold or distributed the cannabis product in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the period during which the holder sold or distributed the cannabis product in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the time and manner in which the recall is to be carried out, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the expected date for the commencement of the recall,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: how and when the Minister will be informed of the progress of the recall, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date by which the recall is expected to be completed;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a description of any other measure that the holder is taking, or intends to take, in respect of the recall; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: contact information for a representative who will be responsible for the recall.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence must, before commencing a voluntary recall of cannabis that has been exported from Canada, provide the Minister with a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the cannabis, including, if applicable, the brand name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of each lot or batch of the cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if known, the name and address of each person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: produced or imported into Canada the cannabis, and, if applicable, packaged or labelled it, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case where the cannabis is contained in a cannabis accessory, produced or imported into Canada the cannabis accessory or any component of it;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the reasons for commencing the recall;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the quantity of the cannabis that was produced or imported into Canada by the holder;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the cannabis that was sold or distributed by the holder in foreign countries;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the quantity of the cannabis that is affected by the problem or potential problem underlying the recall and that remains in the possession of the holder;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the number of persons to which the holder sold or distributed the cannabis in foreign countries;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the period during which the holder sold or distributed the cannabis in foreign countries;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the time and manner in which the recall is to be carried out, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the expected date for the commencement of the recall,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: how and when the Minister will be informed of the progress of the recall, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date by which the recall is expected to be completed;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a description of any other measure that the holder is taking, or intends to take, in respect of the recall; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: contact information for a representative who will be responsible for the recall.

Subsection.Text: The holder must, within 72 hours after providing the Minister with the document referred to in subsection (1) or (2), provide the Minister with a document that contains an evaluation of the risk associated with the problem or potential problem that underlies the recall.

The holder must, within 30 days after the day on which the recall is completed, provide the Minister with a written report that sets out the results of the recall and the measures taken to prevent a recurrence of the problem.

Despite subsection (4), the Minister may extend the period for providing the report — to a maximum of 90 days after the day on which the recall is completed — if, for reasons beyond the holder’s control, it is not feasible to provide it within the 30-day period.
The holder must retain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the documents that they provide to the Minister under subsections (1) and (3) for at least two years after the day on which their last sale or distribution of any cannabis product that is the subject of the recall takes place;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the documents that they provide to the Minister under subsections (2) and (3) for at least two years after the day on which their last export of any of the cannabis that is the subject of the recall takes place; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the report that they provide to the Minister under subsection (4) for at least two years after the day on which the recall is completed.

Section.MarginalNote: Definitions of adverse reaction and serious adverse reaction
Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this section and sections 248.1 and 248.2.

Definition.Text: adverse reaction means a noxious and unintended response to cannabis or a cannabis accessory that contains cannabis. (réaction indésirable)

serious adverse reaction means an adverse reaction that requires inpatient hospitalization or a prolongation of existing hospitalization, causes congenital malformation, results in persistent or significant disability or incapacity, is life-threatening or results in death. (réaction indésirable grave)

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence that sells or distributes a cannabis product must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: within 15 days after becoming aware of a serious adverse reaction to the cannabis product, provide the Minister with a detailed report containing all information in their possession that is associated with the use of the product by the individual who experienced the serious adverse reaction; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: prepare an annual summary report that contains a concise and critical analysis of all adverse reactions to the cannabis product that the holder became aware of during the previous 12 months.

Subsection.Text: The holder must retain the reports for at least 25 years after the day on which they are prepared.

This section does not apply in respect of an adverse reaction to cannabis, or a cannabis accessory that contains cannabis, that is distributed to human participants in the conduct of non-therapeutic research on cannabis.
During the conduct of non-therapeutic research on cannabis, the holder of a licence for research that distributes cannabis, or a cannabis accessory that contains cannabis, to human participants must,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: within seven days after becoming aware of a serious adverse reaction to the cannabis or cannabis accessory that is life-threatening or that results in death, notify the Minister of the serious adverse reaction; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: within eight days after notifying the Minister under paragraph (a), provide the Minister with a detailed report containing all information in their possession that is associated with the use of the cannabis or cannabis accessory by the individual who experienced the serious adverse reaction, including the intended use of the cannabis or cannabis accessory, an assessment of the cause of the serious adverse reaction and a statement of what further action, if any, needs to be taken by the holder of the licence.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Serious adverse reaction not life threatening
Subsection.Text: The holder of the licence must, within 15 days after becoming aware of a serious adverse reaction to the cannabis or cannabis accessory that is not life-threatening and does not result in death, provide the Minister with a detailed report containing all information in their possession that is associated with the use of the cannabis or cannabis accessory by the individual who experienced the serious adverse reaction, including the intended use of the cannabis or cannabis accessory, an assessment of the cause of the serious adverse reaction and a statement of what further action, if any, needs to be taken by the holder of the licence.

The holder must retain a record of each adverse reaction and serious adverse reaction that occurs during the holder’s conduct of non-therapeutic research on cannabis and that the holder becomes aware of.
The holder must retain the reports and record for at least 15 years after the day on which they are prepared.

Heading.TitleText: Disclosure of Information to Third Parties

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, at the request of the government of a province or any police force or other law enforcement agency in a province, disclose to the government, police force or agency any information set out in a notice that is referred to in section 7 or 35 and that relates to a site located in that province if the disclosure is for a purpose related to verifying compliance or preventing non-compliance with the provisions of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a provincial Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: regulations made under a provincial Act.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may disclose any information that is set out in a notice referred to in section 7 or 35 to a Canadian police force, or a member of a Canadian police force, that requests the information in the course of an investigation under the Act.
Information that is disclosed under subsection (2) must be used only for the purposes of the investigation or the administration or enforcement of the Act or these Regulations.

For the purpose of paragraph 83(f) of the Act, information contained in the national cannabis tracking system may be disclosed to the government of a province, at its request, if the disclosure is for a purpose related to the implementation of public health programs or activities that are related to cannabis.

The Minister may, at the request of the government of a province, disclose to the government any information obtained under section 297 if the disclosure is for a purpose related to the implementation of public health programs or activities that are related to cannabis.

In addition to the information that may be disclosed under sections 83, 128 and 129 of the Act, the Minister may disclose to the International Narcotics Control Board other information that is obtained under the Act if the disclosure is necessary to enable Canada to fulfill its international obligations in relation to cannabis.

The Minister may also disclose to the International Narcotics Control Board any information relating to cannabis that was obtained under the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act before the day on which these Regulations come into force if the disclosure is necessary to enable Canada to fulfill its international obligations in relation to cannabis.

Section.Text: The Minister may, for the purposes of the administration or enforcement of the Act or these Regulations or if it is necessary to enable Canada to fulfill its international obligations in relation to cannabis, disclose to a competent authority

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: information obtained from a person that has applied for or that holds an import or export permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: information relating to an activity authorized by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an import or export permit, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a licence held by a person that has applied for or that holds an import or export permit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any document that the holder or former holder of an import or export permit is required to retain, including any document that relates to a licence that they hold or held; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of any import or export permit.

Section.MarginalNote: Exemption — Division 2 of Part 1 of Act
Section.Text: The cannabis that is contained in a test kit that meets the requirements of paragraphs 255(a) and (b) is exempt from Subdivisions A to D of Division 2 of Part 1 of the Act.
Part 5 and section 137 do not apply to the cannabis that is contained in a test kit.
A person is authorized to sell, import or export a test kit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a registration number has been issued for the test kit and the number has not been cancelled;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the following information is included on the label that is applied to the test kit:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a test kit that is not subject to the labelling requirements of the Medical Devices Regulations,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the name and address of the manufacturer or assembler or, if applicable, the name and address of the person for which the test kit was manufactured or assembled further to a custom order, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: its brand name; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit is sold, imported or exported for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement or research purpose.

Section.Text: An individual is authorized to conduct the following activities, in relation to one or more test kits that contain a total amount of cannabis that, as determined in accordance with subsection 2(4) of the Act, is equivalent to more than the amount the individual may possess under the Act, if the registration number is included on the label of each test kit

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: possess it in a public place; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: distribute it for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement or research purpose.

Section.Text: An organization is authorized to conduct the following activities if the label of a test kit includes its registration number:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: possess the test kit; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: distribute the test kit for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer or assembler of a test kit or, if the test kit is manufactured or assembled further to a custom order, the person for which the test kit was manufactured or assembled, may apply for a registration number for the test kit by submitting an application to the Minister containing the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: particulars of the design and construction of the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the proposed use of the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the cannabis contained in the test kit, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the class of cannabis set out in column 1 of Schedule 3 to the Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, a detailed description of every other substance contained in the test kit, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of each substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the substance is a salt, the name of the salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of each substance; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the directions for use of the test kit.

Subsection.Text: An application for the registration of a test kit must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by an individual authorized by the applicant for that purpose; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include a declaration, signed and dated by that individual, indicating that all the information provided in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of their knowledge.

Section.Text: The Minister may, on receiving an application referred to in section 258, require the submission of any additional information that pertains to the information contained in the application and that is necessary for the Minister to consider the application.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister must, after examining the information and documents required under sections 258 and 259, issue a registration number for the test kit to the applicant if the applicant demonstrates that the test kit is designed to be used solely for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement or research purpose.
The Minister must refuse to issue a registration number if he or she has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit is likely to create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of cannabis being diverted to an illicit market or activity, because

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis in the test kit is too high, or
