Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the adulterating or denaturing agent in the test kit is not likely to prevent or deter consumption or administration of the cannabis; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit is likely to be used for a purpose other than any of those set out in subsection (1).

Subsection.Text: The Minister must cancel the registration number of a test kit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister receives a notice from the holder of the registration number stating that it has ceased all authorized activities referred to in section 255, 256 or 257 with respect to the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the test kit is likely to create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of cannabis being diverted to an illicit market or activity, because

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the quantity of cannabis in the test kit is too high, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the adulterating or denaturing agent in the test kit is not likely to prevent or deter consumption or administration of the cannabis, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the test kit is likely to be used for a purpose other than any of those set out in subsection 260(1); or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit is a medical device and is no longer authorized for sale in Canada under the Medical Devices Regulations.

Subsection.Text: When a registration number issued for a test kit is cancelled, the cancelled registration number

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: must not be displayed on the label of any test kit manufactured or assembled further to a custom order after the cancellation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a cancellation under paragraph (1)(a), must remain on the label of any existing test kit until all of the test kits with that registration number are disposed of.

Section.Text: If the Minister proposes to refuse to issue or to cancel a registration number, the Minister must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: send a notice to the applicant or to the holder of the registration number that sets out the reasons for the refusal or cancellation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: give the applicant or holder an opportunity to be heard in respect of the refusal or cancellation.

Subsection.Text: If a registration number issued for a test kit has been cancelled under section 261, the manufacturer or assembler of the test kit or, if the test kit is manufactured or assembled further to a custom order, the person for which the test kit was manufactured or assembled,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: may apply to the Minister for the issuance of a new registration number in accordance with section 258; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: must, in support of the application, provide the Minister with proof that the circumstance that gave rise to the cancellation has been corrected.

Subsection.Text: The Minister, after examining the application and supporting proof referred to in subsection (1), must issue a new registration number for the test kit unless there exists a circumstance set out in paragraph 261(1)(b) or (c).

Heading.Label: PART 14
Heading.TitleText: Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: adult means an individual who is 18 years of age or older. (adulte)

designated person means an individual who is designated by a registered person, in accordance with Division 2 of this Part, to produce cannabis for the medical purposes of the registered person. (personne désignée)

former Marihuana for Medical Purposes Regulations means the regulations made by Order in Council P.C. 2013-645 of June 6, 2013 and registered as SOR/2013-119. (ancien Règlement sur la marihuana à des fins médicales)
health care practitioner means, except as otherwise provided, a medical practitioner or a nurse practitioner. (praticien de la santé)
licence for sale means a licence for sale for medical purposes. (licence de vente)
medical document means a document provided by a health care practitioner to support the use of cannabis for medical purposes. (document médical)
medical practitioner means an individual who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is entitled under the laws of a province to practise medicine in that province;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is not restricted, under the laws of the province in which they practise, from authorizing the use of cannabis; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is not named in a notice issued under section 335 that has not been retracted. (médecin)

Definition.Text: named responsible adult means, in respect of a client, an adult who is named in the client’s registration document under subparagraph 282(2)(a)(iv) or subsection 285(5). (responsable nommé)
nurse practitioner means an individual who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is entitled under the laws of a province to practise as a nurse practitioner or an equivalent designation and is practising as a nurse practitioner or an equivalent designation in that province;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is not restricted, under the laws of the province in which they practise, from authorizing the use of cannabis; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is not named in a notice issued under section 335 that has not been retracted. (infirmier praticien)

Definition.Text: provincial professional licensing authority means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: except in sections 343 to 345, an authority that is responsible for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: authorizing the practise of medicine in a province, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: authorizing individuals to practise as nurse practitioners in a province; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in sections 343 to 345, an authority that is responsible for authorizing individuals to practise pharmacy in a province. (autorité provinciale attributive de licences en matière d’activités professionelles)

Definition.Text: registered person means an individual who is registered with the Minister under subsection 313(1). (personne inscrite)
registration certificate means a certificate issued by the Minister under subsection 313(1). (certificat d’inscription)
registration document means a document provided under paragraph 282(2)(a) to a client by a holder of a licence for sale. (document d’inscription)
written order means a written authorization given by a health care practitioner that a stated amount of cannabis be dispensed for the individual named in the authorization. (commande écrite)

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of paragraph (a) of the definition of nurse practitioner, a designation is equivalent when it designates an individual who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is a registered nurse;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: possesses additional educational preparation and experience related to health care;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: can autonomously make diagnoses, order and interpret diagnostic tests, prescribe drugs and perform other specific procedures under the laws of a province; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is practising their profession in accordance with one of the following provincial laws, as amended from time to time, or a similar law in another province:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the Extended Practice Regulation, Man. Reg. 43/2005, made under The Registered Nurses Act, C.C.S.M., c. R40,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: Ontario Regulation 275/94, made under the Nursing Act, 1991, S.O. 1991, c. 32, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Regulation respecting the classes of specialization of the Ordre des infirmières et infirmiers du Québec for the activities referred to in section 36.1 of the Nurses Act to be engaged in, CQLR, c. I-8, r. 8, made under the Nurses Act of Quebec, CQLR, c. I-8.

Subsection.Text: In the following provisions, the equivalency of a quantity of cannabis is to be determined in accordance with subsection 2(4) of the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subsections 267(2) to (5);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 290(1)(e);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 292(4);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 293(1);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: subparagraph 297(1)(e)(iii);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 322(1)(c);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 348(3)(a); and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 350(2).

Section.Text: This Part does not apply in respect of a drug containing cannabis.

Subsection.Text: The following individuals are authorized to possess, in a public place, cannabis — other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds — that has been obtained under the Act, subject to the applicable maximum amounts and purposes set out in this section:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an adult who is registered with a holder of a licence for sale on the basis of a medical document;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an adult who is a registered person;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an adult who, directly or indirectly, obtained the cannabis as an inpatient or outpatient of a hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an adult who is named in a registration document or a registration certificate as being responsible for an individual referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) or 267(1)(a) or (b) and who possesses the cannabis for the medical purposes of that individual;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an adult who is responsible for an individual referred to in paragraph (c) or 267(1)(c) and who possesses the cannabis for the medical purposes of that individual; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an adult who possesses the cannabis in the presence of an individual referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c) or 267(1)(a), (b) or (c) for the purpose of providing assistance in administering it to the individual.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Client registered on basis of medical document
Subsection.Text: The maximum amount of cannabis that an adult referred to in paragraph (1)(a) is authorized to possess in a public place, for their own medical purposes, is an amount that is equivalent to the lesser of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 30 times the daily quantity of dried cannabis indicated in their registration document or, if they have more than one registration document, 30 times the total of the daily quantities indicated in the registration documents, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 150 g of dried cannabis.

Subsection.Text: The maximum amount of cannabis that an adult referred to in paragraph (1)(b) is authorized to possess in a public place, for their own medical purposes, is an amount that is equivalent to the lesser of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 30 times the daily quantity of dried cannabis indicated in their registration certificate, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 150 g of dried cannabis.

Subsection.Text: The maximum amount of cannabis that an adult referred to in paragraph (1)(c) is authorized to possess in a public place, for their own medical purposes, is an amount that is equivalent to the lesser of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 30 times the daily quantity of dried cannabis indicated on the hospital label that is applied to the container in which the cannabis was provided to or for them, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 150 g of dried cannabis.

Subsection.Text: The maximum amount of cannabis that an adult referred to in paragraph (1)(d) or (e) is authorized to possess in a public place, for the medical purposes of the individual for whom they are responsible, is the maximum amount that the individual is authorized to possess under subsection (2), (3) or (4) or 267(2), (3) or (4), as the case may be.

The maximum amount of cannabis that an adult referred to in paragraph (1)(f) is authorized to possess in a public place, for the purpose of providing assistance in administering cannabis to the individual referred to in that paragraph, is an amount equivalent to the lesser of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the daily quantity of dried cannabis indicated in the individual’s registration document or registration certificate or on the hospital label that is applied to the container in which the cannabis was provided to or for the individual, as the case may be, or in the case where the individual has more than one registration document, or one or more registration documents and a registration certificate, the total of the daily quantities, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 150 g of dried cannabis.

Subsection.Text: This section does not authorize an adult who is referred to in more than one of paragraphs (1)(a) to (c) to possess, for their own medical purposes, more than the equivalent of 150 g of dried cannabis.

The following young persons are authorized to possess cannabis — other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds — that has been obtained under the Act, subject to the applicable maximum amounts and purposes set out in this section:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a young person who is registered with a holder of a licence for sale on the basis of a medical document;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a young person who is a registered person; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a young person who, directly or indirectly, obtained the cannabis as an inpatient or outpatient of a hospital.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Client registered on basis of medical document
Subsection.Text: The maximum amount of cannabis that a young person referred to in paragraph (1)(a) is authorized to possess, for their own medical purposes, is an amount that is equivalent to the lesser of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 30 times the daily quantity of dried cannabis indicated in their registration document or, if they have more than one registration document, 30 times the total of the daily quantities indicated in the registration documents, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 150 g of dried cannabis.

Subsection.Text: The maximum amount of cannabis that a young person referred to in paragraph (1)(b) is authorized to possess, for their own medical purposes, is an amount that is equivalent to the lesser of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 30 times the daily quantity of dried cannabis indicated in their registration certificate, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 150 g of dried cannabis.

Subsection.Text: The maximum amount of cannabis that a young person referred to in paragraph (1)(c) is authorized to possess, for their own medical purposes, is an amount that is equivalent to the lesser of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 30 times the daily quantity of dried cannabis indicated on the hospital label that is applied to the container in which the cannabis was provided to or for them, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 150 g of dried cannabis.

Subsection.Text: This section does not authorize a young person who is referred to in more than one of paragraphs (1)(a) to (c) to possess, for their own medical purposes, more than the equivalent of 150 g of dried cannabis.

Section.Text: Any quantity of cannabis that an individual is authorized to possess under section 266 or 267 is in addition to any other quantity of cannabis that the individual may possess under the Act.

Subsection.Text: In addition to any other quantity of cannabis that they may distribute under the Act, an adult referred to in paragraph 266(1)(d) or (e) is authorized to distribute — but not send or otherwise indirectly make available — to the individual for whom they are responsible, or transport for that individual, a quantity of cannabis, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, that does not exceed the maximum amount that the adult is authorized to possess under subsection 266(5).

In addition to any other quantity of cannabis that they may distribute under the Act, an adult referred to in paragraph 266(1)(f) is authorized to administer, give, transfer, provide or otherwise directly make available to the individual to whom the assistance is being provided a quantity of cannabis, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, that does not exceed the maximum amount that the adult is authorized to possess under subsection 266(6).

Section.Text: Despite section 71 of the Act, an authorization to possess, sell, distribute or produce cannabis that is conferred by this Part on an adult referred to in paragraphs 266(1)(a) to (f), a young person referred to in paragraphs 267(1)(a) to (c) or a designated person does not authorize an employee or agent or mandatary of the adult, young person or designated person — or a person who is acting under a contract with the adult, young person or designated person — to do anything that is prohibited by a provision of Division 1 of Part 1 of the Act.
A health care practitioner must not provide a medical document or issue a written order except as authorized under this Part.

Subsection.Text: A health care practitioner is authorized, in respect of an individual who is under their professional treatment and if cannabis is required for the condition for which the individual is receiving treatment,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to provide a medical document;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: while practising in a hospital, to issue a written order;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to administer to the individual a cannabis product, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: to transfer to the individual, or to an adult who is responsible for them, a cannabis product, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that has been received from a holder of a licence for sale or a licence for processing, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of which the quantity of cannabis does not exceed the quantity that the individual or adult is authorized to possess under section 266 or 267, as the case may be.

Subsection.Text: A health care practitioner is authorized to possess a cannabis product, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, in a public place if they have obtained it under the Act and require it for the practice of their profession in the province where they possess it.
A medical document that is provided under paragraph 272(1)(a) must indicate

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the health care practitioner’s given name, surname, profession, business address and telephone number and, if applicable, their facsimile number and email address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the province in which the health care practitioner is authorized to practise their profession and the number assigned by the province to that authorization;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the given name, surname and date of birth of the individual who is under the professional treatment of the health care practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the location at which the individual consulted with the health care practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the daily quantity of dried cannabis, expressed in grams, that the health care practitioner authorizes for the individual; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a period of use, specified as a number of days, weeks or months.

Subsection.Text: The period of use specified in a medical document must not exceed one year.
A medical document must be signed and dated by the health care practitioner who is providing it and must include a statement confirming that the information in the document is correct and complete.
A medical document is valid for the period of use specified in it, which period begins on

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the individual referred to in paragraph (1)(c) is registered with a holder of a licence for sale on the basis of the document or, if there have been previous registrations on the basis of the document, the earliest registration date; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the individual referred to in paragraph (1)(c) uses the document to register with the Minister under Division 2 of this Part and has not previously been registered with a holder of a licence for sale on the basis of the document, the date of the registration with the Minister.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (4), a medical document is valid for an additional period of six months beginning

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on the day on which this subsection comes into force, if the document ceases to be valid under subsection (4) on or after March 13, 2020 but before the day on which this subsection comes into force; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on the day after the day on which the document ceases to be valid under subsection (4) if the day on which the document ceases to be valid is on or after the day on which this subsection comes into force but before October 1, 2020.

Section.Text: A written order that is issued under paragraph 272(1)(b) must be signed and dated by the health care practitioner and must indicate

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the health care practitioner’s given name, surname and profession;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the given name and surname of the individual who is under the professional treatment of the health care practitioner; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the daily quantity of dried cannabis, expressed in grams, that the health care practitioner authorizes for the individual.

Section.Text: It is prohibited to alter or deface a medical document or other document that is issued or provided under this Part.

Section.MarginalNote: Obtaining from more than one source

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited to seek or obtain a cannabis product from more than one source at a time on the basis of the same medical document.
Despite subsection (1), if a medical document forms the basis for a registration with the Minister under Division 2 of this Part, the registration certificate may be used to obtain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cannabis products, other than cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds, from, or through, a single holder of a licence for sale; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds from one or more holders of a licence for sale.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for sale must, within 30 days after the issuance of their licence, provide a written notice to each provincial professional licensing authority and a copy to the Minister.
The notice must contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the holder, the mailing address of the site specified in the licence and, if applicable, the holder’s email address; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the licence.

Section.Text: An individual is eligible to be a client of a holder of a licence for sale only if the individual ordinarily resides in Canada.

Subsection.Text: Before registering an individual as a client, a holder of a licence for sale must receive a registration application, together with the original of the individual’s medical document or a copy of their registration certificate.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Application on basis of medical document
Subsection.Text: An application that is submitted on the basis of a medical document must include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s given name, surname and date of birth;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: either

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the address of the place in Canada where the applicant ordinarily resides, as well as, if applicable, their telephone number, facsimile number and email address, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the applicant ordinarily resides in Canada but does not ordinarily reside at a specific place, the address as well as, if applicable, the telephone number, facsimile number and email address of a shelter, hostel or similar institution located in Canada that provides them with food, lodging or other social services;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the mailing address of the place referred to in paragraph (b) if different from the address provided under that paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the place referred to in subparagraph (b)(i) is an establishment that is not a private residence, the type and name of the establishment;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of whether the shipping address is to be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the address referred to in subparagraph (b)(i),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the mailing address of the place referred to in subparagraph (b)(i), or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the health care practitioner who provided the medical document has consented to receive cannabis products on behalf of the applicant, the address of the health care practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the given name, surname and date of birth of one or more adults who are responsible for the applicant; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a statement signed and dated by the applicant, or an adult who is named under paragraph (f), confirming that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the applicant ordinarily resides in Canada,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information in the application is correct and complete,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the medical document that forms the basis for the application has not, to the knowledge of the individual signing the statement, been altered,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the medical document is not being used to seek or obtain cannabis products from another source,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case where the applicant is signing the statement, they intend to use any cannabis product that is supplied to them on the basis of the application only for their own medical purposes, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case where an adult who is named under paragraph (f) is signing the statement, they are responsible for the applicant.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Application on basis of registration certificate
Subsection.Text: An application that is submitted on the basis of a registration certificate must include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraphs (2)(a) to (d), as applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of whether the application is being made to obtain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: cannabis products, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, or both, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: cannabis products referred to in both subparagraphs (i) and (ii);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is being made to obtain cannabis products, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, an indication of which of the addresses referred to in paragraph (2)(e) is to be the shipping address;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is being made to obtain cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, an indication of whether the shipping address is to be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the address of the place where the applicant ordinarily resides,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the address of the place where the designated person, if any, ordinarily resides, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the address of the site for the production of cannabis that is specified in the registration certificate; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a statement signed and dated by the applicant, or an adult who is named in the registration certificate under paragraph 313(2)(c), confirming that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the applicant ordinarily resides in Canada,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information in the application is correct and complete,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the copy of the registration certificate is an accurate reproduction of the original,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the application is being made to obtain cannabis products other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, the registration certificate is not being used to seek or obtain the cannabis products from another source,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case where the applicant is signing the statement, they intend to use any cannabis product that is supplied to them on the basis of the application only for their own medical purposes, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case where an adult who is named in the registration certificate is signing the statement, they are responsible for the applicant.

Subsection.Text: If an institution’s address is included in the application in accordance with subparagraph (2)(b)(ii), the application must include a statement that is signed and dated by a manager of the institution confirming that it provides food, lodging or other social services to the applicant.

If an application referred to in section 279 includes, as a shipping address, the address of the health care practitioner who provided the applicant with the medical document, the application must include a statement, signed and dated by the health care practitioner, consenting to receive cannabis products, other than cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds, on the applicant’s behalf.

If the applicant becomes a client of a holder of a licence for sale under this Division and the health care practitioner ceases to consent to receive cannabis products on the behalf of the client, the health care practitioner must send a written notice to that effect to the client and the holder.
A holder of a licence for sale that intends to register an applicant whose application is based on a medical document must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: verify that the medical document meets the requirements set out in subsections 273(1) to (3);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: verify that, at the time the medical document was provided to the applicant, the individual who provided the document was a health care practitioner who was entitled to practise their profession in the province in which the applicant consulted with them; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: verify with the office of the individual referred to in paragraph (b) that the applicant consulted the individual and that the information set out in the medical document is correct and complete.

Subsection.Text: The holder is not required to do the verification referred to in paragraph (1)(c) if the signature of the health care practitioner who provided the medical document is known to the holder.

The holder must, if it appears that the applicant was previously registered on the basis of the medical document but the information referred to in subsection 288(1) does not appear on the medical document,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take reasonable steps to determine whether the applicant was previously registered on the basis of the medical document; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where they determine that the applicant was previously registered on the basis of the medical document,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: take reasonable steps to determine the date on which the applicant was first registered on that basis; and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if they determine the date referred to in subparagraph (i), ensure that it appears on the medical document in accordance with subsection 288(1).

Subsection.Text: The holder must, if a date of registration appears on the medical document but the date is illegible, incomplete or there is reason to doubt that it is accurate,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take reasonable steps to determine the date on which the applicant was first registered on the basis of the medical document; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if they determine the date referred to in paragraph (a), ensure that it appears on the medical document in accordance with subsection 288(1) unless there are reasonable grounds to believe that the date that already appears on the medical document has been falsified.

Subsection.Text: If the holder is, after taking the steps referred to in subparagraph (3)(b)(i) or paragraph (4)(a), unable to determine the date on which the applicant was first registered on the basis of the medical document, they must, if they proceed to register the applicant, indicate on the medical document the information referred to subsection 288(1) in accordance with the requirements set out in that subsection.
A holder of a licence for sale may, subject to section 284, register an applicant as a client.
A holder that registers an applicant as a client must provide them with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a registration document that contains the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the client’s given name, surname and date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the given name and surname of the health care practitioner who provided the client’s medical document,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the given name, surname and date of birth of any adults named in the application under paragraph 279(2)(f) or in the registration certificate under paragraph 313(2)(c), as the case may be,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication of whether the registration is based on a medical document or a registration certificate,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the daily quantity of dried cannabis, expressed in grams, indicated in the medical document or registration certificate,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a registration that is based on a medical document, the shipping address indicated in the application under paragraph 279(2)(e),

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a registration that is based on a registration certificate, the shipping address or addresses indicated in the application under paragraph 279(3)(c) or (d), or both, as applicable, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of expiry of the registration;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: information that will permit them to use a unique identifier for the purpose of ordering cannabis; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the current version of the document entitled Consumer Information — Cannabis, published by the Government of Canada on its website.

Section.Text: A client’s registration with a holder of a licence for sale expires

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if it is based on a medical document, at the end of the period of validity of the document, as determined in accordance with subsections 273(4) and (5); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it is based on a registration certificate, when the registration with the Minister expires.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for sale must refuse to register an applicant as a client if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the application does not meet the requirements set out in section 279 or, if applicable, subsection 280(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has reasonable grounds to believe that false or misleading information has, or false or falsified documents have, been provided in, or in support of, the application;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the requirements set out in subsection 281(1) have not been met;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the medical document that forms the basis for the application is no longer valid;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the registration with the Minister that forms the basis for the application has expired or been revoked;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the given name, surname or date of birth of the applicant is different from the given name, surname or date of birth that appears on the medical document or the copy of the registration certificate that has been submitted; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the health care practitioner who provided the medical document to the applicant notifies the holder in writing that the use of cannabis by the applicant is no longer supported for clinical reasons.

Subsection.Text: The holder must not refuse to register an applicant on the basis that there are reasonable grounds to believe that the medical document is false or falsified unless the holder has contacted the office of the health care practitioner whose name appears in the medical document to ask about the matters referred to in paragraph 281(1)(c).

If the holder proposes to refuse an applicant for a reason referred to in subsection (1) or a business reason, the holder must, without delay, send the applicant a written notice that sets out the reason for the proposed refusal.

If the holder sends a notice under subsection (3), they must not refuse to register the applicant unless the applicant has had 10 days after the day on which the applicant receives the notice to provide reasons why the refusal is unfounded.
If the holder is provided with reasons under subsection (4), they must, if they refuse to register the applicant, send the applicant a written notice of the refusal.
If the holder refuses to register an applicant whose application is based on a medical document, the holder must, without delay, return the medical document unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is clear that the document is false or falsified; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the registration is refused for a reason referred to in paragraph (1)(d) or (g).

Subsection.Text: If the holder refuses to register an applicant whose application is based on a registration certificate, the holder must, as soon as feasible, provide the Minister with a notice that includes the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the given name, surname and date of birth of the registered person named in the certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the registration number indicated in the certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the refusal; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the reasons for the refusal.

Subsection.Text: If there is a change in respect of any of the information provided under section 279, the client — or, if applicable, an adult who is responsible for them — must, without delay, submit an application to amend the registration to the holder of the licence for sale unless the client has ceased to ordinarily reside in Canada.
The application must include the following information and documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the new information;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if there has been a change to the information referred to in paragraph 279(2)(a), proof of the change;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the statement of the health care practitioner consenting to receive cannabis products on behalf of the client, as required by subsection 280(1);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is being submitted by an adult who is responsible for the client but who is not a named responsible adult, the given name, surname and date of birth of the adult; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a statement, signed and dated by the individual who is submitting the application, confirming that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the client ordinarily resides in Canada,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information included in the application is correct and complete,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case where the individual who is signing the statement is not the client, they are responsible for the client, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case where the individual who is signing the statement is neither the client nor a named responsible adult, the client and any named responsible adults have been notified of the application.

Subsection.Text: The new information that is included in the application under paragraph (2)(a) must meet the applicable requirements set out in section 279.

The holder of the licence for sale must, if they receive an application that complies with subsections (2) and (3), amend the client’s registration and provide them with an updated registration document.

If a registration is amended on the basis of an application that is signed by an adult who is neither the client nor a named responsible adult, the name of the adult who signed the application must be included in the updated registration document.
A holder of a licence for sale must, without delay, revoke a client’s registration if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the client — or, if applicable, a named responsible adult — requests it;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the medical document that forms the basis for the registration is transferred to another holder of a licence for sale under section 287;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has reasonable grounds to believe the client has ceased to ordinarily reside in Canada or ceased to have a shipping address in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has reasonable grounds to believe that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration was made on the basis of false or misleading information provided in, or false or falsified documents provided in support of, the registration application, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: false or misleading information was, or false or falsified documents were, provided in, or in support of, an amendment application under section 285;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the health care practitioner who provided the medical document notifies the holder in writing that the use of cannabis by the client is no longer supported for clinical reasons;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the registration is based on a registration certificate, the holder becomes aware that the registration with the Minister has been revoked; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the client dies.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for sale may revoke a client’s registration for a business reason.

A holder of a licence for sale whose licence is revoked must, without delay, revoke the registrations of all of their clients and send each client a written notice that sets out the reason for the revocation.
Before revoking a registration under subsection (1) or (2), the holder must send the client a written notice that sets out the reason for the proposed revocation unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the client has requested that the registration be revoked or that the medical document that forms the basis for the registration be transferred;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the named responsible adult, if any, who signed the most recent statement that was included in an application that was submitted under section 279 or 285 to the holder in respect of the client has requested that the registration be revoked or that the medical document that forms the basis for the registration be transferred;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the client — or, if applicable, the named responsible adult referred to in paragraph (b) — has consented to the transfer of the medical document that forms the basis for the registration;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the client has died; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has received a notice of revocation referred to in subsection 319(1) in respect of the client.

Subsection.Text: If the holder sends a notice under subsection (4), the holder must not revoke the registration unless the client has had 10 days after the day on which they receive the notice to provide reasons why the revocation is unfounded.
If the holder revokes a registration that is based on a medical document, they must, without delay, return the document to the client unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is clear that the document is false or falsified; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the registration is revoked for a reason referred to in paragraph (1)(b), (e) or (g).

Subsection.Text: If the holder revokes a registration that is based on a registration certificate, they must, as soon as feasible, provide the Minister with a notice that includes the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the given name, surname and date of birth of the registered person named in the certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the registration number indicated in the certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the revocation; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the reason for the revocation.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for sale must, without delay, transfer the medical document that forms the basis for a client’s registration to another holder of a licence for sale if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the client — or, if applicable, a named responsible adult — requests, or consents to, the transfer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder to which the document is to be transferred consents to the transfer; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: no revocation of the registration is pending for a reason referred to in any of paragraphs 286(1)(c) to (g).

Subsection.Text: The holder that transfers the medical document must send the information contained in the client’s registration document to the holder to which the document is transferred.

The holder to which the medical document is transferred must, after receiving the information referred to in subsection (2), register the client and comply with the requirements set out in subsection 282(2).

Section.MarginalNote: Requirement to indicate date of registration

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for sale must, before returning a medical document under subsection 286(6) or transferring such a document under section 287, indicate the following information on the document in indelible ink if no date of registration appears on the document:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the client was registered, in the order of day, month and year, preceded by the words “date of registration” or “date d’inscription”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the holder.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, the obligation in subsection (1) applies in respect of the medical document of an individual who was not registered under this Part but who is a client of the holder by virtue of subsection 158(7) of the Act.

Subject to the other provisions of these Regulations, a holder of a licence for sale is authorized to sell cannabis products to a client — or, if applicable, to a named responsible adult — if the holder has received from the client or the named responsible adult

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a written purchase order that complies with subsection (2); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a verbal purchase order that has been recorded in accordance with subsection (3).

Subsection.Text: A written purchase order must contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which it is placed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the given name, surname and date of birth of the client;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the given name and surname of the individual placing the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the shipping address specified in the client’s registration document for the cannabis products that are being ordered;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the client’s unique identifier; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the names assigned by the holder of the licence for sale to the cannabis products being ordered, the quantities desired and the brand names.

Subsection.Text: The record of a verbal purchase order must be in writing and contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraphs (2)(a) to (f);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an order number; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the individual with whom the order was placed.

Subsection.MarginalNote: New medical document or registration certificate
Subsection.Text: For greater certainty,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the authorization to sell cannabis products that is conferred by subsection (1) applies only in respect of the medical document or registration certificate that forms the basis for the client’s registration;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the client wishes to obtain cannabis products from the holder on the basis of a different medical document or registration certificate, they must submit to the holder a new registration application that meets the requirements set out in section 279 and be registered on the basis of that document or certificate; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sections 280 to 284 apply in respect of a registration application referred to in paragraph (b).

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for sale must refuse to fill a purchase order — and must not ask a holder of a licence for processing or cultivation to fill it — if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the order does not meet the requirements of section 289;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any of the information referred to in paragraph 289(2)(b), (c) or (d) does not correspond to the information set out in the client’s registration document;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the client’s unique identifier referred to in paragraph 289(2)(e) is not correct;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the client’s registration has expired or been revoked;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the order specifies cannabis products, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, in respect of which the quantities of cannabis exceed the equivalent of 150 g of dried cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a client who is registered on the basis of a medical document, the order specifies a quantity of cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the order specifies a total quantity of cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds that, taking into account the seed-to-plant ratio specified in subsection (2), exceeds the maximum number of plants, determined in accordance with section 325, that are authorized to be under production by virtue of the client’s registration with the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the order has been previously filled.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of paragraph (1)(g), three cannabis plant seeds are equivalent to one cannabis plant.

If the holder of the licence refuses to fill a purchase order, they must, except in the case of a refusal for a reason referred to in paragraph (1)(d), send the client a written notice that sets out the reason for the refusal.

A holder of a licence for sale that sells a cannabis product under section 289 is authorized to send or deliver it to the relevant shipping address that is specified in the client’s registration document unless, in the case where the shipping address is the address of a health care practitioner,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has received a written notice from the health care practitioner indicating that they have ceased to consent to receive cannabis products on the client’s behalf; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has received a notice issued by the Minister under section 335 that names the health care practitioner and that has not been retracted.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for sale that receives a notice referred to in paragraph (1)(a) or (b) must not ask a holder of a licence for processing to send or deliver cannabis products to a client whose shipping address is the address of the health care practitioner who sent the notice or is named in it, as the case may be.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Notice to holder of processing licence
Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for sale that has asked a holder of a licence for processing to send or deliver cannabis products to the address of a health care practitioner must, without delay, provide the holder of the processing licence with a written notice if, within 48 hours after making the request, the holder of the sale licence receives

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a notice referred to in paragraph (1)(a) from the health care practitioner; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a notice referred to in paragraph (1)(b) that names the health care practitioner.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for processing that receives a notice under subsection (3) must not send or deliver the cannabis products that they had been asked to send or deliver.

An individual to whom cannabis products are sold under section 289 — or a designated person to whom cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds are sent or delivered under section 291 — may return the cannabis products if the holder of the licence for sale accepts the return.

The individual who is returning the cannabis products must, subject to subsection (3), send them or have them delivered to the holder of the licence for sale or the holder of a licence for processing or cultivation, as indicated by the holder of the licence for sale.

In the case of cannabis products that were transferred to the individual by a health care practitioner who had consented under subsection 280(1) to receive them, the individual who is returning the cannabis products may, with the consent of the health care practitioner, give them, send them or have them delivered to the health care practitioner.

The individual who is returning the cannabis products must, if they are sending or having delivered cannabis plants — or other cannabis products in respect of which the total quantity of cannabis exceeds the equivalent of 30 g of dried cannabis,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prepare the parcel in a manner that ensures the security of its contents, such that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it will not open or permit the escape of its contents during handling and transportation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it is sealed so that it cannot be opened without the seal being broken,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: except in the case of cannabis plants, it prevents the escape of odours associated with cannabis plant material, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: it prevents its contents from being identified without it being opened; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: use a method that ensures the tracking and safekeeping of the parcel during transportation.

Subsection.Text: A health care practitioner must ensure that the requirements set out in paragraphs (4)(a) and (b) are met if they are sending or having delivered cannabis products referred to in subsection (4) that have been returned to them under subsection (3).

A holder of a licence for sale to which cannabis products, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, are returned in accordance with section 292 may replace them with cannabis products, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, in respect of which the total quantity of cannabis does not exceed the equivalent of 150 g of dried cannabis.

A holder of a licence for sale to which cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds are returned in accordance with section 292 may replace them with a quantity of cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, or both, that does not exceed, taking into account the seed-to-plant ratio specified in subsection 290(2), the maximum number of plants, determined in accordance with section 325, that are authorized to be under production under the client’s registration with the Minister.

A holder of a licence for processing may replace cannabis products that have been returned in accordance with section 292 with cannabis products in respect of which the total quantity of cannabis, according to information provided by the holder of the licence for sale, does not exceed the applicable quantity of cannabis referred to in subsection (1) or (2).

A holder of a licence for cultivation may replace cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds that have been returned in accordance with section 292 with a quantity of cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, or both, that, according to information provided by the holder of the licence for sale, does not exceed the quantity of cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds that could be replaced by the holder of the licence for sale under subsection (2).

Heading.TitleText: Sale, Display and Promotion to Young Persons

Section.MarginalNote: Sale of cannabis accessories to young persons
Section.Text: A holder of a licence for sale is authorized to sell a cannabis accessory — other than a cannabis accessory referred to in section 31 of the Act or a device referred to in subsection 202(2) — to a young person if the holder takes reasonable steps to ensure that the young person is authorized to possess cannabis under section 267.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for sale is authorized to display a cannabis product, or a package or label of a cannabis product, in a manner that may result in the cannabis product, package or label being seen by a young person if the holder takes reasonable steps to ensure that any such young person is authorized to possess cannabis under section 267.

A holder of a licence for sale that sells a cannabis accessory is authorized to display it, or its package or label, in a manner that may result in the cannabis accessory, package or label being seen by a young person if the holder takes reasonable steps to ensure that any such young person is authorized to possess cannabis under section 267.

Section.MarginalNote: Promotion of cannabis products — young persons

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for sale that promotes a cannabis product by means of informational promotion or brand-preference promotion that is communicated by means of a telecommunication is exempt from the condition set out in paragraph 17(2)(c) of the Act if they have taken reasonable steps to ensure that the promotion cannot be accessed by a young person other than a young person who is authorized to possess cannabis under section 267.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Promotion of cannabis accessories — young persons
Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for sale that promotes a cannabis accessory by means of informational promotion or brand-preference promotion that is communicated by means of a telecommunication is exempt from the condition set out in paragraph 17(3)(c) of the Act if they have taken reasonable steps to ensure that the promotion cannot be accessed by a young person other than a young person who is authorized to possess cannabis under section 267.
A holder of a licence for sale must, on or before the 15th day of each month, provide the Minister with a report that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number of clients who had a valid registration on the last day of the previous month;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of clients who, in the previous month, had their medical document transferred to another holder of a licence for sale or returned to them at their request or at the request of a named responsible adult;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the medical documents that formed the basis for registrations that were valid on the last day of the previous month,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the average daily quantity of dried cannabis, expressed in grams,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the median daily quantity of dried cannabis, expressed in grams, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the highest daily quantity of dried cannabis, expressed in grams;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the number of applicants whom the holder refused to register during the previous month, including the number of them who were refused for each of the following reasons:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the application was incomplete,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder had reasonable grounds to believe that false or misleading information was, or false or falsified documents were, provided in, or in support of, the application, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the medical document or registration certificate that formed the basis for the application was not valid;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the number of purchase orders referred to in subsection 289(1) that the holder refused to fill during the previous month, including the number of them that were refused for each of the following reasons:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the purchase order was incomplete,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the client’s registration had expired or been revoked,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the purchase order specified cannabis products, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, in respect of which the quantities of cannabis exceeded the equivalent of 150 g of dried cannabis, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the cannabis product specified in the purchase order was unavailable;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the given name, surname, profession and business address of each health care practitioner who provided a medical document referred to in paragraph (c), together with the province in which the health care practitioner was authorized to practise their profession at the time they signed the document and the number assigned by the province to that authorization; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the number of medical documents referred to in paragraph (c) that were signed by each health care practitioner referred to in paragraph (f).

Subsection.Text: In this section, health care practitioner means an individual who is, or was, a medical practitioner or nurse practitioner.

A holder of a licence for sale must, if they are provided with an individual’s given name, surname, and date of birth by a member of a Canadian police force who requests information in the course of an investigation under the Act, disclose the following information to the police force as soon as feasible and no later than 72 hours after receiving the request:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of whether the individual is a client of the holder or a named responsible adult in respect of such a client;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the individual is an individual referred to in paragraph (a),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication of whether the client is a registered person and, if so, the classes of cannabis that the client is permitted to obtain by virtue of their registration with the holder, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the daily quantity of dried cannabis that is specified in the client’s registration document in accordance with subparagraph 282(2)(a)(vi).

Subsection.Text: Information provided under this section must be used only for the purposes of the investigation or the administration or enforcement of the Act or these Regulations.

A holder of a licence for sale must disclose, in writing and as soon as feasible, factual information about a health care practitioner — in relation to cannabis — that they have obtained under the Act or the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the provincial professional licensing authority for a province in which the health care practitioner is, or was, entitled to practise if the licensing authority submits to the holder a written request that sets out the health care practitioner’s name and address, a description of the information being requested and a statement that the information is required for the purpose of assisting an investigation by the authority; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the provincial professional licensing authority for a province in which the health care practitioner is not entitled to practise if the licensing authority submits to the holder

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a written request that sets out the health care practitioner’s name and address and a description of the information being requested, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a document that shows that

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the health care practitioner has applied to the licensing authority to practise in that province, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the licensing authority has reasonable grounds to believe that the health care practitioner is practising in that province without being authorized to do so.

Subsection.Text: The factual information that may be requested includes information — including patient information — contained in, or in respect of, any medical document that was signed by the health care practitioner.
Despite subsection (2), the factual information that may be requested does not include information relating to an individual who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is or was registered as a client of the holder on the basis of a registration with the Minister under Division 2 of this Part; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the holder was a licensed producer under the former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations, was registered as a client of the licensed producer under section 133 of those Regulations on the basis of a registration with the Minister under Part 2 of those Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The holder must ensure that the information that they disclose under this section is securely transmitted in an electronic format that is accessible to the provincial professional licensing authority.
In this section, health care practitioner means an individual who is, or was, a medical practitioner or nurse practitioner.

A provincial professional licensing authority may submit a written request to a holder of a licence for sale to obtain information, on a quarterly basis, in respect of each client who is registered with the holder on the basis of a medical document that was signed by a health care practitioner who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: was, at the time that they signed the medical document, entitled to practise the profession regulated by the licensing authority in the province in question; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: was consulted in that province.

Subsection.Text: A holder that has received a request referred to in subsection (1) must, after the end of each quarter and in accordance with subsection (3), provide the provincial professional licensing authority with a report containing the following information in respect of each client referred to in subsection (1) who was validly registered at any time during the relevant quarter, together with details of any changes to the information that occurred during the quarter:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the client’s given name, surname and date of birth;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the postal code for the address that was provided under paragraph 279(2)(b), together with the province specified in the address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the given name, surname and business address of the health care practitioner who signed the medical document, together with the number assigned by the province to the health care practitioner’s authorization to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the daily quantity of dried cannabis specified in the medical document;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the period of use specified in the medical document;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the medical document was signed by the health care practitioner; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: for each shipment of cannabis products that was sent or delivered during the quarter,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date it was sent or delivered,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis that was sent or delivered, expressed in grams, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the class of cannabis set out in Schedule 4 to the Act to which the cannabis products belong.

Subsection.Text: The report must be provided to the provincial professional licensing authority no later than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: April 30 of a given year for the quarter beginning on January 1 and ending on March 31 of that year;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: July 31 of a given year for the quarter beginning on April 1 and ending on June 30 of that year;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: October 31 of a given year for the quarter beginning on July 1 and ending on September 30 of that year; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: January 31 of a given year for the quarter beginning on October 1 and ending on December 31 of the previous year.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, the first quarter in respect of which a report must be provided is the quarter in which the request is received from the provincial professional licensing authority.

If the holder has no information to include in a report for a quarter, they must send a notice to that effect to the provincial professional licensing authority by the relevant deadline referred to in subsection (3).

If the holder ceases to conduct activities, they must, despite subsection (3), provide the provincial professional licensing authority with the report for the quarter in which the activities cease within 30 days after ceasing them.

The provincial professional licensing authority may, at any time, send the holder a notice cancelling the request referred to in subsection (1), in which case the final quarter in respect of which a report must be provided is the one that precedes the quarter in which the notice is received.

A holder, or former holder, that provides a report to a provincial professional licensing authority under this section must transmit it securely in an electronic format that is accessible to the licensing authority.

A holder of a licence for sale must, each time that they do verifications under subsection 281(1), retain a document that contains details of the verifications and of any measures taken under subsections 281(3) to (5).
The document must be retained for at least two years after the day on which it is prepared.
A holder of a licence for sale must retain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: each registration application that they receive under subsection 279(1), together with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an application that is based on a medical document, the original of the medical document or, in the case where the medical document has been returned under subsection 284(6) or 286(6) or transferred under subsection 287(1), a copy of it that includes, if applicable, the information referred to in section 288, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an application that is based on a registration certificate, the copy of the certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of each registration document that they provide under paragraph 282(2)(a) and of each updated registration document that they provide under subsection 285(4);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: each amendment application referred to in section 285 that they receive;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of each notice that they send or provide under subsection 284(3), (5) or (7), 286(3), (5) or (7), 290(3) or 291(3);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: each notice referred to in paragraph 291(1)(a) or (b) that they receive; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: each notification referred to in paragraph 284(1)(g) or 286(1)(e) that they receive.

Subsection.Text: The documents referred to in subsection (1) must be retained

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of documents referred to in paragraphs (1)(a), (c), (e) and (f), for at least two years after the day on which they are received; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the copies referred to in paragraphs (1)(b) and (d), for at least two years after the day on which the registration document or notice was provided or sent.

Section.Text: A holder of a licence for sale must maintain documentation as to the steps that they take to satisfy the conditions set out in sections 294 to 296 and retain each version of the documentation for at least two years after the day on which it is replaced by a new version or, if it has not been replaced, for at least two years after the day on which the licence expires or is revoked.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for sale must retain, in respect of each purchase order referred to in section 289 that they fill or cause to be filled, a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the given name, surname and date of birth of the client;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the given name and surname of the individual who placed the purchase order;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the purchase order was placed;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the names they have assigned to the cannabis products that are sent or delivered and the brand names;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis that is sent or delivered;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the cannabis products are sent or delivered; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the address to which the cannabis products are sent or delivered.

Subsection.Text: The holder must retain the document — together with the relevant written purchase order or, in the case of a verbal purchase order, the record referred to in subsection 289(3) — for at least two years after the day on which the document is prepared.
A holder of a licence for sale must retain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of each notice that they provide to a provincial professional licensing authority under section 277, together with the copy that they provide to the Minister under that section;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of each request that they receive from a provincial professional licensing authority under subsection 299(1),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of the request, together with any supporting documentation received,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a written record of the date on which the request and any documentation are received,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of the information that they disclose in response to the request,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a written record of the date on which the information is disclosed, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a written record of the steps that are taken to ensure that the information is securely transmitted to the authority;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of each request or notice referred to in section 300 that they receive from a provincial professional licensing authority, together with a written record of the date on which it is received;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of each report that they provide to a provincial professional licensing authority under section 300, together with a written record of the date on which it is provided and the steps that are taken to ensure that it is securely transmitted; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of any notice that they send to a provincial professional licensing authority under subsection 300(5).

Subsection.Text: The documents referred to in subsection (1) must be retained for at least two years after

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the documents referred to in paragraph (1)(a), the day on which the notice is provided to the licensing authority;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the documents referred to in paragraph (1)(b), the day on which the information is disclosed to the licensing authority;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of documents referred to in paragraph (1)(c), the day on which the request or notice is received from the licensing authority;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of documents referred to in paragraph (1)(d), the day by which the holder is required to provide the report to the licensing authority; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a notice referred to in paragraph (1)(e), the end of the quarter to which the notice relates.

Section.Text: For the purposes of paragraphs 312(3)(g) and 326(1)(b), a parcel of land is considered to be adjacent to another parcel of land if its boundary has at least one point in common with the boundary of the other parcel of land.

Subsection.Text: An application that is submitted under this Division must be signed and dated by the individual who is submitting it and must include a statement by the individual confirming that the information included in the application is correct and complete.
If the application is signed by an adult who is responsible for the applicant, it must include a statement by the adult confirming that they are responsible for the applicant.

Section.Text: The Minister may, on receiving an application under this Division, require the submission of any additional information that pertains to the information contained in the application and that is necessary for the Minister to consider the application.

Subsection.Text: An individual is eligible to be a registered person only if they ordinarily reside in Canada.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Eligibility – production for own medical purposes
Subsection.Text: An individual is eligible to produce cannabis for their own medical purposes as a registered person only if they are an adult.
An individual is not eligible to produce cannabis for their own medical purposes as a registered person if, within the preceding 10 years, they have been convicted, as an adult, of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a sale, distribution or export offence that was committed while they were authorized to produce cannabis under this Division;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a designated cannabis offence that was committed while they were authorized under the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act — other than under the former Marihuana Medical Access Regulations — to produce a substance that was referred to in item 1 of Schedule II to that Act, as that item read immediately before the coming into force of subsection 204(1) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a designated marihuana offence that was committed while they were authorized to produce marihuana

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: under the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act, other than under the former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by virtue of an injunction order issued by a court; or
