Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an offence committed outside Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted an offence referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (c).

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: designated cannabis offence means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an offence — in relation to a substance that was referred to in item 1 of Schedule II to the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act, as that item read immediately before the coming into force of subsection 204(1) of the Act — under section 5 of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act, or under section 6 of that Act except with respect to importation; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a conspiracy or an attempt to commit, being an accessory after the fact in relation to, or any counselling in relation to, an offence referred to in paragraph (a). (infraction désignée relativement au chanvre indien)

Definition.Text: designated marihuana offence means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an offence, in relation to marihuana, under section 5 of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act, or under section 6 of that Act except with respect to importation; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a conspiracy or an attempt to commit, being an accessory after the fact in relation to, or any counselling in relation to, an offence referred to in paragraph (a). (infraction désignée relativement à la marihuana)

Definition.Text: former Marihuana Medical Access Regulations means the regulations made by Order in Council P.C. 2001-1146 of June 14, 2001 and registered as SOR/2001-227. (ancien Règlement sur l’accès à la marihuana à des fins médicales)

marihuana means the substance referred to as “Cannabis (marihuana)” in subitem 1(2) of Schedule II to the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act, as that subitem read immediately before the coming into force of subsection 204(1) of the Act. (marihuana)
sale, distribution or export offence means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an offence under subsection 9(1) or (2), 10(1) or (2) or 11(1) or (2) of the Act, with the exception of an offence under subsection 11(1) with respect to importation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an offence under subsection 14(1) of the Act in respect of the commission of an offence referred to in paragraph (a); or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a conspiracy or an attempt to commit, being an accessory after the fact in relation to, or any counselling in relation to, an offence referred to in paragraph (a) or (b). (infraction relative à la vente, à la distribution ou à l’exportation)

Section.Text: An individual is not eligible to be registered under this Division more than once at any one time.

Subsection.Text: An individual is eligible to be a designated person only if they are an adult who ordinarily resides in Canada.
An individual is not eligible to be a designated person if, within the preceding 10 years, they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: have been convicted, as an adult, of a designated offence or a controlled substance offence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: have been convicted, as an adult, of an offence committed outside Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted an offence referred to in paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: were a young person who received an adult sentence, as those terms are defined in subsection 2(1) of the Youth Criminal Justice Act, in respect of an offence referred to in paragraph (a); or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: received a sentence — for an offence they committed outside Canada when they were at least 14 years old but less than 18 years old that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted an offence referred to in paragraph (a) — that was longer than the maximum youth sentence that could have been imposed under the Youth Criminal Justice Act for such an offence.

Subsection.Text: Before registering an individual under this Division, the Minister must receive an application for registration and the original of the individual’s medical document.
The registration application must contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s given name, surname and date of birth;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: unless the applicant intends to produce cannabis for their own medical purposes, either

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the address of the place in Canada where the applicant ordinarily resides, as well as, if applicable, their telephone number, facsimile number and email address, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the applicant ordinarily resides in Canada but does not ordinarily reside at a specific place, the address, as well as, if applicable, the telephone number, facsimile number and email address of a shelter, hostel or similar institution, located in Canada, that provides them with food, lodging or other social services;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the mailing address of the place referred to in paragraph (b) if different from the address provided under that paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the place referred to in subparagraph (b)(i) is an establishment that is not a private residence, the type and name of the establishment;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the given name, surname and date of birth of one or more adults who are responsible for the applicant, including any adult who is signing the application;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an indication that the individual who is signing the application will

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: comply with the possession limit referred to in section 266 that applies to them, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if they are not the applicant, take reasonable steps to ensure that the applicant will comply with the possession limits that apply to them;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of whether

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the applicant intends to produce cannabis for their own medical purposes,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: cannabis is to be produced for the medical purposes of the applicant by a designated person, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: cannabis will not be produced under the registration; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant intends to produce cannabis for their own medical purposes, or to have it produced by a designated person, an indication that the individual who is signing the application will

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: take reasonable steps to ensure the security of the cannabis in their possession that they are authorized to produce, or that is produced for the medical purposes of the applicant, under this Division, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if they are not the applicant, ensure that the applicant takes reasonable steps to ensure the security of the cannabis in the applicant’s possession that has been produced under this Division.

Subsection.Text: If the applicant intends to produce cannabis for their own medical purposes, the application must also include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the place in Canada where they ordinarily reside, as well as, if applicable, their telephone number, facsimile number and email address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the information referred to in paragraphs (2)(c) and (d) as it relates to the place referred to in paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an indication that, within the 10 years preceding the application, they have not been convicted, as an adult, of an offence referred to in subsection 309(3);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an indication that they will comply with the limit on the number of cannabis plants under production, as specified in the registration certificate to be issued under subsection 313(1);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the full address of the site where the proposed production of cannabis plants is to be conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of whether the proposed production area is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: entirely indoors,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: entirely outdoors, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: partly indoors and partly outdoors; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if there is to be any outdoor production, an indication that the site referred to in paragraph (e) is not adjacent to a school, public playground, daycare facility or other public place frequented mainly by young persons.

Subsection.Text: If cannabis is to be produced by a designated person, the application must include a declaration by the designated person that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraph (2)(a) and subparagraph (2)(b)(i) — and, if applicable, paragraphs (2)(c) and (d) — in respect of that person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraphs (3)(e) to (g);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an indication that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: within the 10 years preceding the day on which the declaration is made, they have not been convicted of an offence referred to in paragraph 311(2)(a) or (b) or received a sentence referred to in paragraph 311(2)(c) or (d),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they will take reasonable steps to ensure the security of the cannabis in their possession that they produce under this Division, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: they will comply with the limit on the number of cannabis plants under production, as specified in the document to be provided under subsection 313(3); and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a document, issued by a Canadian police force within the 90 days preceding the date on which the application is submitted, establishing that, within the 10 years preceding the date on which the document is issued, the designated person has not been convicted of an offence referred to in paragraph 311(2)(a) or received a sentence referred to in paragraph 311(2)(c).

Subsection.Text: The declaration must be signed and dated by the designated person and must include a statement by them confirming that the information contained in the declaration is correct and complete.

If the proposed site for the production of cannabis plants is not the ordinary place of residence of, and is not owned by, the applicant or, if applicable, the designated person, the application must include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the full name, address and telephone number of the owner of the site; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration, signed and dated by the site’s owner — or, if the owner is a corporation, by an authorized representative of the owner — consenting to the production of cannabis at the site.

Subsection.Text: If an institution’s address is included in the application in accordance with subparagraph (2)(b)(ii), the application must include a statement that is signed and dated by a manager of the institution confirming that it provides food, lodging or other social services to the applicant.
If the requirements set out in section 312 are met, the Minister must, subject to section 317, register the applicant and issue them a registration certificate.
The registration certificate must contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the given name, surname and date of birth of the registered person and, if applicable, the designated person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the address specified in the application under paragraph 312(2)(b) and, if applicable, the address of the place where the designated person ordinarily resides;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the given name, surname and date of birth of any adults who are named in the application under paragraph 312(2)(e);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a unique registration number;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the health care practitioner who provided the medical document that forms the basis for the registration;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the daily quantity of dried cannabis, expressed in grams, that is specified in the medical document that forms the basis for the registration;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the maximum quantity of dried cannabis, expressed in grams, that the registered person is authorized to possess by virtue of the registration, as determined in accordance with subsection 266(3) or 267(3), as the case may be;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the registration;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry of the registration;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the type of production that is authorized, namely, production by the registered person or production by a designated person;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the full address of the site where the production of cannabis plants is authorized by virtue of the registration;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, an indication of whether the authorized production area is entirely indoors, entirely outdoors or partly indoors and partly outdoors; and

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the maximum number of cannabis plants, determined in accordance with section 325, that may be under production at the production site by virtue of the registration and, if applicable, the maximum number of plants for each indoor and outdoor production period.

Subsection.Text: If a designated person is named in the registration certificate, the Minister must provide them with a document containing information relating to the production of cannabis that is authorized, including the information referred to in paragraphs (2)(g) to (m) and the given name and surname of any adults who are named in the registration certificate under paragraph (2)(c).

Section.Text: The registration of a registered person expires at the end of the period of validity of the medical document that forms the basis for the registration, as determined in accordance with subsections 273(4) and (5).

Subsection.Text: To renew a registration, the registered person, or an adult who is responsible for them, must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: submit an application to the Minister that includes the registration number and the information and documents required under subsections 312(2) to (7); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that a new medical document is sent to the Minister.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister has received an application and medical document under subsection (1) but has not notified the applicant of the Minister’s decision in respect of the application before the current registration expires, the registration remains valid until the Minister notifies the applicant — and, in the case of a refusal to renew the registration, the designated person, if any — of the decision.
If a renewal application has been submitted in accordance with paragraph (1)(a) and the Minister has received a new medical document under paragraph (1)(b), the Minister must, subject to section 317,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: renew the registration;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide the registered person with a new registration certificate; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if there is a designated person, provide them with an updated version of the document referred to in subsection 313(3).

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, a renewed registration replaces the previous one.

Subject to subsection (2), to amend any of the information in a registration certificate, the registered person, or an adult who is responsible for them, must submit an application to the Minister that includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the registration number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the proposed amendment and the supporting reasons for it;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the information and documents referred to in section 312 that are relevant to the proposed amendment;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the event that has necessitated the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if there has been a change to the given name or surname of an individual who is named in the registration certificate under paragraph 313(2)(a) or (c), proof of the change.

Subsection.Text: An amendment application cannot be submitted in respect of a new medical document.
If an application is submitted in accordance with subsection (1), the Minister must, subject to section 317,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: amend the registration;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide the registered person with an amended registration certificate; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if there is a designated person, provide them with an updated version of the document referred to in subsection 313(3).

Subsection.Text: If, as a result of the renewal or amendment of a registration, an individual ceases to be a designated person, the Minister must notify them of the loss of their authorization to produce cannabis under the registration.

If, as a result of a renewal or amendment, the location of the authorized site for the production of cannabis plants — or the place of residence of the registered person or designated person — is changed, the Minister may specify the period during which the registered person or, if applicable, the designated person is authorized to transport cannabis from the former site or place of residence to the new site or place of residence.

Section.MarginalNote: Refusal to register, renew or amend

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to register an applicant or to renew or amend a registration if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant is not eligible under subsection 309(1) or section 310;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the medical document that forms the basis for the application does not meet all of the requirements of section 273 or is no longer valid;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: at the time the medical document was provided to the applicant, the individual who provided it

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: was not a health care practitioner, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: was not entitled to practise their profession in the province in which the applicant consulted with them;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the given name, surname or date of birth of the applicant is different from the given name, surname or date of birth that appears on the medical document;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the health care practitioner who provided the medical document notifies the Minister in writing that the use of cannabis by the applicant is no longer supported for clinical reasons;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that false or misleading information has, or false or falsified documents have, been provided in, or in support of, the application;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the registration, renewal or amendment would result in the applicant or, if applicable, the designated person being authorized to produce cannabis plants under more than two registrations;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the registration, renewal or amendment would result in the proposed site for the production of cannabis plants being authorized under more than four registrations;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the applicant intends to produce cannabis for their own medical purposes, the applicant is not eligible under subsection 309(2) or (3); and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where cannabis is to be produced by a designated person, the individual who has been designated is not eligible under section 311.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may refuse to register an applicant or renew or amend a registration if, in the case where cannabis is to be produced by the applicant or a designated person, the registration, renewal or amendment is likely to create a risk to public health or public safety, including the risk of cannabis being diverted to an illicit market or activity.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Notice and opportunity to be heard
Subsection.Text: Before refusing to register an applicant or refusing to amend or renew a registration, the Minister must send the applicant a written notice that sets out the reason for the proposed refusal and give them an opportunity to be heard.
The Minister must revoke a registration if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the registered person is not eligible under section 309;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the designated person is not eligible under section 311;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the registration was issued, amended or renewed on the basis of false or misleading information or false or falsified documents;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the health care practitioner who provided the medical document that forms the basis for the registration notifies the Minister in writing that the use of cannabis by the registered person is no longer supported for clinical reasons;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the registered person — or an adult who is named in the registration certificate under paragraph 313(2)(c) — requests, in writing, that the registration be revoked; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the registered person dies.

Subsection.Text: If a site for the production of cannabis plants is authorized under more than four registrations, the Minister must revoke the excess registrations.

The Minister may revoke a registration if, in the case where the registered person or designated person is authorized to produce cannabis, the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the revocation is necessary to protect public health or public safety, including to prevent cannabis from being diverted to an illicit market or activity.
Before revoking a registration, the Minister must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where it is to be revoked for a reason set out in any of paragraphs (1)(a) to (d) or subsection (2) or (3),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: send the registered person a written notice that sets out the reason for the proposed revocation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: give them an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, send the designated person a written notice of the proposed revocation.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, if a registration is revoked, the activities that were previously authorized under Subdivision B by virtue of the registration cease to be authorized.

If a registration is revoked and the Minister is aware that the registration has formed the basis for a registration with a holder of a licence for sale under Division 1 of this Part, the Minister must provide the holder with a notice of revocation that includes the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the given name, surname and date of birth of the individual whose registration has been revoked;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the registration number of the revoked registration; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the revocation.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a licence for sale that is notified under subsection (1) must, if within the previous 48 hours they have asked a holder of a licence for processing or cultivation to send or deliver cannabis products to, or for, the individual whose registration has been revoked, notify the holder of the licence for processing or cultivation, in writing, without delay.
A holder of a licence for processing or cultivation that is notified under subsection (2) must not send or deliver the cannabis products that they had been asked to send or deliver.
In this Subdivision, production site means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a registered person, the site, if any, for the production of cannabis plants that is specified in their registration certificate under paragraph 313(2)(k); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a designated person, the site for the production of cannabis plants that is specified in the document that the person receives under subsection 313(3).

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the quantities of cannabis that a registered person is authorized to obtain by cultivation, propagation and harvesting, or to send, deliver, transport or possess, by virtue of a registration under this Division are in addition to any other quantities that they are permitted to obtain by cultivation, propagation and harvesting, or to send, deliver, transport or possess, under the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantities of cannabis that a designated person is authorized to obtain by cultivation, propagation and harvesting, or to send, deliver, transport, sell or possess, by virtue of a registration under this Division are in addition to any other quantities that they are permitted to obtain by cultivation, propagation and harvesting, or to send, deliver, transport, sell or possess, under the Act.

Subsection.Text: A registered person who is registered to produce cannabis for their own medical purposes is, in accordance with the registration and the provisions of this Division, authorized to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: obtain by cultivation, propagation and harvesting at the production site a quantity of cannabis plants that does not exceed the maximum number of plants that is specified in the registration certificate under paragraph 313(2)(m);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the production site is different from the place where the registered person ordinarily resides,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subsection 326(2), transport directly from the place of residence to the production site a total quantity of cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds that, taking into account the seed-to-plant ratio specified in subsection 290(2), does not exceed the equivalent of the maximum number of plants that is specified in the registration certificate under paragraph 313(2)(m), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: transport cannabis, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, directly from the production site to the place of residence; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the registration has been renewed or amended and, as a result, the location of the production site or the place of residence of the registered person is changed, transport cannabis directly from the former production site or place of residence to the new production site or place of residence within any period that the Minister may specify under subsection 316(2).

Subsection.Text: A registered person referred to in subsection (1) is authorized to possess the cannabis that they are authorized to obtain by cultivation, propagation and harvesting or to transport under that subsection.
A designated person is, in accordance with the registration and the provisions of this Division, authorized to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: obtain by cultivation, propagation and harvesting at the production site a quantity of cannabis plants that does not exceed the maximum number of plants that is specified in the document that the designated person receives under subsection 313(3);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the production site is different from the place where the designated person ordinarily resides,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subsection 326(2), transport directly from the place of residence to the production site a total quantity of cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds that, taking into account the seed-to-plant ratio specified in subsection 290(2), does not exceed the equivalent of the maximum number of plants that is specified in the document that the designated person receives under subsection 313(3), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: transport cannabis, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, directly from the production site to the place of residence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: send, deliver, transport or sell to the registered person — or an adult who is named in the document that the designated person receives under subsection 313(3) — a quantity of cannabis, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, that does not exceed the equivalent of the maximum quantity of dried cannabis that is specified in the document; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the registration has been renewed or amended and, as a result, the location of the production site or the place of residence of the designated person is changed, transport cannabis directly from the former production site or place of residence to the new production site or place of residence within any period that the Minister may specify under subsection 316(2).

Subsection.Text: A designated person who sends or has cannabis delivered under paragraph (1)(c) must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prepare the parcel in a manner that ensures the security of its contents, such that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it will not open or permit the escape of its contents during handling or transportation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it is sealed so that it cannot be opened without the seal being broken,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: it prevents the escape of odours associated with cannabis plant material, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: it prevents the contents from being identified without it being opened; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: use a method that ensures the tracking and safekeeping of the parcel during transportation.

Subsection.Text: A designated person is authorized to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: possess the cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds that they are authorized to obtain by cultivation, propagation and harvesting or to transport under paragraph (1)(a), (b) or (d); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: possess in a public place the cannabis, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, that they are authorized to send, deliver, transport or sell under paragraphs (1)(b) to (d).

Section.Text: If a designated person is specified in a registration certificate, the registered person may, if they are an adult, participate in the activities that the designated person is authorized to conduct under subsection 322(1).

An individual who ceases to be a designated person may, within seven days after ceasing to be designated, conduct the activities referred to in paragraph 322(1)(c) in accordance with that paragraph unless the registration has expired or has been revoked.

Subsection.Text: If the production area is entirely indoors, the maximum number of cannabis plants that may be under production at a production site by virtue of a registration is determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the daily quantity of dried cannabis, expressed in grams, indicated in the medical document that forms the basis for the registration;
is 30 g, being the expected yield of dried cannabis per plant; and
is a constant equal to 1, representing the growth cycle of a cannabis plant from seeding to harvesting.

Subsection.Text: If the production area is entirely outdoors, the maximum number of cannabis plants that may be under production at a production site by virtue of a registration is determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the daily quantity of dried cannabis, expressed in grams, indicated in the medical document that forms the basis for the registration;
is 250 g, being the expected yield of dried cannabis per plant; and
is a constant equal to 1, representing the growth cycle of a cannabis plant from seeding to harvesting.

Subsection.Text: If the production area is partly indoors and partly outdoors, the maximum number of cannabis plants that may be under production at a production site by virtue of a registration is determined

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the indoor production period, by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the daily quantity of dried cannabis, expressed in grams, indicated in the medical document that forms the basis for the registration,
is 30 g, being the expected yield of dried cannabis per plant, and
is a constant equal to 1, representing the growth cycle of a cannabis plant from seeding to harvesting; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the outdoor production period, by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the daily quantity of dried cannabis, expressed in grams, indicated in the medical document that forms the basis for the registration,
is 250 g, being the expected yield of dried cannabis per plant, and
is a constant equal to 1, representing the growth cycle of a cannabis plant from seeding to harvesting.

Subsection.Text: If the maximum number of cannabis plants determined under this section is not a whole number, it is to be rounded to the next highest whole number.
An individual who is authorized to produce cannabis plants under this Division must not cultivate, propagate or harvest them

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: indoors and outdoors at the same time; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: outdoors if the production site is adjacent to a school, public playground, daycare facility or other public place frequented mainly by young persons.

Subsection.Text: If the production site of an individual who is authorized to produce cannabis plants under this Division is different from the place where the individual ordinarily resides, the individual must not transport to the production site cannabis plants that were ordered in accordance with section 289 if it has been more than seven days after the individual received the plants at their place of residence.

A registered person who is authorized to produce cannabis, or for whom cannabis may be produced by a designated person, under this Division — or, if applicable, any adult who is named in the registration certificate of the registered person — must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take reasonable steps to ensure the security of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the cannabis in their possession that was produced under this Division, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration certificate, if they possess it;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: report the theft or loss of anything referred to in paragraph (a) to a police force within 24 hours after becoming aware of the theft or loss; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: report the theft or loss of anything referred to in paragraph (a) to the Minister, in writing, within 72 hours after becoming aware of the theft or loss and include confirmation that the requirement set out in paragraph (b) has been complied with.

Subsection.Text: The requirements set out in subsection (1) also apply to a designated person in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cannabis in their possession that they produced under this Division; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the document referred to in subsection 313(3).

Subsection.Text: At any time after receiving a medical document that forms the basis for an application under this Division, the Minister may disclose, in respect of the health care practitioner who is named in the medical document, the following information to the provincial professional licensing authority for the province identified in the medical document under paragraph 273(1)(b):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the given name, surname and business address of the health care practitioner, together with the number assigned by the province to the health care practitioner’s authorization to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the daily quantity of dried cannabis that is specified in the medical document; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the province that is specified in the application under paragraph 312(2)(b).

Subsection.Text: At any time after registering an individual under this Division, the Minister may disclose, in respect of the health care practitioner who is named in the medical document that forms the basis for the registration, the following information to the provincial professional licensing authority for the province identified in the document under paragraph 273(1)(b):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the given name, surname and date of birth of the individual who is or was registered with the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the postal code for the address of the place indicated in the medical document as the place where the individual ordinarily resides;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the period of use that is specified in the medical document; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the medical document was signed by the health care practitioner.

Subsection.Text: In this section, health care practitioner means an individual who is, or was, a medical practitioner or nurse practitioner.

Section.Text: The Minister may disclose any of the following information to a Canadian police force, or a member of a Canadian police force, that requests the information in the course of an investigation under the Act, on condition that the information is used only for the purposes of the investigation or the administration and enforcement of the Act or these Regulations:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a named individual, whether the individual is a registered person, a designated person or an adult who is named in a registration certificate under paragraph 313(2)(c);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a specified address, whether the address is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the place where a registered person or designated person ordinarily resides and, if so, the name of that person and the registration number, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the site where the production of cannabis plants is authorized under a registration and, if so, the registration number, the name of the individual who is authorized to produce and, if that individual is a designated person and the registered person is an adult, the name of the registered person; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a registration,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the given name, surname and date of birth of the registered person and, if applicable, the designated person and any adult who is named in the registration certificate under paragraph 313(2)(c),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the full address of the place where the registered person and, if applicable, the designated person ordinarily reside,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration number,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the maximum quantity of dried cannabis that the registered person is authorized to possess, as indicated in the registration certificate,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the effective date and date of expiry of the registration,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: if the registration remains valid by virtue of subsection 314(2), the status of the renewal application,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the full address of the site where the production of cannabis plants is authorized,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the authorized production area is indoors, outdoors or partly indoors and partly outdoors, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: the maximum number of cannabis plants that may be produced at the production site and, if applicable, the maximum number of cannabis plants that may be produced for each indoor and outdoor production period.

Section.Text: A health care practitioner must, in respect of cannabis products that they possess for the practice of their profession,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take reasonable steps to protect them from theft or loss; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: report any theft or loss to the Minister within 10 days after becoming aware of the theft or loss.

Subsection.Text: A health care practitioner must, if they accept cannabis products that are returned under subsection 292(3), retain a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the individual who is returning the cannabis products;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the location at which the cannabis products are received;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which they are received;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis that is received; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the cannabis products, including their brand names.

Subsection.Text: The health care practitioner is not required to include the information referred to in paragraphs (1)(d) and (e) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they are unable to ascertain the information without unsealing a parcel that meets the requirements of paragraph 292(4)(a) and the parcel is subsequently sent or delivered to the holder of the licence that originally sold or distributed the cannabis products to or for the client; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a cannabis accessory that contains cannabis, they are unable to ascertain the information.

Subsection.Text: The document must be retained for at least two years after the day on which it is prepared.

Section.Text: If an individual ceases to be a health care practitioner, they must, in respect of any document that they were required to retain under this Part and for which the retention period has not yet ended,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the document continues to be retained until the end of the retention period; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: notify the Minister, in writing, of the address of the place of business at which the document is retained and of any subsequent change to the address.

Section.Text: The Minister must disclose, in writing, factual information about a health care practitioner — in relation to cannabis — that has been obtained under the Act or the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the provincial professional licensing authority for a province in which the health care practitioner is, or was, entitled to practise if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the licensing authority submits to the Minister a written request that sets out the health care practitioner’s name and address, a description of the information being requested and a statement that the information is required for the purpose of assisting an investigation by the authority,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the health care practitioner has contravened, in relation to cannabis, a rule of conduct established by the licensing authority,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister becomes aware that the health care practitioner has been convicted of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: a designated offence,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a controlled substance offence in relation to cannabis,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: a contravention of the former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations or the former Marihuana for Medical Purposes Regulations, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: a contravention of the Narcotic Control Regulations in relation to cannabis, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the health care practitioner has contravened this Part or the former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations, the former Marihuana for Medical Purposes Regulations or — in relation to cannabis — the Narcotic Control Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the provincial professional licensing authority for a province in which the health care practitioner is not entitled to practise if the licensing authority submits to the Minister

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a written request that sets out the health care practitioner’s name and address and a description of the information being requested, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a document that shows that

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the health care practitioner has applied to the licensing authority to practise in that province, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the licensing authority has reasonable grounds to believe that the health care practitioner is practising in that province without being authorized to do so.

Section.Text: In sections 335 to 337, health care practitioner means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who is entitled under the laws of a province to practise medicine in that province; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who meets the requirements of paragraph (a) of the definition nurse practitioner in subsection 264(1).

Subsection.Text: The Minister must, in the circumstances set out in subsection (2), issue a notice to the persons and pharmacies specified in subsection (3) advising them, as applicable, that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holders of a licence for sale and the holders of a licence for processing that receive the notice must not send cannabis products to the health care practitioner who is named in the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any medical document that is signed by the health care practitioner who is named in the notice must not form the basis for registering a client if the medical document is signed after the day on which the notice is issued; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies must not distribute or sell cannabis products on the basis of a medical document signed by, or a written order issued by, the health care practitioner who is named in the notice if the medical document is signed, or the written order is issued, after the day on which the notice is issued.

Subsection.Text: The notice must be issued if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the health care practitioner who is named in the notice has asked the Minister, in writing, to issue it;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the health care practitioner who is named in the notice has contravened, in relation to cannabis, a rule of conduct established by the provincial professional licensing authority for the province in which the health care practitioner is practising and the licensing authority has asked the Minister, in writing, to issue the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the health care practitioner who is named in the notice has been convicted of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated offence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a contravention of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a controlled substance offence in relation to cannabis,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a contravention of the former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations or the former Marihuana for Medical Purposes Regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a contravention of the Narcotic Control Regulations in relation to cannabis; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the health care practitioner who is named in the notice has been named in a notice issued under subsection 189(2) or (4).

Subsection.Text: A notice that is issued under this section must be issued to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the health care practitioner who is named in the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all holders of a licence for sale and holders of a licence for processing;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: all hospital pharmacies in the province in which the health care practitioner who is named in the notice is entitled to practise and is practising;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the provincial professional licensing authority for the province in which the health care practitioner who is named in the notice is entitled to practise; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: on request, the provincial professional licensing authority for any province other than the province referred to in paragraph (d).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may issue a notice referred to in subsection (1) if he or she has reasonable grounds to believe that the health care practitioner who is named in the notice

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has conducted an activity referred to in section 272 other than in accordance with that section;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has provided a medical document, or issued a written order, that contains false or misleading information;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, provided themselves with a medical document or issued a written order for themselves, contrary to accepted medical practice;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, conducted an activity referred to in section 272 in respect of their spouse, common-law partner, parent or child, including a child adopted in fact, contrary to accepted medical practice; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: is unable to account for a quantity of cannabis for which they were responsible under this Part, the Narcotic Control Regulations or the former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before issuing a notice under subsection (4), the Minister must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: consult with the provincial professional licensing authority for the province in which the health care practitioner to whom the notice relates is entitled to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: send to the health care practitioner a written notice that sets out the reasons why a notice is being considered and give him or her an opportunity to present reasons why the notice should not be issued; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: consider

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any reasons that have been presented by the health care practitioner under paragraph (b),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the compliance history of the health care practitioner in respect of the Act, the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act and the regulations made or continued under either Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the actions of the health care practitioner pose a significant risk to public health or public safety, including the risk of cannabis being diverted to an illicit market or activity.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must retract a notice that was issued under section 335 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the health care practitioner who is named in the notice has requested in writing that it be retracted;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the health care practitioner has provided a letter from the provincial professional licensing authority for the province in which the health care practitioner is entitled to practise that states that the authority consents to the retraction of the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the notice was issued at the request of the health care practitioner, one year has elapsed since the notice was issued; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the notice was issued in the circumstance referred to in paragraph 335(2)(d), the notice that was issued under subsection 189(2) or (4) has been retracted under subsection 190(1).

Subsection.Text: If the Minister retracts a notice issued under section 335, he or she must notify, in writing, the persons and pharmacies to which it was issued.

A pharmacist who is practising in a pharmacy that has received a notice issued under section 335 must not distribute or sell cannabis products on the basis of a medical document signed, or a written order issued, by the health care practitioner who is named in the notice unless the medical document is signed, or the written order is issued, before the day on which the notice is issued.
A pharmacist who is practising in a pharmacy that has received a notice issued under section 344 must not distribute or sell cannabis products to the pharmacist who is named in the notice.
The prohibitions referred to in subsections (1) and (2) cease to apply if the notice is retracted.

Section.Text: A pharmacist must not use an order — including a written order — to dispense a cannabis product if the quantity of cannabis that would be dispensed, when added to the quantity of cannabis that has already been dispensed under the order, would exceed the quantity of cannabis specified in the order.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 337, a pharmacist who is practising in a hospital may, if authorized by the individual in charge of the hospital,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: distribute, sell or return, in accordance with paragraph 348(2)(b) or subsection 348(4) or (7), cannabis products, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, that have been received from a holder of a licence for sale or a holder of a licence for processing; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: distribute — but not send — or sell cannabis products, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, to an employee of the hospital or a health care practitioner practising in the hospital, on receipt of an order, in writing, that has been signed and dated by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the pharmacist in charge of the hospital’s pharmacy, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a health care practitioner who is authorized by the individual in charge of the hospital to sign the order.

Subsection.Text: Before distributing or selling cannabis products under paragraph (1)(b), the pharmacist receiving the order must verify the signature on the order, if it is unknown to them.
A pharmacist must not conduct the activities referred to in subsection (1) if the pharmacist has been named in a notice that has been issued under section 344 and that has not been retracted.
In this section, distribute does not include administering.
A pharmacist who receives cannabis products from a person must retain a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis that is received;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the cannabis products, including their brand names;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the cannabis products are received; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and mailing address of the person from which the cannabis products are received.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist who distributes or sells cannabis products on the basis of a medical document or written order must retain a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist’s name or initials;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, initials and address of the health care practitioner who provided the medical document or issued the written order;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and mailing address of the individual for whom the cannabis products are distributed or sold;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis that is distributed or sold;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the cannabis products, including their brand names;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the cannabis products are distributed or sold; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the number that the pharmacist has assigned to the medical document or written order.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist who distributes or sells cannabis products for emergency purposes on the basis of an order made in accordance with subsection 348(4) must retain a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the pharmacist or health care practitioner who signed the order;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the individual to whom the cannabis products are distributed or sold;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis that is distributed or sold;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the cannabis products, including their brand names; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the cannabis products are distributed or sold.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist who returns cannabis products must retain a document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the person to which the cannabis products are returned;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis that is returned;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the cannabis products, including their brand names; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the cannabis products are returned.

Subsection.Text: The documents must be retained for at least two years after the day on which they are prepared.

Section.Text: If an individual ceases to be a pharmacist, they must, in respect of any document that they were required to retain under this Part and for which the retention period has not yet ended,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the document continues to be retained until the end of the retention period; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: notify the Minister, in writing, of the address of the place of business at which the document is retained and of any subsequent change to the address.

Section.Text: The pharmacist in charge of a hospital’s pharmacy must, in respect of cannabis products that are on the pharmacy premises or for which the pharmacist is responsible,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take reasonable steps to protect them from theft or loss; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: report any theft or loss to the Minister within 10 days after becoming aware of the theft or loss.

Section.Text: The Minister must disclose, in writing, factual information about a pharmacist — in relation to cannabis — that has been obtained under the Act or the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the provincial professional licensing authority for a province in which the pharmacist is, or was, entitled to practise if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the licensing authority submits to the Minister a written request that sets out the pharmacist’s name and address, a description of the information being requested and a statement that the information is required for the purpose of assisting an investigation by the authority,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the pharmacist has contravened, in relation to cannabis, a rule of conduct established by the licensing authority,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister becomes aware that the pharmacist has been convicted of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: a designated offence,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a controlled substance offence in relation to cannabis,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: a contravention of the former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: a contravention of the Narcotic Control Regulations in relation to cannabis, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the pharmacist has contravened these Regulations, the former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations or — in relation to cannabis — the Narcotic Control Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the provincial professional licensing authority for a province in which the pharmacist is not entitled to practise if the licensing authority submits to the Minister

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a written request that sets out the pharmacist’s name and address and a description of the information being requested, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a document that shows that

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the pharmacist has applied to the licensing authority to practise in that province, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the licensing authority has reasonable grounds to believe that the pharmacist is practising in that province without being authorized to do so.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must, in the circumstances set out in subsection (2), issue a notice to the following persons and pharmacies advising them that holders of a licence for sale, holders of a licence for processing and pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies must not distribute or sell cannabis products to the pharmacist who is named in the notice:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist who is named in the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all holders of a licence for sale and all holders of a licence for processing;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: all hospital pharmacies in the province in which the pharmacist who is named in the notice is entitled to practise and is practising;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the provincial professional licensing authority for the province in which the pharmacist who is named in the notice is entitled to practise; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: on request, the provincial professional licensing authority for any province other than the province referred to in paragraph (d).

Subsection.Text: The notice must be issued if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist who is named in the notice asks the Minister, in writing, to issue the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist who is named in the notice has contravened, in relation to cannabis, a rule of conduct established by the provincial professional licensing authority for the province in which the pharmacist is practising and the licensing authority has asked the Minister, in writing, to issue the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist who is named in the notice has been convicted of an offence referred to in subparagraph 343(a)(iii); or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist who is named in the notice has been named in a notice issued under subsection 181(2) or (4).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may issue a notice referred to in subsection (1) if he or she has reasonable grounds to believe that the pharmacist who is named in the notice

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has conducted an activity referred to in section 339 other than in accordance with that section;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, distributed or sold a cannabis product to their spouse, common-law partner, parent or child, including a child adopted in fact, contrary to accepted pharmaceutical practice; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is unable to account for a quantity of cannabis products for which they were responsible under this Part, the Narcotic Control Regulations or the former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before issuing a notice under subsection (3), the Minister must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: consult with the provincial professional licensing authority for the province in which the pharmacist to whom the notice relates is entitled to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: send to the pharmacist a written notice that sets out the reasons why a notice is being considered and give him or her an opportunity to present reasons why the notice should not be issued; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: consider

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any reasons that have been presented by the pharmacist under paragraph (b),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the compliance history of the pharmacist in respect of the Act, the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act and the regulations made or continued under either Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the actions of the pharmacist pose a significant risk to public health or public safety, including the risk of cannabis being diverted to an illicit market or activity.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must retract a notice that was issued under section 344 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist who is named in the notice has requested in writing that it be retracted;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist has provided a letter from the provincial professional licensing authority for the province in which the pharmacist is entitled to practise that states that the authority consents to the retraction of the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the notice was issued at the request of the pharmacist, one year has elapsed since the notice was issued; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the notice was issued in the circumstance referred to in paragraph 344(2)(d), the notice that was issued under subsection 181(2) or (4) has been retracted under subsection 182(1).

Subsection.Text: If the Minister retracts a notice issued under section 344, he or she must notify, in writing, the persons and pharmacies to which it was issued.

Section.Text: In sections 347, 348, 350 and 351, distribute does not include administering.
An individual in charge of a hospital must, in respect of cannabis products that they permit to be administered, distributed or sold,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take reasonable steps to protect them from theft or loss; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: report any theft or loss to the Minister within 10 days after becoming aware of the theft or loss.

Subsection.Text: An individual in charge of a hospital must not permit cannabis products to be administered, distributed or sold, except in accordance with this section.

An individual in charge of a hospital may permit cannabis products, other than cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds, received from a holder of a licence for sale or a holder of a licence for processing to be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: administered, on receipt of a medical document or written order, to an inpatient or outpatient of the hospital; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: distributed — but not sent — or sold, on receipt of a medical document or written order, to an individual referred to in paragraph (a) or an adult who is responsible for them.

Subsection.Text: An individual in charge of a hospital must, if they permit cannabis products to be distributed or sold under paragraph (2)(b), ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis that is distributed or sold does not exceed the equivalent of the lesser of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 30 times the daily quantity of dried cannabis that is specified in the medical document or written order, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 150 g of dried cannabis;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the cannabis products are distributed or sold in the container in which they were received from the holder of the licence for sale or the holder of the licence for processing;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a label is applied to the container in which the cannabis products were received indicating

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the given name, surname and profession of the health care practitioner who signed the medical document or written order,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the given name and surname of the patient,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the daily quantity of dried cannabis that is specified in the medical document or written order, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the cannabis products are distributed or sold;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the patient or responsible adult is provided with the current version of the document entitled Consumer Information — Cannabis, published by the Government of Canada on its website; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the patient or responsible adult is provided with a separate document containing the information referred to in paragraph (c).

Subsection.Text: An individual in charge of a hospital may permit cannabis products, other than cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds, received from a holder of a licence for sale or a holder of a licence for processing to be distributed or sold for emergency purposes to an employee of or a health care practitioner in another hospital on receipt of an order, in writing, that has been signed and dated by a pharmacist in the other hospital or a health care practitioner who is authorized by the individual in charge of the other hospital to order cannabis products.

An individual in charge of a hospital must not permit cannabis products to be distributed or sold under subsection (4) unless the signature on the order has been verified by the individual who distributes or sells the cannabis products, if it is unknown to them.

An individual in charge of a hospital may permit cannabis products, other than cannabis plants and cannabis plant seeds, to be distributed for research purposes to an individual who is employed in a research laboratory in the hospital and who holds a licence for those purposes.
An individual in charge of a hospital may permit cannabis products to be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: returned to the holder of the licence for sale or the holder of the licence for processing from which the cannabis products were received, on receipt of a written request for the cannabis products that has been signed and dated by, or on behalf of, the holder; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: distributed or sold, for destruction, to a holder of a licence for sale, or a holder of a licence for processing, that is authorized to destroy cannabis that they did not produce, sell or distribute, on receipt of a written request for the cannabis products that has been signed and dated by, or on behalf of, the holder.

Section.Text: A hospital employee is authorized to possess cannabis products, other than cannabis plants or cannabis plant seeds, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the cannabis products have been obtained in accordance with section 348 or 350; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the employee requires the cannabis products for the purposes of, and in connection with, their employment.

Subsection.Text: An individual to whom cannabis products are distributed or sold under paragraph 348(2)(b) may return them to a hospital employee who is authorized to distribute or sell cannabis products if the employee accepts the return.

The individual returning the cannabis products must comply with the requirements set out in subsection 292(4) if they are returning more than the equivalent of 30 g of dried cannabis and are sending the cannabis products or having them delivered to the hospital.
The individual in charge of the hospital may, subject to the limit referred to in paragraph 348(3)(a), permit cannabis products that have been returned to be replaced.
An individual who is in charge of a hospital must ensure that documents that contain the following information are retained:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of cannabis products that are received at the hospital,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the class of cannabis set out in Schedule 4 to the Act to which the cannabis products belong and their brand names,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis that is received,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person from which the cannabis products are received, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the cannabis products are received;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of cannabis products that are distributed or sold for a patient,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the given name and surname of the patient,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the given name, surname and profession of the health care practitioner who signed the relevant medical document or written order, together with the date on which it was signed,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the daily quantity of dried cannabis that is specified in the medical document or written order referred to in subparagraph (ii) and, if applicable, the period of use that is specified,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the class of cannabis set out in Schedule 4 to the Act to which the cannabis products belong,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis that is distributed or sold, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the cannabis products are distributed or sold; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of cannabis products that are distributed or sold to a person that is authorized to sell or distribute such products — other than an adult referred to in paragraph 266(1)(d) or (e) — or that are returned under subsection 348(7),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the person to which the cannabis products are distributed, sold or returned,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the cannabis products are distributed, sold or returned,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of cannabis that is distributed, sold or returned,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand names of the cannabis products, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of cannabis products that are distributed, sold or returned under subsection 348(7), the address of the person to which they are distributed, sold or returned.

Subsection.Text: The individual in charge of the hospital must ensure that the documents are retained for at least two years after the day on which they are prepared.

Section.Text: If a hospital ceases operations, the individual who was in charge of the hospital must, in respect of any document that they were required to retain under this Part and for which the retention period has not yet ended,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the document continues to be retained until the end of the retention period; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: notify the Minister, in writing, of the address of the place of business at which the document is retained and of any subsequent change to the address.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must disclose, in writing, factual information about a nurse — in relation to cannabis — that has been obtained under the Act or the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the nursing statutory body for a province in which the nurse is, or was, entitled to practise if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the nursing statutory body submits to the Minister a written request that sets out the nurse’s name and address, a description of the information being requested and a statement that the information is required for the purpose of assisting an investigation by the body,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the nurse has contravened, in relation to cannabis, a rule of conduct established by the nursing statutory body,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister becomes aware that the nurse has been convicted of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: a designated offence,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a controlled substance offence in relation to cannabis,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: a contravention of the former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations or the former Marihuana for Medical Purposes Regulations, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: a contravention of the Narcotic Control Regulations in relation to cannabis, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the nurse has contravened this Part, the former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations, the former Marihuana for Medical Purposes Regulationsor — in relation to cannabis — the Narcotic Control Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the nursing statutory body for a province in which the nurse is not entitled to practise if the nursing statutory body submits to the Minister

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a written request that sets out the nurse’s name and address and a description of the information being requested, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a document that shows that

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the nurse has applied to the nursing statutory body to practise in that province, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the nursing statutory body has reasonable grounds to believe that the nurse is practising in that province without being authorized to do so.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: nurse means an individual — other than a nurse practitioner — who is authorized by a nursing statutory body to practise nursing. (infirmier)
nursing statutory body means the authority that is responsible for authorizing individuals to practise nursing in a province. (organisme régissant la profession d’infirmier)

Section.MarginalNote: Licences — former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations
Section.Text: A licence issued under the former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations, as set out in column 1 of the table to this section, is deemed to be a licence of the class set out in column 2, and one of the licences of the subclass set out in column 3 if the holder of the licence meets the requirements, if any, in that column for that subclass.

row.entry: Licence issued under section 35 of the former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations
Licence authorizing the production of fresh or dried marihuana, or marihuana plants or seeds
Licence for standard cultivation if the requirements in Division 1 of Part 4 are met
Licence for micro-cultivation if the requirements in sections 13 and 74 are met
Licence for a nursery if the requirements in sections 16 and 74 are met
Licence authorizing the production of cannabis oil or cannabis resin
Licence for standard processing if the requirements in Division 1 of Part 4 are met
Licence for micro-processing if the requirements in sections 21 and 74 are met
Licence authorizing the activities referred to in subsection 22(4) or (5) of the former Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations
Licence for sale for medical purposes

Subsection.Text: A licence issued under the Narcotic Control Regulations as they read immediately before the day on which these Regulations come into force, as set out in column 1 of the table to this section, is deemed to be a licence of the class set out in column 2 and, if applicable, one of the licences of the subclass set out in column 3 if the holder of the licence meets the requirements in that column and, despite subsections 159(1) and (4) of the Act, continues in force until December 31, 2019, unless it is revoked before that date.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Licences not set out in table
